Description:
Overview:

Baker Tilly US, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a leading advisory, tax and assurance firm, providing clients a genuine coast-to-coast and global advantage with critical mass and top-notch talent in major regions of the U.S. and in many of the world’s leading financial centers – New York, London, San Francisco, Los Angeles and Chicago. Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 148 territories, with 36,000 professionals and a combined worldwide revenue of $4.0 billion.
Many of Baker Tilly’s roles have the opportunity to work remotely. Please discuss with your talent acquisition professional to understand the requirements for an opportunity you are exploring.
Baker Tilly is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable federal, state or local law.
Responsibilities:

The Junior Database Administrator is responsible for implementation, maintenance, testing and support of firm-wide databases and applications, primarily related to Baker Tilly Time and Billing System (STAR). This includes analyzing, developing and managing requests for modifications and enhancements to the database structure for these applications. Also responsible for supporting the application development team with database changes, queries, and reports, as well as working with the Technical Services Team on maintenance updates to the database servers.
Primary Duties and Responsibilites:
Responsible for the infrastructure and architecture for all database systems and related subsystems. This includes the definition of backup strategies and maintenance plans, patch management procedures and disaster recovery procedures and processes. In addition, this role is responsible for system performance maintenance and data integrity.
Responsible for the development of enhancements and modifications to the database systems used by the firm. This includes the development of custom level queries, SSIS packages, reports and actual system development work as needed, including enhancement estimates.
Assist in Reporting team initiatives through identifying end user requirements, development, testing and support of reports, data warehouses and data analysis.
Provide firm-wide support for all custom-built applications. Additionally, provide second level support for STAR. Fill in as primary support person as needed.
Assist other Baker Tilly IT personnel with problem resolution as needed. This can include firm-wide issues, as well as region specific problems.
Conduct briefings and demonstrations for users to enhance systems productivity. May be called upon to assist in the development of training coursework and materials as well as performing the actual training.
Maintain technical knowledge by attending technical education, attending workshops, reading publications and pursuing technical certifications.
Maintain and comply with quality service by following organization’s technological standards. Document procedures
Research new technologies and applications that can improve the quality, performance or functionality of database applications used firm-wide.
All other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelors degree required.
1 to 3 years of related work experience required.
Bachelor’s degree in related field.
SQL Server Administration.
SQL programming/SQL Database.
SQL Server Reporting Services.
SQL Server Analysis Services.
Experience in .NET programming (ASP.NET, VB.NET, C#).
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services.

Job Title: Cloud Database Architect

Location: Orlando, FL
Duration: 12 + months

Is remote option available during COVID: Yes

Job Description:

Reference Architectures for large database footprints using automation to build consistent images and processes for DBAs. (Maria/MySQl/Aurora)

7+ years' experience in Python development and should have excellent database administration concept.
Excellent knowledge of Python coding.
Select the appropriate AWS service based on compute, data, or security requirements.
Experience with Version Control System like GitHub.
Experience with Chef configuration management and migrations.

Deploy, manage, and operate scalable, highly available, and fault-tolerant Database on AWS
Investigate, troubleshoot, and resolve Database products.

We are seeking a Senior SQL Server Database Administrator responsible for managing multiple databases supporting complex enterprise applications in production and non-production environments. Further this position is responsible for providing database schema architectural vision and design, driving efficiency efforts and operational improvements of performance, integrity and security of critical database implementations to meet business needs.
ResponsibilitiesImplement conceptual design to physical database implementation, enhance and refine the logical design of the database.Work closely with Infrastructure Technology database management team and application development teams to ensure database operational continuity, availability, integrity, recovery, and security.Develop and maintain policies and procedures for ensuring secure access to production system information.Monitor databases for optimal performance and acts to mitigate blocking and performance tuning issues.Provide guidance to Application Development staff for query, stored procedures, functions and database design.Analyze large, complex systems to determine performance bottlenecks, application bugs, and opportunities to improve efficiency.Baseline system performance and monitor for deviation, recommending and implementing improvements to slow running queries.Document database architecture, configuration settings, baseline performance metrics and planned and unplanned outages. Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, a related field, or equivalent database administration experience10+ years of proven track record in database administration including mastery of Microsoft SQL Server, SQL, ETL processes and tools, stored procedures and functions.Advanced skills in managing MS SQL Server instances used with SSIS, SSAS and SSRS.Proven experience in logical database design, query and index tuning, relational database security design concepts, reporting systems, and data modeling.Act as a reference point for others on database schema design, SQL coding and related tools.Effective verbal and written communication skills to recommend technical processes, explain technical procedures, and negotiate resolution of work issues.Proven ability to work independently to coordinate and solve moderately complex technical data management issues.Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.
6 Month Contract Position (No Perdiem)
Projected Start Date: 12/06/21
***Must be On Site for work*** (No Remote)

SOFIA, BG | TEL AVIV, IL | KYIV, UA | PLOVDIV, BG
ENGINEERING
21.F1A
FULL TIME
BUILDING THE POSSIBILITIES.

DraftKings is growing quickly and we’re looking for a Senior DBA centered around the mission of providing a best-in-class experience for our products and customers. This position requires strong technical skills and a bias toward collaboration. You will be working across teams, informing business decisions, and helping to expand our software platform.
WHAT YOU'LL DO AS A SENIOR DBA:
Maintaining, monitoring, and securing the organization's production and non-production of PostgreSQL / MS SQL / MongoDB databases, in high-volume/multi-instance environments, utilizing state of the art concepts and employing leading-edge maintenance techniques to maximize application availability.
Actively monitor the health, performance, and integrity of all databases and proactively take corrective actions as necessary.
Defining and implementing an effective database backup strategy.
Defining and implementing an effective data retention strategy.
Participating in the assessment and implementation of all database-related tools or other 3rd-party products and in the migration and testing required to move to more recent versions of PostgreSQL / MS SQL / MongoDB as they are released.
Providing on-call support for production environments on a shared DBA rotation.
Providing 24/7 support for various activities including Database maintenance, Application Releases, Application Database upgrades, DBMS upgrades, and Disaster Recovery.

WHAT YOU’LL BRING:
Good knowledge and experience of PostgreSQL infrastructure and capabilities
Good knowledge and experience of MongoDB infrastructure topology is an advantage
Good knowledge in MS SQL 2016 and related product technologies AlwaysON/HA, Replication, Log shipping, etc. is an advantage.
Experience in troubleshooting and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, blocking and deadlocking issues, connectivity issues, security issues, etc.
Knowledge of indexes, index management, and statistics.
Experience in Performance Tuning, Query Optimization, and other related monitoring and troubleshooting tools.
Analytical ability, strong judgment, and the ability to work effectively with IT, management, and staff.
Ability to effectively communicate with users in written or verbal form.
General knowledge in the following areas: IT concepts, strategies, and methodologies, architectures and technical standards, database administration tools and utilities, backup and recovery, storage subsystems, and replication concepts.
Code writing skills in one or more of the following languages: tsql, python, ansible, Powershell.

#LI-IA1

WHO ARE WE A GOOD FIT FOR?
We love working with talented people but more than that, we seek out compassionate co-workers with a collaborative spirit. Our work moves quickly and we’re great at coming together to find creative solutions to some of tech’s most interesting problems. If that sounds good to you, join us.

WE ARE DRAFTKINGS.

We’re inspired by our shared passion for developing creative solutions to complex challenges and empowering the people around us to do their best work. We are industry leaders in the digital entertainment and technology space propelled by constant curiosity and diverse perspectives.

Our teams are fueled by innovation. We are looking ahead, building what’s next, and continuously reinventing the industry. We’re a publicly traded (NASDAQ: DKNG) technology company headquartered in Boston, with teams around the world and an expanding global presence.

JOIN US!

We strive to create a place where all feel safe, empowered, engaged, championed, and inspired. DraftKings is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. This means we do not tolerate discrimination of any kind and are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of your gender identity, race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, or status as an individual with a disability.

READY TO BUILD WHAT’S NEXT? APPLY NOW.

As a regulated gaming company, you may be required to obtain a gaming license issued by the appropriate state agency as a condition of employment.

Job Summary:
The Sr. DBA position works on a central team of Database Systems Engineers and Administrators supporting DBMS for Disney Connected, Advanced Technologies and corporate development teams and customers. Primary focus of this position will be Database support and service of operational and business processes for internet sites and corporate applications for The Walt Disney Company. Key responsibilities include DB technology evaluation, guidance and consultation, design support, task automation and scripting, best practice and standards development, capacity planning, optimization and tuning, system upgrades and migrations, performance management, monitoring, security, backup and recovery, issue troubleshooting, and documentation. Additional tasks as assigned.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for level 1 systems management and exercises project-level control over initiatives. Excellent technical expertise in relevant state of the art database technologies, stores, systems, and design. Carries out assignments with minimal coaching and guidance from others. Develops, enhances and adheres to engineering and administration standards. Upholds and maintains strong documentation.

The ideal candidate will have experience with Pubic Cloud providers like AWS and Azure and 4-6 years experience with DB2. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience is a plus.

Basic Qualifications:
4-6 years experience with DB2 is strongly preferred. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience, or similar relational database systems, is a plus.
4-6 years’ experience with Linux Server platforms and/or Windows Server
4-6 years’ experience with relevant scripting languages or programming frameworks desired (NodeJS, JavaScript, Python, Perl, C, windows script; PowerShell, sh, korne, bash)
Expertise in relational database administration including configuration, implementation, data modeling, maintenance, redundancy/HA/DR, security, troubleshooting/performance tuning, upgrades, database, data and server migrations, SQL
2 or more years of IT operational experience supporting robust e-commerce, gaming or online businesses in a 24X7 production environment (on call)
Thorough understanding in Security implementations (IAM, SSL, encryption, firewall, wall garden) on Database, storage, network and Cloud environments. Participated in auditing exercise
Knowledge in 1 or more Cloud Platforms including but not limited to: AWS, Azure, GCP, Oracle Cloud and hybrid cloud environments
Knowledge in Monitoring, Alerting tools such as Datadog, Cloudwatch, OEM, Quest
Expertise in configuring, implementing and supporting high availability redundancy strategies on systems including replication, clustering, log shipping, mirroring
Expertise in database design and architectural principles and methodologies
Expertise with Disaster Recovery planning and implementation
Experience with Linux system administration, configuration, troubleshooting, performance tuning, and security procedures; experience with Windows desired
Excellent knowledge of hardware, storage, RAID, and disk subsystems technologies as they pertain to DBMS systems, experience with SAN technologies highly desired
Excellent systems documentation and system diagraming skills
Experience with project management methodologies and handling complex projects
Ability to partner with relevant software vendors to determine near-term, long-term business impacts of product updates on our technology portfolio
Demonstrated experience with troubleshooting systems issues and effectively diagnosing problems
Knowledge of understanding of TCP/IP fundamentals (DNS, SSH), general networking technologies, AWS networking (VPC, security group), network architecture and connectivity troubleshooting
Preferred Qualifications:
Leads and completes tasks independently, with attention to detail and while under pressure
Excellent judgment, problem resolution, negotiation, and decision-making skills as well as the ability to work under continual deadline pressure
Identifies, analyzes, and drives problems to resolution, handling complex issues simultaneously while effectively communicating across teams
Builds team relationships across the organization
Effectively communicates technical actions and expectations to the appropriate audience
Delivers customer service excellence by knowing customer’s business needs, identifying appropriate technical solutions, and meeting/exceeding service expectations
Knowledge in 1 or more relevant areas including but not limited to: Cloud Computing, Internet Security, Hardware systems, Networking systems, Storage technologies, Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence, Data Center Facilities, Ecommerce platforms are desired
Required Education
Degree in computer science/information systems, engineering or related field required.

Preferred Education
Bachelor of Science in computer science/information systems, engineering or related field preferred.

Description:
All ManTech employees will need to meet the requirements set forth in Executive Order 14042 and the Safer Federal Workforce Task Force Guidance requiring all covered contractor personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future
Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first.Â At ManTech International Corporation , youâ€™ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.
Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer-oriented Oracle Database Administrator to join our team in Colorado Springs, CO. You will support an IT operations environment.Â You should expect to support work on weekends, and you may be included in an on-call rotation for after-hours support.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Ensuring availability and performance of the databases that support the system
Ensure that associated hardware resources are allocated to the databases and ensure high availability and optimum performance
Proactively monitor the database systems to ensure secure services with minimum downtime
Assist in providing trend analysis to the service management team to enable them to make informed decisions regarding resource management as well as provide problem escalation to the development team and third parties as appropriate.Â In addition, you are responsible for the improvement and maintenance of the databases, to include, rollouts, upgrades, implementations, and release of database changes as required.
Provide data management support across multiple applications
Provide 24/7 support of production database services to ensure the highest standards of availability, resilience, integrity, security, and performance
Performance monitoring, reporting, and tuning of Oracle databases
Management and maintenance of back-ups & recovery procedures
Installation and maintenance of database server, replication, and client environments
Reviewing and tuning SQL and PL/SQL code
Assist with designing database packages and procedures
Provision of support and assistance to development team in the design, development, testing, tuning and implementation of database applications
Assist with the creation and maintenance of SQL queries and routines
Provisioning of (database) development and testing environments
Writing ad-hoc queries based on schema knowledge for various reporting requirements
Writing / Tuning data ingestion procedures from external suppliers and partners using PL/SQL, sql loader, and third-party tools (e.g., Toad etc.)
Assist in supporting complex data models, object relational database mapping and producing complex reports
Required Qualifications:
A Professional Oracle DBA Certification
An Oracle RAC and Grid Certified Expert
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or any other related scientific or technical discipline
A minimum of ( 7) seven years of related professional experience; a degree can be substituted for an additional (11) eleven years of related experience
Working knowledge of Oracle 11g with production support experience in a multi-project environment
Working knowledge of Oracle 12c and migration from Oracle 11g
Working knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL including tuning
Working Knowledge of Oracle Recovery Manager, Import/Export (and Datapump), SQL*Loader and Oracle Enterprise Manager
Working Knowledge of High Data Availability (HAD) strategies and tools
Knowledge of Unix/Linux in a multi-domain environment including basic commands and shell scripting
Desired Qualifications:
Knowledge of XML and HTML
Knowledge of open-source web development
Security Clearance Requirements:
U.S. citizenship
Ability to obtain and maintain agency Suitability
An active DoD Secret clearance, is preferred
Physical Requirements:
The person in this position must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time. Occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, or to communicate with co-workers, management, and customers, via email, phone, and or virtual communication, which may involve delivering presentations.

Database Administrator - Remote Opportunity - ( 210006GC )
Description
About KinderCare Education ®
KinderCare Education operates more than 1,380 early learning centers, and more than 560 Champions sites, supported by a corporate team of nearly 600 headquarters employees in Portland, Oregon. In 2019, KinderCare Education earned their third Gallup Great Workplace Award – one of only 39 companies worldwide to win this award.
In neighborhoods with our KinderCare ® Learning Centers that offer early childhood education and child care for children six weeks to 12 years old
At work through KinderCare Education at Work™ , family benefits for employers including on-site and near-site early learning centers and back-up care for last-minute child care
In local schools with our Champions ® before and after-school programs.
Job Summary:
As part of our IT Operations team, you are an experienced and highly skilled SQL DBA who maintains, improves, and supports our mission critical application and reporting databases across the enterprise systems suite. These application and business intelligence DBs are integral to several rapidly growing lines of business as we undertake a roadmap of technical and digital transformation including migration to the Cloud.
Key responsibilities include:
Manage SQL Server databases supporting critical business applications across multiple application stacks
Configure and maintain database servers and processes
Monitor system's health and performance
Ensure high levels of performance, availability, sustainability, and security
Analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time
Provide suggestions for solutions to deadlocks, performance issues, index optimization, etc
Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes
Assist developers with query tuning and schema refinement
Participate in on-call rotation for critical production system support
Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours
Qualifications
Key desired skills and experience:
3 years of experience as a SQL Server DBA or similar role
3 years of experience with MY SQL Server Administration experience (required)
3 years of experience with Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO)
3 years of experience with backups, restores and recovery models
3 years of experience of High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for SQL Server
Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on company’s success
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills\
Excellent organization skills and the ability to achieve results within tight deadlines.
Positive, results driven, rational, logical, team player.
Experience working with remote teams is desirable.
MCTS, MCITP, and/or MVP certifications a plus
KinderCare Education employs more than 32,000 team members across 1,700 locations nationwide. Our devoted family of education providers leads the nation in accreditation and includes KinderCare® Learning Centers, KinderCare Education at Work®, Champions® Before- and After-School Programs, Cambridge Schools ™ , Knowledge Beginnings® and The Grove School®.
KinderCare Education is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Overview:

Baker Tilly US, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a leading advisory, tax and assurance firm, providing clients a genuine coast-to-coast and global advantage with critical mass and top-notch talent in major regions of the U.S. and in many of the world’s leading financial centers – New York, London, San Francisco, Los Angeles and Chicago. Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 148 territories, with 36,000 professionals and a combined worldwide revenue of $4.0 billion.
Many of Baker Tilly’s roles have the opportunity to work remotely. Please discuss with your talent acquisition professional to understand the requirements for an opportunity you are exploring.
Baker Tilly is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable federal, state or local law.
Responsibilities:

The Junior Database Administrator is responsible for implementation, maintenance, testing and support of firm-wide databases and applications, primarily related to Baker Tilly Time and Billing System (STAR). This includes analyzing, developing and managing requests for modifications and enhancements to the database structure for these applications. Also responsible for supporting the application development team with database changes, queries, and reports, as well as working with the Technical Services Team on maintenance updates to the database servers.
Primary Duties and Responsibilites:
Responsible for the infrastructure and architecture for all database systems and related subsystems. This includes the definition of backup strategies and maintenance plans, patch management procedures and disaster recovery procedures and processes. In addition, this role is responsible for system performance maintenance and data integrity.
Responsible for the development of enhancements and modifications to the database systems used by the firm. This includes the development of custom level queries, SSIS packages, reports and actual system development work as needed, including enhancement estimates.
Assist in Reporting team initiatives through identifying end user requirements, development, testing and support of reports, data warehouses and data analysis.
Provide firm-wide support for all custom-built applications. Additionally, provide second level support for STAR. Fill in as primary support person as needed.
Assist other Baker Tilly IT personnel with problem resolution as needed. This can include firm-wide issues, as well as region specific problems.
Conduct briefings and demonstrations for users to enhance systems productivity. May be called upon to assist in the development of training coursework and materials as well as performing the actual training.
Maintain technical knowledge by attending technical education, attending workshops, reading publications and pursuing technical certifications.
Maintain and comply with quality service by following organization’s technological standards. Document procedures
Research new technologies and applications that can improve the quality, performance or functionality of database applications used firm-wide.
All other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelors degree required.
1 to 3 years of related work experience required.
Bachelor’s degree in related field.
SQL Server Administration.
SQL programming/SQL Database.
SQL Server Reporting Services.
SQL Server Analysis Services.
Experience in .NET programming (ASP.NET, VB.NET, C#).
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services.

Oracle Utilities Cloud Database Administrator
Responsibilities:
The Oracle DBA is responsible for providing technical expertise in the analysis, design, implementation, and maintenance of an existing high-volume, data intensive system. Position requires critical thinking and problem-solving abilities to address complex issues involving performance analysis, data migration, information life cycle management, multi tenancy for applications designed for very large databases.
Candidate must be able to support large enterprise initiatives and help resolve architectural issues in the environment and database infrastructure, as well as develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of the database architecture and the application functionality.
Additional responsibilities may include database design and implementation for multiple products; supporting multiple lab environments; installing, maintaining, and refreshing Oracle database for development and test environments; analyzing performance issues and providing recommendation based on testing results; proactively diagnosing and resolving problems affecting database; maintaining database configurations in compliance with release management and change management; participates in special projects and performs additional duties as required.
The candidate will work with a cross-section of organizations, including other DBAs, systems engineers, developers and the management team. The candidate is expected to work on shifts for ensuring 24*7 availability for the SaaS solutions.
The candidate will work with a world class team to provide enterprise-wide, Oracle Database Administration support for production systems and provide DBA services to application development teams, including database design, database generation, coding, and database production support. Provide DBA support with a high degree of customer service, technical expertise, and timeliness. Provide accurate and creative solutions to user problems of moderate nature to ensure user productivity.
 REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Strong knowledge of Oracle 10g /11g/12c internals, from performance troubleshooting from SQL to ASM.
Strong Database Administration and SQL skills
Operating system knowledge (Unix, Linux and/or Windows)
Daily administration activities such as Datapump Export/Import, Database migration/cloning, RMAN, Data Guard replication, backup/restore, patching, maintenance, upgrades, storage layout and access control should be second nature
Hands on experience with OEM 13c, AWR, ASH, SQL Tuning Advisor, SQL Plan Baselines.
Extensive knowledge of high availability database concepts.
Proficient with automation of maintenance tasks using PL/SQL and scripting tools such as shell script, Perl or Python
Superior troubleshooting skills, battle-tested in high-volume production environments including Grid Control Administration
Hands on experience on RAC, Data Guard and multitenant database
Maintenance and support for VLDB databases
Schema design and access control for multi-tenancy databases.
The following technical skills are plus:
Hands on Experience with Golden Gate
Oracle Certified Professional (OCP)
Hands on experience with VPD, Data Vault, TDE, Audit Vault is a plus
Operations support as well as Cloud operation experience
Additional experience with Oracleâ€™s Exadata engineered systems is preferred
Personal Competencies:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent customer focus and issue handling skills
Strong analytical reasoning and problem solving skills
Strong focus on diagnosing and resolving complex technical problems
Strong teamwork skills and ability to work as member of a global team
Results oriented
Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Work with a world-class team to provide enterprise-wide, Oracle Database Administration support for all products using Oracle Utilities Application Framework and provide DBA services to SaaS development and production environments.
Own database architecture and design for Oracle Utilities Framework products and help resolve complex technical issues.
Provide product development support. This includes creating primary database storage structures, designing and creating primary objects, modifying database structure as necessary for enhancements or performance, creating/maintaining documentation and standards, establishing application development best practices, monitor and optimize performance of the database, plan for backup and recovery of the database, and allocate system storage and plan future storage needs.
Design /develop / maintain database upgrade procedures/tools. This comprises creating/maintaining database-related scripts and programs to upgrade database portion of the Oracle Utility products and the scripts for database support of the development environments.
Research, evaluate, design, test, recommend, and plan implementation of new or improved RDBMS, ETL and database tools.
Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. It requires 10 years of experience supporting relational databases as an Oracle DBA. Exposure and practice at using the DBMS to optimize performance of large production databases for enterprise use is preferred. Experience with an organization with a key 24 X 7 reliance on its database is desirable. Requires a bachelorâ€™s degree in computer science or equivalent field.


Work with a world class team to provide enterprise-wide, Oracle Database Administration support for production systems and provide DBA services to application development teams, including database design, database generation, coding, and database production support. Provide DBA support with a high degree of customer service, technical expertise, and timeliness. Provide accurate and creative solutions to user problems of moderate nature to ensure user productivity.


As a Senior Database Administrator, you are instrumental in researching, evaluating, designing, testing, recommending, and planning implementation of new versions of Oracle database and database tools. May act as a team lead during database implementations and for system operation and maintenance.


Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 8 years of experience supporting relational databases as a DBA, with multiple distributed relational DBSM's or a depth and focus in Oracle and related tools. Success at using the DBMS to optimize performance of large databases for enterprise use is greatly preferred. Experience with an organization with a key 24 X 7 reliance on its database is desirable. BS or equivalent desired.


If you are a Colorado resident, Please Contact us or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 129367 in the subject line of the email.

This includes the definition of backup strategies and maintenance plans, patch management procedures and disaster recovery procedures and processes. In addition, this role is responsible for system performance maintenance and data integrity.
Responsible for the development of enhancements and modifications to the database systems used by the firm. This includes the development of custom level queries, SSIS packages, reports and actual system development work as needed, including enhancement estimates.
Assist in Reporting team initiatives through identifying end user requirements, development, testing and support of reports, data warehouses and data analysis.
Provide firm-wide support for all custom-built applications. Additionally, provide second level support for STAR. Fill in as primary support person as needed.
Assist other Baker Tilly IT personnel with problem resolution as needed. This can include firm-wide issues, as well as region specific problems.
Conduct briefings and demonstrations for users to enhance systems productivity. May be called upon to assist in the development of training coursework and materials as well as performing the actual training.
Maintain technical knowledge by attending technical education, attending workshops, reading publications and pursuing technical certifications.
Maintain and comply with quality service by following organization’s technological standards. Document procedures
Research new technologies and applications that can improve the quality, performance or functionality of database applications used firm-wide.
All other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelors degree required.
1 to 3 years of related work experience required.
Bachelor’s degree in related field.
SQL Server Administration.
SQL programming/SQL Database.
SQL Server Reporting Services.
SQL Server Analysis Services.
Experience in .NET programming (ASP.NET, VB.NET, C#).
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services.

The Database Administrator is a top level technical contributor able to perform all aspects of database management in a multi-platform enterprise scale environment. Responsible for performance tuning, data integrity, data security, and data interchange and other concepts related to various databases such as Oracle, and SQL Server. This individual can sit at any Collins Aerospace domestic location or remote.
Primary Responsibilities:
Stay abreast of technology developments in the database arena and provide expert level advice
Demonstrate proactive identification of key database architectures, components and interfaces
Partner with RDBMS vendors demonstrating industry-standard knowledge to deploy complex business solutions
Work with application teams to define optimal data models employing tools such as normalization principles
Guide the DBA team to deploy best in class RDBMS technology designs
Assume the lead on design and performance configuration efforts in the most complex database architectures and implementations
Provide database support in an on-call rotation
Innovate to find better means of achieving the goals of 24x7 availability and top performance
Focus on strategy to ensure the group’s goals align with those of the company
Basic Qualifications:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of prior relevant experience OR Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 5 years experience OR In absence of a degree, 12 years of relevant experience is required
Experience creating and maintaining stored procedures for Oracle SQL
Knowledge of diverse database architectures
Knowledge in database and information modelling (ER, Dimensional, physical, logical, hierarchical, semantic, etc.)
Knowledge in database and schema design and translation to implementation
7 years of data management experience
Experience migrating databases to newer releases
Strong oral and written communication skills
Proficiency working in a team environment
Preferred Qualifications:
Work in North Carolina
Work from Eastern US - Remote

WE ARE REDEFINING AEROSPACE.

We are seeking a Senior SQL Server Database Administrator responsible for managing multiple databases supporting complex enterprise applications in production and non-production environments. Further this position is responsible for providing database schema architectural vision and design, driving efficiency efforts and operational improvements of performance, integrity and security of critical database implementations to meet business needs.
ResponsibilitiesImplement conceptual design to physical database implementation, enhance and refine the logical design of the database.Work closely with Infrastructure Technology database management team and application development teams to ensure database operational continuity, availability, integrity, recovery, and security.Develop and maintain policies and procedures for ensuring secure access to production system information.Monitor databases for optimal performance and acts to mitigate blocking and performance tuning issues.Provide guidance to Application Development staff for query, stored procedures, functions and database design.Analyze large, complex systems to determine performance bottlenecks, application bugs, and opportunities to improve efficiency.Baseline system performance and monitor for deviation, recommending and implementing improvements to slow running queries.Document database architecture, configuration settings, baseline performance metrics and planned and unplanned outages. Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, a related field, or equivalent database administration experience10+ years of proven track record in database administration including mastery of Microsoft SQL Server, SQL, ETL processes and tools, stored procedures and functions.Advanced skills in managing MS SQL Server instances used with SSIS, SSAS and SSRS.Proven experience in logical database design, query and index tuning, relational database security design concepts, reporting systems, and data modeling.Act as a reference point for others on database schema design, SQL coding and related tools.Effective verbal and written communication skills to recommend technical processes, explain technical procedures, and negotiate resolution of work issues.Proven ability to work independently to coordinate and solve moderately complex technical data management issues.Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.
6 Month Contract Position (No Perdiem)
Projected Start Date: 12/06/21

Why Mayo Clinic

Mayo Clinic is the nation's best hospital (U.S. News & World Report, 2020-2021) and ranked #1 in more specialties than any other care provider. We have a vast array of opportunities ranging from Nursing, Clinical, to Finance, IT, Administrative, Research and Support Services to name a few. Across all locations, you’ll find career opportunities that support diversity, equity and inclusion. At Mayo Clinic, we invest in you with opportunities for growth and development and our benefits and compensation package are highly competitive. We invite you to be a part of our team where you’ll discover a culture of teamwork, professionalism, mutual respect, and most importantly, a life-changing career!


Mayo Clinic offers a variety of employee benefits. For additional information please visit Mayo Clinic Benefits. Eligibility may vary.

Position description
Under general supervision and guidance, the HTM DBA is responsible for the maintenance and support of complex database systems software at multiple Mayo Clinic sites. Actively monitor and respond to technical database problems utilizing diagnostic testing tools and techniques as well as assist in managing overall database capacity and health. Interface with vendor support service groups or other external support teams to ensure proper escalation during outages or periods of degraded system performance. Expected to contribute to the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of custom databases, and/or the installation and maintenance of purchased databases, plus the configuration and support of DBA applications across Mayo Clinic’s HTM Division; produce and maintain documentation such as systems requirements, designs, resource inventories and plans as requested by HTM leadership. Work will be reviewed for quality, timeliness, and adequacy at predetermined milestones. Demonstrated ability to take responsibility and accountability for managing work with little or no direct supervision. Demonstrated ability to multi-task and prioritize issues appropriately. Must possess human relations skills to interact effectively with a variety of personnel at multiple sites. Develops and maintains effective relationships with the HTM technical staff and management across all Mayo sites in the support of multiple projects simultaneously.

Qualifications

This position requires a Bachelor's degree and training experience in Systems DBA or an Associate's degree plus 3 years of demonstrated technical experience as a Systems DBA. A high school diploma and 5 years of demonstrated IT technical experience as a professional Systems DBA at a large, complex organization like Mayo may be considered in lieu of the degree.

Authorization to work and remain in the United States, without necessity for Mayo Clinic sponsorship now, or in the future (for example, be a U.S. Citizen, national, or permanent resident, refugee, or asylee). Also, Mayo Clinic does not participate in the F-1 STEM OPT extension program.


Additional qualifications

A Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, engineering or related field preferred; a Master's degree in a relevant technical discipline helpful. At least one DBMS platform certification is preferred. Experience working in healthcare technology and medical devices is a real plus. Qualified candidates should have knowledge of system design principles, software development methodologies, project management methodologies, and some computer programming and/or system support experience. Exposure to managing both custom developed and vendor-supplied applications helpful. A working knowledge of the following is preferred: Client/Server application architecture, Clustering, VB and scripting tools; MS SQL Server, Oracle, My SQL, DB2 or Sybase; Web Architecture including HTML, JavaScript, Active Server Pages (ASP), PHP; Network topologies and protocols e.g. IEEE 802.3, 802.11a/b/g,802.1x, TCP/IP;SAN, NAS, virtualized storage environments. Proficient verbal and written communication skills using English.

Exemption status

Exempt

Compensation Detail

Education, experience and tenure may be considered along with internal equity when job offers are extended. The minimum salary every 2 weeks is approx $3,171 based on a full-time position.

Benefits eligible

Yes

Schedule

Full Time

Hours / Pay period

80

Schedule details

Monday through Friday 8am to 5pm. Overtime required periodically as needed.

Weekend schedule

Occasional weekend hours required as needed.

Remote

Yes

International Assignment

No

Site description

May have some flexibility to work remotely 50% or more; business need requires employees to live within a reasonable driving distance of campus.

Mayo Clinic is located in the heart of downtown Rochester, Minnesota, a vibrant, friendly city that provides a highly livable environment for more than 34,000 Mayo staff and students. The city is consistently ranked among the best places to live in the United States because of its affordable cost of living, healthy lifestyle, excellent school systems and exceptionally high quality of life.

Overview:

Baker Tilly US, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a leading advisory, tax and assurance firm, providing clients a genuine coast-to-coast and global advantage with critical mass and top-notch talent in major regions of the U.S. and in many of the world’s leading financial centers – New York, London, San Francisco, Los Angeles and Chicago. Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 148 territories, with 36,000 professionals and a combined worldwide revenue of $4.0 billion.
Many of Baker Tilly’s roles have the opportunity to work remotely. Please discuss with your talent acquisition professional to understand the requirements for an opportunity you are exploring.
Baker Tilly is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable federal, state or local law.
Responsibilities:

The Junior Database Administrator is responsible for implementation, maintenance, testing and support of firm-wide databases and applications, primarily related to Baker Tilly Time and Billing System (STAR). This includes analyzing, developing and managing requests for modifications and enhancements to the database structure for these applications. Also responsible for supporting the application development team with database changes, queries, and reports, as well as working with the Technical Services Team on maintenance updates to the database servers.
Primary Duties and Responsibilites:
Responsible for the infrastructure and architecture for all database systems and related subsystems. This includes the definition of backup strategies and maintenance plans, patch management procedures and disaster recovery procedures and processes. In addition, this role is responsible for system performance maintenance and data integrity.
Responsible for the development of enhancements and modifications to the database systems used by the firm. This includes the development of custom level queries, SSIS packages, reports and actual system development work as needed, including enhancement estimates.
Assist in Reporting team initiatives through identifying end user requirements, development, testing and support of reports, data warehouses and data analysis.
Provide firm-wide support for all custom-built applications. Additionally, provide second level support for STAR. Fill in as primary support person as needed.
Assist other Baker Tilly IT personnel with problem resolution as needed. This can include firm-wide issues, as well as region specific problems.
Conduct briefings and demonstrations for users to enhance systems productivity. May be called upon to assist in the development of training coursework and materials as well as performing the actual training.
Maintain technical knowledge by attending technical education, attending workshops, reading publications and pursuing technical certifications.
Maintain and comply with quality service by following organization’s technological standards. Document procedures
Research new technologies and applications that can improve the quality, performance or functionality of database applications used firm-wide.
All other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelors degree required.
1 to 3 years of related work experience required.
Bachelor’s degree in related field.
SQL Server Administration.
SQL programming/SQL Database.
SQL Server Reporting Services.
SQL Server Analysis Services.
Experience in .NET programming (ASP.NET, VB.NET, C#).
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services.

Overview:

Baker Tilly US, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a leading advisory, tax and assurance firm, providing clients a genuine coast-to-coast and global advantage with critical mass and top-notch talent in major regions of the U.S. and in many of the world’s leading financial centers – New York, London, San Francisco, Los Angeles and Chicago. Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 148 territories, with 36,000 professionals and a combined worldwide revenue of $4.0 billion.
Many of Baker Tilly’s roles have the opportunity to work remotely. Please discuss with your talent acquisition professional to understand the requirements for an opportunity you are exploring.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable federal, state or local law.
Responsibilities:

The Junior Database Administrator is responsible for implementation, maintenance, testing and support of firm-wide databases and applications, primarily related to Baker Tilly Time and Billing System (STAR). This includes analyzing, developing and managing requests for modifications and enhancements to the database structure for these applications. Also responsible for supporting the application development team with database changes, queries, and reports, as well as working with the Technical Services Team on maintenance updates to the database servers.
Primary Duties and Responsibilites:
Responsible for the infrastructure and architecture for all database systems and related subsystems. This includes the definition of backup strategies and maintenance plans, patch management procedures and disaster recovery procedures and processes. In addition, this role is responsible for system performance maintenance and data integrity.
Responsible for the development of enhancements and modifications to the database systems used by the firm. This includes the development of custom level queries, SSIS packages, reports and actual system development work as needed, including enhancement estimates.
Assist in Reporting team initiatives through identifying end user requirements, development, testing and support of reports, data warehouses and data analysis.
Provide firm-wide support for all custom-built applications. Additionally, provide second level support for STAR. Fill in as primary support person as needed.
Assist other Baker Tilly IT personnel with problem resolution as needed. This can include firm-wide issues, as well as region specific problems.
Conduct briefings and demonstrations for users to enhance systems productivity. May be called upon to assist in the development of training coursework and materials as well as performing the actual training.
Maintain technical knowledge by attending technical education, attending workshops, reading publications and pursuing technical certifications.
Maintain and comply with quality service by following organization’s technological standards. Document procedures
Research new technologies and applications that can improve the quality, performance or functionality of database applications used firm-wide.
All other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelors degree required.
1 to 3 years of related work experience required.
Bachelor’s degree in related field.
SQL Server Administration.
SQL programming/SQL Database.
SQL Server Reporting Services.
SQL Server Analysis Services.
Experience in .NET programming (ASP.NET, VB.NET, C#).
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services.

Database Administrator IV Works under the general supervision of the Long Term Care Application Manager. This position is responsible for leading complex technical database activities for the information systems supporting the HHSC Division of Regulatory Services. Provides support in the development and maintenance of data warehouse and reporting systems. Develops, tests, debugs and documents highly complex program code to implement functional and design requirements for reporting systems in the agency. Participates in code walk-throughs. Assists in the development and maintenance of system documentation. Works with other members of the development team and end-users. Develops and maintains expertise in a variety of programming and database management tools. Develops technical and user documentation and supports training as required.


Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.


1. Evaluates users' requests for new data elements and systems and incorporates into the existing shared data environment. Coordinates use of data to ensure data integrity and control redundancy. Loads databases and reorganizes as needed. Performs data modeling and prototyping. (30%)

Install and use Data Modeling tools like Erwin, Sql developer data modeler etc

Develop logical and physical Data Models and Entity Relationship Diagrams

Implement database objects in a Oracle RDBMS.

Advanced data modeler with experience in Design, creation, and maintenance data models representing production databases.

Generate scripts to be in the database using data modeler tools

Incorporating changes to data model design

Write source to target mapping instructions as needed to support ETL development

Develop stored procedures, database triggers and complex PL/SQL packages where needed.

Perform requirement analysis and provide data mapping guidance to application and development teams.

PL/SQL skills


2. Analyzes, designs, and implements databases. Determines and implements database search strategies. Determines database storage requirements. Develops and maintains data dictionary ensuring uniformity of definitions and sets standards for use of data dictionary. Establishes and controls necessary database security. (30%)

Evaluate the database server Hardware

Install database and grid software

Plan database for logical structure, overall database design and backup, restore strategy

Database performance analysis

Implement ASM for database storage or filesystem based database strategy

Follow database naming conventions per guidelines

If needed implement Oracle advanced security and Oracle database Vault

Database security solutions to ensure data privacy, protect against insider threats, and enable regulatory compliance

Implement oracle identity management to secure critical applications and sensitive data, lower operational costs, and comply with regulatory requirements.

- Directs the design, analysis and development of backup and recovery systems by working with the customer for support and implementation of more complex databases and environments. Serves as primary contact for vendors and system architects to represent customer requirements. Creates documentation for backup and recovery. Defines database validation requirements to ensure database integrity -Develops a plan and directs implementation of database security infrastructure that coincides with policy requirements, Makes recommendations for security best practices


3. Designs, codes and modifies complex computer programs, subroutines, triggers, stored procedures, objects, classes and scripts to maintain reporting systems. Performs necessary testing of assigned programs, including the generation of test data, writing test scripts/execution sequences, examining test results, debugging detected errors, etc. Uses current software development methods/techniques and established development standards (which include programming standards, documentation standards and testing standards) to ensure the quality and maintainability of reports/applications. Participates in code walk-thrus to ensure compliance with development standards and system/business requirements. (20%)


4. Works with trainers, technical support staff, network specialists and contract staff to perform modifications and/or updates to existing systems or to implement new systems. Identifies, investigates and resolves production problems. This may include analyzing problems, coding, testing, implementing and training of other technical staff and/or customers. (15%)


5. Other duties as assigned. (Note: This includes but is not limited to actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency’s obligations for disaster response and/or recovery or Continuity of Operations (COOP) activation. Such participation may require an alternate shift pattern assignment and/or location.) (5%)


Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of database management systems such as MS SQL Server and Oracle.

Knowledge of information systems project methodologies

Knowledge of general technical knowledge

Knowledge of and familiarity with personal computer hardware and peripheral equipment


Skills in computer programming

Skills in planning, scheduling and prioritizing work assignments

Skills in written and verbal communications

Skills in writing and testing code, including new and maintenance


Ability to analyze problems and develop solutions to correct the problems

Ability to analyze functional/design requirements and to develop solutions to implement the requirements

Ability to perform detailed work accurately and in accordance with standards

Ability to work and communicate effectively with others

Ability to meet deadlines and work on projects with changing priorities

Registration or Licensure Requirements:
A minimum of one (1) IT certification is preferred.


Initial Selection Criteria:
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a major in computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, Management or related field. May substitute direct work experience on a year-for-year basis. Minimum of 7 years’ experience as a Database Administrator.

You.

You bring your body, mind, heart and spirit to your work as a Remote SQL Server Database Administrator.

You know how to move fast. You know how to stay organized. You know how to have fun.

You’re great at what you do, but you want to be part of something even greater. Because you believe that while individuals can be strong, the right team is invincible.

Us.

System Services is our Corporate Headquarters in Broomfield, Colorado and is located within the Oracle campus. SCL Health is a faith-based, nonprofit healthcare organization dedicated to improving the well-being of the people we serve.

Benefits are one of the ways we encourage health for you and your family. Our generous package includes medical, dental and vision coverage. But health is more than a well-working body: it encompasses body, mind and social well-being. To that end, we’ve launched a Healthy Living program to address your holistic health. Healthy Living includes financial incentives, digital tools, tobacco cessation, classes, counseling and paid time off. We also offer financial wellness tools and retirement planning.

We.

Together we’ll align mission and careers, values and workplace. We’ll encourage joy and take pride in our integrity.

We’ll laugh at each other’s jokes (even the bad ones). We’ll hello and high five. We’ll celebrate milestones and acknowledge the value of spirituality in healing.

We’re proud of what we know, which includes how much there is to learn.

Your day.

As a Remote SQL Server Database Administrator you need to know how to:


Performs activities related to the corporate-wide administration of database infrastructures, including defining, organizing, securing, ensuring efficiency, documenting, determining long term requirements and operational guidelines.

Provides operational services which maximize system availability, enhance security and optimize error-free process and job cycles.

Creates SQL Server database maintenance plans and jobs.

Provides responsive, high-quality customer support to resolve customer problems and respond to questions.

Interacts with other internal application teams and systems groups, to triage and diagnose issues related to assigned databases or areas.

Provides direction, coordination, guidance, and technical support and expertise related to the installation and implementation of all new instances and services and upgrades to existing systems.

Serves as the technical subject matter expert related to the assigned databases or areas.

Promotes mission, vision, and values of SCL Health, and abides by service behavior standards.

Performs other duties as assigned.


Your experience.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.


Database Management Software: Microsoft last 3 major product release versions, vendor specific backup and recovery methodologies, vendor specific build and configuration best practices, database lifecycle management tools required.

Knowledge of and hands on experience with setting up, monitoring and troubleshooting SQL Server Always ON Availability groups.

Working knowledge of SSAS, SSRS and SSIS.

Operating Systems Configuration/Management: Microsoft Windows operating environments, file systems, local or network storage device usage, scripting required.

Industry best practices and/or standards for database builds and configurations

LAN/WAN networking principles and knowledge and business and management principles preferred.

Ability to work nights and/or weekends is required for identified positions



Required:

Bachelor's Degree in computer science, information services, business administration, engineering, or related field required. 100% remote work position.

Preferred:

Five (5) years experience with Microsoft SQL Server database administration and disaster recovery methodology in an enterprise environment preferred. Experience in the healthcare industry is preferred. Understanding of Epic architecture and Clarity and Caboodle databases is preferred. Microsoft MCSA or DP-300

Your next move.

Now that you know more about being a Remote SQL Server Database Administrator on our team we hope you’ll join us. At SCL Health you’ll reaffirm every day how much you love this work, and why you were called to it in the first place.

Major League Baseball is looking for experienced Data Engineers that are passionate about building new technologies for the baseball industry. Launched in 2001 as the tech arm of Major League Baseball, MLBAM is now a leading authority in real-time sports data processing, distribution and analysis.
The Baseball Data team is the central data hub for MLB. Using cutting edge technology, our data is consumed by fans, broadcasters, stadiums, and MLB teams. Our team's primary product line is MLB.com Gameday, Statcast and Pitchcast. You can find more information about Statcast at
http://www.nytimes.com/2016/10/02/magazine/can-new-technology-bring-baseballs-data-revolution-to-fielding.html
As a Senior Data Engineer, your primary responsibilities will be to help design, develop, optimize, and enhance our constantly evolving databases, ETL pipelines, and reporting tools that support the storage and consumption of baseball data. Everything from player records, to pitch by pitch statistical data, to "Statcast" ball and player tracking data, you will be responsible for ensuring we are securely and accurately storing and delivering all data components that power the game of baseball. If it happens on the diamond - we want to track it and store it! If you love working with baseball data then this is the job for you.

Responsibilities Include:

Build and manage relational PostgreSQL databases leveraging your knowledge of different types of data types, their use cases, trade-offs, performance, and limitations
Define and implement database schema and configurations working with a team of extraordinary engineers and technologists.
Create and maintain documentation of procedures, schemas and guides for troubleshooting database systems.
Develop, manage, and test database backup & recovery strategies, verifying data integrity
Orchestrate data ETL workflows using Apache Airflow/Google Cloud Composer and Python
Work alongside top data scientists on data analysis, machine vision and NLP.
Participate in the full lifecycle of software development (requirements gathering, designing, building, testing and maintenance).
Change the way baseball data is consumed.

You Have:

5+ years of experience with Database Design and development with PostgreSQL
Significant practical hands-on experience with database administration, backup and recovery, performance tuning and high-availability solutions.
Detailed understanding of Postgres database server architecture, concepts, features, and high-availability technologies.
Expert knowledge of PL/PgSQL, triggers, and stored procedure development and optimization in PostgreSQL
Experience managing production databases with replication, hot stand-by, clustering, and table partitioning.
An avid learner, independent with excellent problem-solving skills.
Passionate about mentoring peer developers, providing code reviews, etc.
A passion for baseball and baseball data.

Preferred, But Not Required

Exposure to Google Cloud Platform
Understanding of big data concepts and knowledge of big data languages/tools such as Hadoop, Kylin, or Spark

Data Engineering is a rapidly growing field so above all else, we're looking for motivated engineers that will always be open to challenge the status quo and will stay on top of the latest technologies and trends to ensure we find the best solutions.

What Is It Like to Work at MLB?

Major League Baseball (MLB) is the most historic of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. Employees love working at MLB because of the culture of growth, teamwork, and professionalism. Employees who are most successful at MLB take initiative, know how to identify problems and provide solutions, and always put the Team first. For those ready to step up to the plate and join the Major Leagues, MLB takes the same approach as teams do with their players: empowering them to be at their best by engineering experiences that put employees in the best position to succeed. Major League Baseball is looking for candidates who are passionate about growing America's pastime to best serve its fans for decades to come.

MLB's vision is to be the global sport of choice for youth to play, fans of all backgrounds to enjoy and a desired destination for employment. With a belief that the journey to growth and greatness is ongoing, MLB gives employees the opportunity to continue learning and honing their skills with programs such as: tuition reimbursement; mentorship programs; lunch and learns; online course subscriptions; paid industry certifications; business resource groups; and more.

MLB provides its employees with exceptional medical, dental, and vision coverage. Premiums are 100% employer covered to help employees focus on being their best!
All in-office and ballpark-based positions are subject to MLB's mandatory Covid-19 vaccine policy

Job Summary:
The Sr. DBA position works on a central team of Database Systems Engineers and Administrators supporting DBMS for Disney Connected, Advanced Technologies and corporate development teams and customers. Primary focus of this position will be Database support and service of operational and business processes for internet sites and corporate applications for The Walt Disney Company. Responsible for level 1 systems management and exercises project-level control over initiatives. Excellent technical expertise in relevant state of the art database technologies, stores, systems, and design. Carries out assignments with minimal coaching and guidance from others. Develops, enhances and adheres to engineering and administration standards. Upholds and maintains strong documentation.

The ideal candidate will have experience with Pubic Cloud providers like AWS and Azure and 4-6 years experience with DB2. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience is a plus.

Basic Qualifications:
4-6 years experience with DB2 is strongly preferred. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience, or similar relational database systems, is a plus.

4-6 years’ experience with relevant scripting languages or programming frameworks desired (NodeJS, JavaScript, Python, Perl, C, windows script; PowerShell, sh, korne, bash)
Expertise in relational database administration including configuration, implementation, data modeling, maintenance, redundancy/HA/DR, security, troubleshooting/performance tuning, upgrades, database, data and server migrations, SQL
2 or more years of IT operational experience supporting robust e-commerce, gaming or online businesses in a 24X7 production environment (on call)

Expertise in configuring, implementing and supporting high availability redundancy strategies on systems including replication, clustering, log shipping, mirroring

Expertise with Disaster Recovery planning and implementation
Experience with Linux system administration, configuration, troubleshooting, performance tuning, and security procedures; experience with Windows desired
Excellent knowledge of hardware, storage, RAID, and disk subsystems technologies as they pertain to DBMS systems, experience with SAN technologies highly desired
Excellent systems documentation and system diagraming skills

Demonstrated experience with troubleshooting systems issues and effectively diagnosing problems

Preferred Qualifications:
Leads and completes tasks independently, with attention to detail and while under pressure
Excellent judgment, problem resolution, negotiation, and decision-making skills as well as the ability to work under continual deadline pressure

The Postgres Database Administrator is responsible for the installation, configuration, maintenance, analysis and tuning of the database servers and related systems required to support the O'Reilly computing environment.

Essential Job Functions
Manages the creation and modification of database objects to ensure any changes have been reviewed and approved before installing in production environment.
Works with development teams to optimize design of databases and access from applications.
Develops a methodology for the ongoing assessment of database performance and the identification of problem areas.
Researches available technology solutions. Evaluates and recommends options to improve database server environment.
Reviews database backup and disaster recovery resources to ensure company data is adequately protected.
Installs new software releases, system upgrades, evaluates and installs OS patches and resolves software related issues.
Develops a security scheme for the database environment and performs user account and group administration for database server when needed. Performs periodic review of accounts per audit requirements.
Provides database support assistance to the IS department and log support calls to vendor when required.
Responds to operational needs which may involve working after hours and/or travel to resolve issues.
Skills and Qualifications
Senior level experience working with PostgreSQL Database Administration including large scale server hardware and software systems.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Information Systems or equivalent experience.
Exceptional problem-solving skills.
Above average oral and written communications skills.
Willingness to work flexible schedule including nights/weekends.
Must work well in a team environment.
Must be able to learn independently.
Knowledge of Windows, Linux platforms and AS/400 platforms.
Knowledge of Database server software in O'Reilly computing environment including but not limited to DB2, Oracle, MSSQL, MySQL and PostgreSQL.

TTI, Inc. is seeking a Database Administrator (DB2). This person is accountable for the performance, maintenance, synchronization, security, and accessibility of all DB2 database systems with demonstrated proficiency in database replication, backup and restore, performance tuning and scalability. The position will require extensive custom DB2 development on the z/OS platform including stored procedures, views and provides technical support to application developers and end users. This position is accountable for troubleshooting system issues; developing and monitoring scheduled jobs and maintenance plans; and for proactively monitoring the performance of databases. Experience developing SQL Code for API use is a plus.
Headquartered in Fort Worth, TX, TTI, Inc. is the world’s leading authorized distributor of passive, connector, electromechanical and discrete components. Just celebrating its 50th anniversary, this Berkshire Hathaway company is ever-growing and has over 100 locations in North America, Europe, and Asia! Join a winning team in a growing global organization!
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Designs, implements and maintains the database architectures enhancing the integrity, security and performance of the database operating environment by collaborating with application developers, server administrators, project management, and end users to accomplish goals and objectives. Provides effective/accurate time estimates based on documented requirements
Develops, tests, and implements extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) processes from external and internal sources.
Provides effective support on a 24/7 on-call rotation basis by researching & analyzing issues to determine database related implications, effectively communicating with all impacted parties, and troubleshooting & resolving issues with a sense of urgency to minimize any system downtime.
Performs regular full and incremental backups of databases while adhering to the Recovery Time and Recovery Point objectives defined by the business. Periodically verify backups (e.g. by restoring to a test system). Participate in Disaster Recovery drills (i.e. bring databases online at DR site).
Monitors disk space on database and storage servers, CPU and Memory. Identify tuning opportunities for developers and provide tuning advice. Archive data as necessary to keep from using too much disk space.
Provides guidance/support for the Development Team on a regular basis. This includes collaborating with architects and developers to design and implement business processes.
Must prepare database documentation, including standards, procedures, best practices and data dictionary(s).
Must be able to plan, install and test software upgrades and patches where necessary.
Constantly look for opportunities to automate tasks and improve stability/ reliability.
Provides weekly status reports on database state/in-flight projects/maintenance schedules/etc.
Ensures future growth ramifications are considered in all design decisions, forecasting system and storage requirements to accommodate growth in data storage and performance needs. Continuously evaluates the operating performance of the database environment to ensure maximum performance by proactively monitoring the performance of all databases and by developing and implementing changes to enhance overall performance. Performs ongoing planning and monitoring of database size, performance, and hardware capacity.
Continually increases technical knowledge and proactively applies knowledge by keeping abreast of changes in technology via available resources, and utilizes this knowledge by recommending appropriate changes (e.g. programming techniques, software, performance measurement tools, systems and process, etc.).
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
High School Diploma or GED required. A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science plus five years of database development and administration experience; or equivalent combination of education or experience preferred.
SKILLS & CERTIFICATIONS
Extensive knowledge & experience of DB2 (version 12 is a plus).
Expert experience in database Backup, Restore and Recovery procedures.
Experience with z/OS Mainframe platform.
Experience in building Stored Procedures.
Work collaboratively with other team members and application groups
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills and multitasking ability.
Show initiative, self-direction, and follow-through on assignments
Embraces and leads technological change and development
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively document procedures.
Ability to work weekends and after business hours.
Strong desire and passion to learn new technologies
Demonstrated commitment to quality.
IBM DB2 certification(s) are desirable.
Knowledge of competing database platforms.
Possess accurate keyboarding proficiency.

Scope and Purpose of Position

The role of the Database Analyst is to develop automated and scalable reporting capabilities for internal and external customers. This includes the development, design and maintenance of reporting capabilities utilizing SQL programming and ETL tools available within the business.

Development of standardized SQL queries and stored procedures across multiple disparate servers/databases
