Active participation in the development of data warehouse’s, data stores and other supplemental reporting enhancements, including the creation of new reporting templates and analytical reports, maintain a reporting schedule and documentation of reporting procedures
Collaborate with internal departments and external entities to identify and implement changes that will enhance core system data quality
Analyze, interpret and report financial and operational performance trends from various channels & departments, identifying areas performing outside of expected results
Develop efficiencies to consolidate and increase the effectiveness of outbound file development and reconciliation, and maintain departmental reports used internally and externally
Maintain current knowledge of regulations, data files, and their structures and associated database tables in the IT systems

Interact with Client Management and Clients directly to discuss reporting requirements and deliver reporting results
Perform ad hoc duties in accordance with business needs

Education and Experience

5+ years SQL development experience; advance SQL skills required
3+ years’ ETL development experience using Informatica PowerCenter and/or SSIS
Experience within health care industry and knowledge of claims data highly desirable
Extensive experience with Microsoft Excel, Access and/or other data analysis reporting tools
Preferred experience with application logic with an ability to read/develop programs and review the logic of programs developed by others as well as to read file layouts
Ability to work onsite and participate in interactive onsite meetings on a regular and predictable basis
Ability to initiate immediate interaction, coordination and collaboration with team members, clients, customers etc.

Description:
Overview:

Baker Tilly US, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a leading advisory, tax and assurance firm, providing clients a genuine coast-to-coast and global advantage with critical mass and top-notch talent in major regions of the U.S. and in many of the world’s leading financial centers – New York, London, San Francisco, Los Angeles and Chicago. Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 148 territories, with 36,000 professionals and a combined worldwide revenue of $4.0 billion.
Many of Baker Tilly’s roles have the opportunity to work remotely. Please discuss with your talent acquisition professional to understand the requirements for an opportunity you are exploring.
Baker Tilly is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable federal, state or local law.
Responsibilities:

The Junior Database Administrator is responsible for implementation, maintenance, testing and support of firm-wide databases and applications, primarily related to Baker Tilly Time and Billing System (STAR). This includes analyzing, developing and managing requests for modifications and enhancements to the database structure for these applications. Also responsible for supporting the application development team with database changes, queries, and reports, as well as working with the Technical Services Team on maintenance updates to the database servers.
Primary Duties and Responsibilites:
Responsible for the infrastructure and architecture for all database systems and related subsystems. This includes the definition of backup strategies and maintenance plans, patch management procedures and disaster recovery procedures and processes. In addition, this role is responsible for system performance maintenance and data integrity.
Responsible for the development of enhancements and modifications to the database systems used by the firm. This includes the development of custom level queries, SSIS packages, reports and actual system development work as needed, including enhancement estimates.
Assist in Reporting team initiatives through identifying end user requirements, development, testing and support of reports, data warehouses and data analysis.
Provide firm-wide support for all custom-built applications. Additionally, provide second level support for STAR. Fill in as primary support person as needed.
Assist other Baker Tilly IT personnel with problem resolution as needed. This can include firm-wide issues, as well as region specific problems.
Conduct briefings and demonstrations for users to enhance systems productivity. May be called upon to assist in the development of training coursework and materials as well as performing the actual training.
Maintain technical knowledge by attending technical education, attending workshops, reading publications and pursuing technical certifications.
Maintain and comply with quality service by following organization’s technological standards. Document procedures
Research new technologies and applications that can improve the quality, performance or functionality of database applications used firm-wide.
All other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelors degree required.
1 to 3 years of related work experience required.
Bachelor’s degree in related field.
SQL Server Administration.
SQL programming/SQL Database.
SQL Server Reporting Services.
SQL Server Analysis Services.
Experience in .NET programming (ASP.NET, VB.NET, C#).
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services.

About the Role
The Senior Database Administrator (DBA) will be in charge of providing technical strategy and support for production and development database environments, including overseeing the development and organization of databases, implementation of new technologies, and providing long term strategy on database and business opportunities. This role is challenged to work with Architecture, Data Insights and Analytics, Product, and Technical Operations to achieve a state of the art data environment that meets current and future business objectives.
This role will train and develop technical support, data analysts and application staff to improve upon the data processing environment, make recommendations for design tools to assist in management and transaction processing for capacity assessment and planning.
As a senior staff member you’ll be expected to operate independently, though your day-to-day will involve leading, learning and working with various teams to create, support, and deploy database needs across the organization.
This is an exciting time at New Classrooms as our mission of creating and inspiring better ways to give every student an educational foundation for lifelong success has never been more important. This role is critical to experimentation and our ability to support schools and students in this uncertain time.
Our team spans a range of backgrounds, skill sets, and experience levels, but are all high-performing, dedicated, and fantastic to collaborate with. We are looking for someone who seeks out challenges, thrives in complexity, and finds satisfaction in making complicated things simpler using your technical expertise.
What You Would Do
Work to ensure New Classrooms technical solutions are effectively delivered, aligned to the overall strategy, and deliver value to the schools and communities we serve.
Maintain existing and developing data methodology for the ongoing assessment of database performance management, tuning, and the identification of problem areas.
Innovate the existing database design from logical data models and product specifications.
Design and implement database change control processes
Develop and drive security measures for the database environment and data integrity.
Partner with Product Design, Engineering, and Operations teams to drive innovation and continuous improvement
Help service data-related requests of internal stakeholders as needed
Key Competencies of the Role
Information sharing: In order to build resilience resilience and responsiveness in the organization, you’ll need to be open and honest about challenges, as well as the actions required to address unexpected developments
Operates effectively: You’ll have the ability to juggle a multitude of projects simultaneously, large or small
Verbal + Written Communication: You’ll be working with lots of people in the organization and the way you communicate with these people will need to vary based on their needs and level of understanding of the work that you do
Creativity: You’ll have the ability to think “outside the box” for creative problem solving and strategic thinking
Leadership: You’ll possess proactive leadership with the ability to inspire and motivate
What We Are Looking For
Leadership experience as a DBA in all phases of a production database lifecycle, from database design to incident resolution through monitoring and alerts
Experience working with container technologies such as Docker
Exceptional expertise with a services architecture in an AWS environment
Hands on skills working with repository management and infrastructure as code using technologies such as Terraform.
Solid knowledge and history dealing with consistency issues across distributed systems
Experience working within an Agile methodology, techniques, frameworks such as SAFe and DevOps to deliver solutions.
Experience with software development project and documentation tools such as JIRA and Confluence.
Role Classification and Benefits
This role is full-time and includes benefits such as rich medical, dental, and vision insurance, 37 paid days off per year (prorated for the period in which you work), paid parental leave, a professional development budget of $375 annually and a quarterly cell phone subsidy.
Commitment to Diversity
At New Classrooms we are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion. We strive to create and inspire better ways to give every student an educational foundation for lifelong success. In order to fully realize this mission we are dedicated to building a diverse pool of candidates including those from underrepresented backgrounds, and resolute in building an inclusive culture that supports and celebrates the diverse voices and perspectives of our employees.
Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex.

The Postgres Database Administrator is responsible for the installation, configuration, maintenance, analysis and tuning of the database servers and related systems required to support the O'Reilly computing environment.

Essential Job Functions
Manages the creation and modification of database objects to ensure any changes have been reviewed and approved before installing in production environment.
Works with development teams to optimize design of databases and access from applications.
Develops a methodology for the ongoing assessment of database performance and the identification of problem areas.
Researches available technology solutions. Evaluates and recommends options to improve database server environment.
Reviews database backup and disaster recovery resources to ensure company data is adequately protected.
Installs new software releases, system upgrades, evaluates and installs OS patches and resolves software related issues.
Develops a security scheme for the database environment and performs user account and group administration for database server when needed. Performs periodic review of accounts per audit requirements.
Provides database support assistance to the IS department and log support calls to vendor when required.
Responds to operational needs which may involve working after hours and/or travel to resolve issues.
Skills and Qualifications
Senior level experience working with PostgreSQL Database Administration including large scale server hardware and software systems.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Information Systems or equivalent experience.
Exceptional problem-solving skills.
Above average oral and written communications skills.
Willingness to work flexible schedule including nights/weekends.
Must work well in a team environment.
Must be able to learn independently.
Knowledge of Windows, Linux platforms and AS/400 platforms.
Knowledge of Database server software in O'Reilly computing environment including but not limited to DB2, Oracle, MSSQL, MySQL and PostgreSQL.
Benefits
All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

McCarter & English LLP is actively seeking a Microsoft SQL Database Administrator for its office located in Newark, NJ. If you have the appropriate experience, we invite you to consider joining our team. Please send your resume and cover letter to the attention of Christine Lydon, Esq., at recruiting@mccarter.com.
The Microsoft SQL Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for the overall integrity, health and maintenance of the database environment to include, but not limited to, monitoring database security and software, implementing database disaster recovery planning and testing and creating/maintaining documentation on database configuration. This individual ensures that the SQL Server infrastructure and related procedures adhere to McCarter and English’s goals of support of staff, attorneys and clients. The candidate who fills this position will be working with other team members, vendors, and outside consultants to support new and existing SQL Server solutions. The quality of support for these solutions will impact the business so attention to detail is a “must-have” trait for a candidate to possess. This candidate will also assist in the end-user experience and provide end-user support as needed.
SKILLS
Good understanding of data structures, operating systems, database systems, object-oriented systems & design
In-depth understanding of modern software development methodologies is a plus
At least 5 years’ production experience installing and administering Microsoft SQL Server
At least 5+ years of experience and extensive knowledge with SQL Clusters and High Availability Groups
Good working knowledge of Active Directory, Windows OS, and related Microsoft tools
Ability to adhere to documented standards and procedures, including change management, incident, and problem management
Ability to work with vendor hardware and software engineers to escalate investigation and resolution of problems
Ability to work independently and as part of a larger team in an efficient and collaborative manner
Possess a high degree of energy, accountability, initiative, and innovation
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
RESPONSIBILITIES
Administer all aspects of the SQL Server stack
Troubleshoot and resolve SQL Server performance issue
Assist in migration of legacy instances to SQL Server X from previous versions
Provide first line SQL Server Database Administration support
Work within best practices to administer the SQL Server environment for optimal needs-based performance
Advise developers on the most efficient database designs
Experience using PowerShell to automate administration tasks
Participate in the analysis and composition of requirements
Participate in DR Tests in support of mission-critical IT service continuity/BCP planning
Participate in root cause analysis and related documentation and communication of SQL systems
Perform and document SQL patching on an ongoing basis
Daily health check monitoring of SQL infrastructure
Write in depth documentation and follow test procedures
Ensure that database servers back up is as per the business’s Recovery Point Objectives (RPO)
Ensure enhanced security measures are in place and reviewed
Conduct test backups to verify that business’ Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) are met
Be available to troubleshoot SQL Server service outages including after- hours and weekends as needed.
Configure SQL Server monitoring utilities to reduce the number of false alarms
Make recommendations on technologies (clustering, log shipping, mirroring, Windows Azure etc.) to be used for incorporating new systems
Install and configure new SQL Servers
Deployment of database change scripts from third party vendors
Analyze performance issues to determine best solutions to increase performance, server configuration changes or index/query changes)
Documentation of company’s database environment
McCarter & English, LLP is an Equal Opportunity Employer

ASU is the largest state university and for the last seven years in a row has been recognized as the most innovative university by U.S. News & World Report. The University Technology Office of ASU is currently seeking a motivated and experienced Database Administrator (SQL Server) to join our high-performing team. This position is responsible for coordinating and monitoring the design, development, modification and implementation of databases and database environments; ensures all database environments are highly available and recoverable; provides technical support and leadership for supported database environments; provides and designs tools to assist in the management of the databases and client/server environment; ensures all database environments are secured by deploying user provisioning, database encryption, and data masking techniques.

As with everyone in the UTO family, culture and communications are core responsibilities in this role.

ASU offers a total compensation package that includes valuable employee benefits. Click here to explore options.

Essential Duties
Develops methodology for the ongoing assessment of database performance.
Identifies and resolves conflicts arising over the creation, control and use of data.
Works collaboratively with users and team members to gather requirements.
Develops project specifications, scope and estimated effort.
Develops database design, table structure and writes store procedures to meet user objectives/outcomes.
Identifies and troubleshoots errors and/or problems with applications.
Establishes and monitors security guidelines
Works closely and collaboratively with Web Development teams to identify relevant data sources, develop and/or modify database structures as appropriate
Monitors database performance, identifies potential areas for improvement, makes modifications as appropriate
Works collaboratively with Server team as needed Participate as either leader or team member in a wide variety of projects to develop and improve routine procedures through use of innovative and technology supported solutions
Prepares associated documentation and end-user training Remains abreast of technology directions, initiatives and trends within scope of expertise to provide ideas, guidance and recommendations.
Ensures availability and performance of Microsoft SQL Server and other DBMS environments that support multiple critical applications.
Ensures associated hardware resources are optimally allocated to database servers.
Proactively monitors the database environments to ensure secure services with minimum downtime.
Provides trend analysis and database documentation / reports to management team to enable them to make informed decisions regarding resource management and availability of the systems.
Troubleshoots and problem solves issues related to the Microsoft SQL Server and other DBMS environments.
Responsible for improvement and maintenance of the databases to include patching and upgrades.
Provides implementation and release of database changes to support the application development teams in both the development and production environments.
Provides migration of database components from/to DEV, QA, and Production in support of Development teams.
Reviews vendor database requirements & recommendations, and implement optimal and secure solutions.
Provides Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services - Extract, Transform, Load
This is a 24/7 support environment and will require on-call availability.
Takes responsibility for fostering culture, advancing our values, and championing engagement in all its forms - collaborating across our teams as well as participating in UTO/ASU events and programs.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or closely related field and 4 years database administration including creating and updating table structures and views as well as writing stored procedures OR, Any equivalent combination of experience and/or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved.
Desired Qualifications
Knowledge of web based applications and associated database requirements to proactively identify, develop and deploy solutions to improve effectiveness of technology delivered materials/information.
Demonstrated knowledge of database design principles, practices and methods; security/permission standards; Database query tools including, but not limited to, SQL. Languages including, but not limited to, C#, Python.XML, HTML, and Microsoft Word. Access to SQL queries. Cloud environments such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) database Services, and Terraform would be a plus.
Experience writing Microsoft SSIS packages, ETL work, performance tuning and SQL tuning.
Ability to model empathy, compassion and emotional intelligence
Experience working in a values-led organization, emphasizing diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging
Ability to help foster a safe psychological space for all teammates where everyone can thrive
Ability to stimulate changes in individual, institutional, and corporate behaviors to create a more sustainable environment
Ability to lead by example in communicating, participating and encouraging support of the institution’s sustainability programs
Demonstrated understanding of:
Database design principles
Practices and methods
Security/permission standards
Database Encryption techniques
Database query tools including, but not limited to, SQL Server Management Studio
SQL tuning; database indexing
Database disaster recovery techniques
Database replication
Evidence of:
Experience in/with the following: design, setup, installation, and implementation of databases in large scale environments; routine database maintenance including backups, restores, re-indexing, integrity checks, jobs, alerts, processes, etc.
Experience with SQL coding and SQL tuning for optimum performance of queries.
Self-sufficiency and initiative working on database-related projects
Ability to implement and document database processes such as component migration, failover, and disaster recovery models
Effective communication skills.
The Data Management - Database Administration team is responsible for MSSQL, Oracle, MySQL, Sybase, and PostgreSQL platforms in addition to Cloud environments such as AWS database Services. Any additional experience with these other platforms is a plus.
Working Environment
Activities are primarily performed in a regular, climate controlled office setting subject to extended periods of sitting, standing, walking.
Use office equipment including a desktop computer.
Lift up to 20 pounds.
Communicate to perform essential duties.
Regular review of completed tasks.
Department Statement
The University Technology Office (UTO) embraces its role as both an enabler and catalyst for advancing the vision and work of the New American University. We are a values-driven organization. Our commitments are reflected in all of the work we do in pursuit of operational excellence, the experience and delight of our community, and our strategic and innovation initiatives.
ASU Statement
Arizona State University is a new model for American higher education, an unprecedented combination of academic excellence, entrepreneurial energy and broad access. This New American University is a single, unified institution comprising four differentiated campuses positively impacting the economic, social, cultural and environmental health of the communities it serves. Its research is inspired by real world application blurring the boundaries that traditionally separate academic disciplines. ASU serves more than 100,000 students in metropolitan Phoenix, Arizona, the nation's fifth largest city. ASU champions intellectual and cultural diversity, and welcomes students from all fifty states and more than one hundred nations across the globe.

Black Knight is the premier provider of integrated technology, services, data and analytics that lenders and servicers look to first to help successfully manage the entire loan life cycle. Our deep understanding of regulatory and compliance issues complements the knowledge, technology and solutions we offer to help our clients achieve their business goals. Black Knight offers leading software systems; data and analytics offerings; and information solutions that facilitate and automate many of the business processes across the mortgage life cycle.
JOB FAMILY DESCRIPTION
Provides support to and maintains multiple production and/or non-production databases of significant and/or strategic impact across the enterprise. Responsible for standards and design of physical data storage, maintenance, access and security administration.
GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Performs backup and recovery on Database Management Systems, configures database parameters and prototype designs against logical data models, and defines data repository requirements, data dictionaries and warehousing requirements.
Optimizes database access and allocates/re-allocates database resources for optimum configuration, database performance and cost.
Ensures service level agreements are met for internal and external clients.
Provides status reports that detail issues for escalation to management.
Performs configuration, scripting, analysis, installation, monitoring, administration and tuning for database management systems.
Required to participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation.
Weekend work – Related to on-call and Company/Application Initiative’s and/or deployments
Performs data analysis to provide management with timely and accurate information and predict future requirements
Develops, implements and tests database backup and recovery policies and procedures.
Creates and maintains documentation for database policies, procedures, and processes.
Performs/schedules routine maintenance on databases to keep them running at peak performance.
Monitors database performance, availability, and capacity.
Participates in continuous business process redesign to improve internal operations.
Interfaces with user departments remotely and on-site to assist in the implementation of work requests and provide operational support.
Troubleshoots issues and recommends solutions.
Performs other duties as required.
EDUCATIONAL GUIDELINES
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.
GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Knowledge of database management systems.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment with minimal supervision.
Must be self-motivated, a team player, and have a strong track record in customer satisfaction.
Thorough database design and analysis skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to learn and apply new skills in a constantly changing technical environment.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of SQL and SQL performance and tuning.
Knowledge of UNIX platforms.
Experience with scripting languages.
Ability to monitor and tune databases and instances.
Ability to maintain and monitor availability, security, and integrity of databases.
Knowledge of backup and recovery operations for database management systems.
Demonstrated experience with successful system and project implementations.
Ability to adapt to the use of new software tools as they are acquired or adopted within IT.
Focused on production and customer needs.
Knowledge of relational database concepts and terminology.
Knowledge of programming with TSQL, PowerShell and similar scripting languages.
Knowledge of High Availability and Encryption.
Knowledge of tools like UIM/DPA/Splunk/Password Managers.
Interested in learning new skills/platforms, i.e., Job Schedulers, Open-Source Databases, etc.
Database Administrator II
Intermediate professional level role. Supports multiple services and multiple databases of medium to high complexity (complexity defined by database size, technology used, systems feeds and interfaces) with multiple concurrent users, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility of data. Works on multiple projects as a project leader or sometimes as a project advisor. May coach more junior technical staff. Typically requires four
(4) or more years of experience working with various database management systems in database design, testing, implementation, maintenance and administration in a multiple platform environment.
Although target pay range may vary by work location, a representative pay range is $63,910 to $87,880. Eligible to participate in medical, dental and vision insurance, life insurance and disability insurance, 401(k) plan and employee stock purchase plan. Eligible to participate in the discretionary annual performance bonus.
Black Knight is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, and protected veteran or military family status. Our employees’ diversity is our strength, and when we embrace our differences, it makes us better and brighter. Black Knight’s commitment to inclusion is at the core of who we are, and motivates us in how we do business each and every day.
Location:
Remote
Time Type:
Full time

WebMD is the most recognized and trusted brand of health information and the leading provider of health information services, serving consumers, physicians, healthcare professionals, employers and health plans through our public and private online portals and WebMD the Magazine. The WebMD Health Network includes WebMD, Medscape, MedicineNet, eMedicine, RxList, theheart.org and Medscape Education. Our consumer portals and mobile health applications provide engaging, relevant and credible health and wellness information, personalized health assessment tools and access to online communities.


WebMD is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ancestry, color, religion, sex, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, medical condition, disability, veterans status, or any other basis protected by law.

WebMD’s Data Management team is looking for a Database Administrator with a passion for data and Devops. You don’t need to be a doctor to work the data at WebMD but will be able to diagnose and solve any data problems. We support databases that can respond in milliseconds or aggregate billions of rows in seconds. We manage and support data warehouses, data lakes, data marts. Our databases include both old schools and pioneers. Postgres, MySQL, MS SQL Server, MongoDB, InfluxDB, Vertica, Hadoop and Oracle are all in our territory.
This is your chance to use what you just learned in the real world. You probably coded in Java or Python, we use them. You probably had to write a Spark project; we manage them. You may stay up all night to wrap up a project with SQL or JavaScript. That’s fantastic. We need them.
As an Apprentice you will be paid $20/hr for your first 6 months and then based on performance you will be offered a full time salaried position with us.

IKO Industries Ltd. is a market leader in the manufacturing of roofing and building materials. IKO is a Canadian owned and operated business with production facilities worldwide and has many years of unparalleled success in the roofing materials industry. Quality, integrity, and trustworthiness are the values that underlie this success, and we have built this company by hiring people who hold these values. People like you!

Job Description
The Database Administrator will support both operational and project related activities and maintain defined IT standards at all global IKO locations. The scope includes designing, developing, installing, monitoring, maintaining, and performance tuning of all MS SQL/Oracle databases while ensuring high levels of data availability. Incumbent will apply excellent communication, problem-solving, change management, and database skills to ensure the IKO Database and related operations are accurate, up-to-date, available, secure, and performing as the business requires.

• Participate in projects as required
• Available to work after hours as needed for high impact incidents and project cutover activities
• Develop and maintain Disaster Recovery Procedures and participate in DR testing

• Work collaboratively with Developers

The Database Administrator I or II will perform administrative and technical duties in support of Geology and Engineering data sets. Work assignments are sophisticated in nature, where considerable judgment, tact, accuracy, and initiative are required in resolving problems of a technical nature.
At NGM, we are committed to a safe work environment sending every person home safe and healthy every day and leaving a sustainable legacy on our host communities. About Nevada Gold Mines
Nevada Gold Mines (NGM) is a joint venture between Barrick (61.5%) and Newmont (38.5%) that combined our significant assets across Nevada in 2019 to create the single largest gold-producing complex in the world. NGM produces approximately 3.5 million ounces of gold a year. The massive mining operation comprises eight mines along with their associated infrastructure and processing facilities and hosts three of Barrick’s Tier One assets: Carlin, Cortez, and Turquoise Ridge. At NGM, our mission is to be the world’s most valued gold mining business by finding, developing, and owning the best assets, with the best people, to deliver sustainable returns for our owners and partners.

Job Title: Information Technology Specialist 15 - Oracle Database Admin...
Description:
Job Description
The Department of Technology, Management and Budget supports the business operations of the state agencies through a variety of services including Information Technology project delivery, maintenance and support. This position is with the Agency Services area of DTMB.
We are looking for a person who understands the value of public service and wants to help us meet the needs of our citizens. Above all, we are looking for someone that is passionate about database administration. This person must be able to communicate effectively both orally and written with other analysts, project managers and with the user both listening and lending professional advice. This person must be able to work in a team focused environment.

This position is responsible for developing Oracle Database environment standards, policies and procedures pertaining to database installations and configurations, database security, database integrity, database high availability and disaster recovery, and database software version upgrades. This position also provides design, planning and technical support (installation, upgrade, maintenance, etc.) and oversight of all Oracle database platforms for Michigan Department of Treasury and Bureau of State Lottery environments to ensure systems high availability for critical Treasury and Lottery revenue producing applications. These systems have both Treasury, Lottery, Agency Service and SOM internal and external components and interfaces, including interfaces with various state departments, federal government, and other states. This position is responsible for providing Database Administration for Treasury. Lottery and assists with the continued support, upgrade, migration and maintenance of these systems. This position is responsible for resolving issues escalated by junior level DBAs related to database security, performance tuning, availability, and advanced database backup/recovery. This position also assists with setting enterprise database standards as well as evaluate new database platforms and technologies.
If you are a self-motivated person who wants a challenge and to work in a high paced environment, we are really interested in hearing from you.
The state of Michigan offers a competitive work experience that includes a tuition reduction program at several key higher education institutes if you would like to advance your education, good benefits, excellent vacation and sick time policies and an ability to successfully juggle your work and family life. We would like the opportunity to share with you more about the benefits of working for the state and joining the state of Michigan employee family if you are interested. Please consider sending in your application today.
ITS 15 - Oracle DBA Position Description
Required Education and Experience
**Please submit a copy of your official college transcripts with your application. **
Education
Possession of a bachelor's degree with at least 21 semester (32 term) credits in one or a combination of the following: computer science, data processing, computer information systems, data communications, networking, systems analysis, computer programming, information assurance, IT project management or mathematics.

Experience
Information Technology Specialist 15
Three years of professional experience equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst P11 or one year equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst 12.
Alternate Education and Experience
An associate's degree with 16 semester (24 term) credits in one or a combination of the following: computer science, data processing, computer information systems, data communications, networking, systems analysis, computer programming, mathematics or equivalent; and at least two years of experience as an application programmer, computer operator, or information technology technician and four years of professional experience equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst P11 or one year equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst 12.
OR
At least an educational level typically acquired through the completion of high school and at least three years of experience as an application programmer, computer operator, or information technology technician and four years of professional experience equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst P11 or one year equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst 12.
Additional Requirements and Information
This position has a FTINPRINT sub-class code. The sub-class code indicates the position has access to Federal Tax Information (FTI) and requires passing of a fingerprint-based background check per IRS Publication 1075.
If applicable, attach copies of official college transcripts to your application. (Internet version of transcripts will not be accepted). Failure to attach applicable transcripts may result in your application being screened out.
Your application for any position does not guarantee that you will be contacted by the Department/Agency for further consideration. Only those applicants interviewed will be notified of the results.
The department reserves the right to close this posting prior to its original end date once a sufficient number of applications have been received.
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

Certain positions may be assigned subclass codes and individuals appointed must possess the required specialized experience.

Position Summary
Create database structures that consolidate the conceptual, logical and physical models of data stored by the City; improve the quality, accuracy and integrity of information and data resources; maintain an enterprise-level, inter-departmental data model consisting of a subject data model and a conceptual entity relationship model; implement policies and standards for data modeling, conceptual database design, as well as data naming and meta data documentation standards; install, maintain, monitor and tune database management systems to ensure optimal performance and perform a variety of technical tasks relative to assigned area of responsibility.

Job descriptions are intended to present a general list of tasks/duties performed by employees within this job classification. Job Descriptions are not intended to reflect all duties performed within the job.
Minimum Education, Experience And Additional Requirements
Education and experience directly related to the minimum requirements below may be interchangeable on a year for year basis.

Master's degree from an accredited college or university in information systems, or computer science; and

Two (2) years of experience in database administration or computer programming.

Oracle Database or Microsoft Database certification preferred.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Possession of a Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) certification within 6 months of hire.

Possession of a valid New Mexico Driver's License, or the ability to obtain by date of hire.

Possession of a City Operator's Permit (COP) within six (6) months from date of hire.
Preferred Knowledge
Advanced principles and practices of database administration
Advanced methods and techniques of database design and administration
Methods and techniques of data modeling and conceptual database design
Methods and techniques of applications development and common development languages
Principles and practices of software installation
Operational characteristics of applicable database management system, information systems and mainframe environments
Principles and practices of project management
Apply data security principles to creating and maintaining secure databases
Understand ITIL techniques and principles

Preferred Skills & Abilities
Develop and modify database models based on City needs
Perform various database administration functions
Develop standards and methodologies for use of the City's database management system
Develop and maintain data and entity relationship models
Evaluate, implement, maintain and train others in the use of data modeling tools
Participate in systems analysis, design and implementation
Monitor and troubleshoot database performance
Communicate clearly and concisely
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of work
Perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation
Coordinate the work of lower level staff

Job Summary:
The Sr. DBA position works on a central team of Database Systems Engineers and Administrators supporting DBMS for Disney Connected, Advanced Technologies and corporate development teams and customers. Primary focus of this position will be Database support and service of operational and business processes for internet sites and corporate applications for The Walt Disney Company. Key responsibilities include DB technology evaluation, guidance and consultation, design support, task automation and scripting, best practice and standards development, capacity planning, optimization and tuning, system upgrades and migrations, performance management, monitoring, security, backup and recovery, issue troubleshooting, and documentation. Additional tasks as assigned.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for level 1 systems management and exercises project-level control over initiatives. Excellent technical expertise in relevant state of the art database technologies, stores, systems, and design. Carries out assignments with minimal coaching and guidance from others. Develops, enhances and adheres to engineering and administration standards. Upholds and maintains strong documentation.

The ideal candidate will have experience with Pubic Cloud providers like AWS and Azure and 4-6 years experience with DB2. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience is a plus.

Basic Qualifications:
4-6 years experience with DB2 is strongly preferred. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience, or similar relational database systems, is a plus.
4-6 years’ experience with Linux Server platforms and/or Windows Server
4-6 years’ experience with relevant scripting languages or programming frameworks desired (NodeJS, JavaScript, Python, Perl, C, windows script; PowerShell, sh, korne, bash)
Expertise in relational database administration including configuration, implementation, data modeling, maintenance, redundancy/HA/DR, security, troubleshooting/performance tuning, upgrades, database, data and server migrations, SQL
2 or more years of IT operational experience supporting robust e-commerce, gaming or online businesses in a 24X7 production environment (on call)
Thorough understanding in Security implementations (IAM, SSL, encryption, firewall, wall garden) on Database, storage, network and Cloud environments. Participated in auditing exercise
Knowledge in 1 or more Cloud Platforms including but not limited to: AWS, Azure, GCP, Oracle Cloud and hybrid cloud environments
Knowledge in Monitoring, Alerting tools such as Datadog, Cloudwatch, OEM, Quest
Expertise in configuring, implementing and supporting high availability redundancy strategies on systems including replication, clustering, log shipping, mirroring
Expertise in database design and architectural principles and methodologies
Expertise with Disaster Recovery planning and implementation
Experience with Linux system administration, configuration, troubleshooting, performance tuning, and security procedures; experience with Windows desired
Excellent knowledge of hardware, storage, RAID, and disk subsystems technologies as they pertain to DBMS systems, experience with SAN technologies highly desired
Excellent systems documentation and system diagraming skills
Experience with project management methodologies and handling complex projects
Ability to partner with relevant software vendors to determine near-term, long-term business impacts of product updates on our technology portfolio
Demonstrated experience with troubleshooting systems issues and effectively diagnosing problems
Knowledge of understanding of TCP/IP fundamentals (DNS, SSH), general networking technologies, AWS networking (VPC, security group), network architecture and connectivity troubleshooting
Preferred Qualifications:
Leads and completes tasks independently, with attention to detail and while under pressure
Excellent judgment, problem resolution, negotiation, and decision-making skills as well as the ability to work under continual deadline pressure
Identifies, analyzes, and drives problems to resolution, handling complex issues simultaneously while effectively communicating across teams
Builds team relationships across the organization
Effectively communicates technical actions and expectations to the appropriate audience
Delivers customer service excellence by knowing customer’s business needs, identifying appropriate technical solutions, and meeting/exceeding service expectations
Knowledge in 1 or more relevant areas including but not limited to: Cloud Computing, Internet Security, Hardware systems, Networking systems, Storage technologies, Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence, Data Center Facilities, Ecommerce platforms are desired
Required Education
Degree in computer science/information systems, engineering or related field required.

Preferred Education
Bachelor of Science in computer science/information systems, engineering or related field preferred.

Company Name: Virginia Dept of Agri & Cons Services
Description:
Black Knight is the premier provider of integrated technology, services, data and analytics that lenders and servicers look to first to help successfully manage the entire loan life cycle. Our deep understanding of regulatory and compliance issues complements the knowledge, technology and solutions we offer to help our clients achieve their business goals. Black Knight offers leading software systems; data and analytics offerings; and information solutions that facilitate and automate many of the business processes across the mortgage life cycle.
JOB FAMILY DESCRIPTION
Provides support to and maintains multiple production and/or non-production databases of significant and/or strategic impact across the enterprise. Responsible for standards and design of physical data storage, maintenance, access and security administration.
GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Performs backup and recovery on Database Management Systems, configures database parameters and prototype designs against logical data models, and defines data repository requirements, data dictionaries and warehousing requirements.
Optimizes database access and allocates/re-allocates database resources for optimum configuration, database performance and cost.
Ensures service level agreements are met for internal and external clients.
Provides status reports that detail issues for escalation to management.
Performs configuration, scripting, analysis, installation, monitoring, administration and tuning for database management systems.
Required to participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation.
Weekend work – Related to on-call and Company/Application Initiative’s and/or deployments
Performs data analysis to provide management with timely and accurate information and predict future requirements
Develops, implements and tests database backup and recovery policies and procedures.
Creates and maintains documentation for database policies, procedures, and processes.
Performs/schedules routine maintenance on databases to keep them running at peak performance.
Monitors database performance, availability, and capacity.
Participates in continuous business process redesign to improve internal operations.
Interfaces with user departments remotely and on-site to assist in the implementation of work requests and provide operational support.
Troubleshoots issues and recommends solutions.
Performs other duties as required.
EDUCATIONAL GUIDELINES
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.
GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Knowledge of database management systems.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment with minimal supervision.
Must be self-motivated, a team player, and have a strong track record in customer satisfaction.
Thorough database design and analysis skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to learn and apply new skills in a constantly changing technical environment.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of SQL and SQL performance and tuning.
Knowledge of UNIX platforms.
Experience with scripting languages.
Ability to monitor and tune databases and instances.
Ability to maintain and monitor availability, security, and integrity of databases.
Knowledge of backup and recovery operations for database management systems.
Demonstrated experience with successful system and project implementations.
Ability to adapt to the use of new software tools as they are acquired or adopted within IT.
Focused on production and customer needs.
Knowledge of relational database concepts and terminology.
Knowledge of programming with TSQL, PowerShell and similar scripting languages.
Knowledge of High Availability and Encryption.
Knowledge of tools like UIM/DPA/Splunk/Password Managers.
Interested in learning new skills/platforms, i.e., Job Schedulers, Open-Source Databases, etc.
Database Administrator II
Intermediate professional level role. Supports multiple services and multiple databases of medium to high complexity (complexity defined by database size, technology used, systems feeds and interfaces) with multiple concurrent users, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility of data. Works on multiple projects as a project leader or sometimes as a project advisor. May coach more junior technical staff. Typically requires four
(4) or more years of experience working with various database management systems in database design, testing, implementation, maintenance and administration in a multiple platform environment.
Although target pay range may vary by work location, a representative pay range is $63,910 to $87,880. Eligible to participate in medical, dental and vision insurance, life insurance and disability insurance, 401(k) plan and employee stock purchase plan. Eligible to participate in the discretionary annual performance bonus.

Black Knight’s commitment to inclusion is at the core of who we are, and motivates us in how we do business each and every day.

Required Education and Experience
**Please submit a copy of your official college transcripts with your application. **
Education
Possession of a bachelor's degree with at least 21 semester (32 term) credits in one or a combination of the following: computer science, data processing, computer information systems, data communications, networking, systems analysis, computer programming, information assurance, IT project management or mathematics.

Experience
Information Technology Specialist 15
Three years of professional experience equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst P11 or one year equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst 12.
Alternate Education and Experience
An associate's degree with 16 semester (24 term) credits in one or a combination of the following: computer science, data processing, computer information systems, data communications, networking, systems analysis, computer programming, mathematics or equivalent; and at least two years of experience as an application programmer, computer operator, or information technology technician and four years of professional experience equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst P11 or one year equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst 12.
OR
At least an educational level typically acquired through the completion of high school and at least three years of experience as an application programmer, computer operator, or information technology technician and four years of professional experience equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst P11 or one year equivalent to an Information Technology Infrastructure or Programmer/Analyst 12.
Additional Requirements and Information
This position has a FTINPRINT sub-class code. The sub-class code indicates the position has access to Federal Tax Information (FTI) and requires passing of a fingerprint-based background check per IRS Publication 1075.
If applicable, attach copies of official college transcripts to your application. (Internet version of transcripts will not be accepted). Failure to attach applicable transcripts may result in your application being screened out.
Your application for any position does not guarantee that you will be contacted by the Department/Agency for further consideration. Only those applicants interviewed will be notified of the results.
The department reserves the right to close this posting prior to its original end date once a sufficient number of applications have been received.

Why Mayo Clinic

Mayo Clinic is the nation's best hospital (U.S. News & World Report, 2020-2021) and ranked #1 in more specialties than any other care provider. We have a vast array of opportunities ranging from Nursing, Clinical, to Finance, IT, Administrative, Research and Support Services to name a few. Across all locations, you’ll find career opportunities that support diversity, equity and inclusion. At Mayo Clinic, we invest in you with opportunities for growth and development and our benefits and compensation package are highly competitive. We invite you to be a part of our team where you’ll discover a culture of teamwork, professionalism, mutual respect, and most importantly, a life-changing career!


Mayo Clinic offers a variety of employee benefits. For additional information please visit Mayo Clinic Benefits. Eligibility may vary.

Position description

The Oracle DBA Team has an opening for an experienced Oracle Systems DBA capable of supporting enterprise class systems and applications. We are seeking someone with Oracle DBA experience, ability to troubleshoot complex problems, works well with ambiguity, has excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills coupled with a strong desire to deliver great service and results. Candidates will need the ability to work across multiple teams, interface with leadership & vendors, build consensus towards goals, and advise customers on the use of Oracle tools. Additional skills such as experience with operating systems, networks, Cloud technologies, and programming or scripting are desired.
Under general supervision and guidance, the IT Systems DBA is responsible for the maintenance and support of moderately complex Database systems software at multiple Mayo Clinic sites. Actively monitor and respond to technical database problems utilizing diagnostic testing tools and techniques as well as assist in managing overall database capacity. Interface with vendor support service groups or other external support teams to ensure proper escalation during outages or periods of degraded system performance. Expected to contribute to the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of custom databases, and/or the installation and maintenance of purchased databases, plus the configuration and support of DBMS applications across Mayo Clinic; produce and maintain documentation such as systems requirements, designs, resource inventories and plans as requested by the work unit leadership. Work will be reviewed for quality, timeliness, and adequacy at predetermined milestones. Demonstrated ability to take responsibility and accountability for managing work with little or no direct supervision. Demonstrated ability to multi-task and prioritize issues appropriately. Must possess human relations skills to interact effectively with a variety of personnel at multiple sites. Develops and maintains effective relationships with the IT technical staff and management across all Mayo sites in the support of multiple projects simultaneously.

Qualifications

This position requires a Bachelor’s degree and training experience in Systems DBA or an Associate’s degree

plus 3 years of demonstrated technical experience as a Systems DBA. A high school diploma and 5 years of

demonstrated IT technical experience as a professional Systems DBA at a large, complex organization like

Mayo may be considered in lieu of the degree.

Additional qualifications

A Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, engineering or related field preferred; a

Master's degree in a relevant technical discipline helpful. At least one DBMS platform certification is preferred. Experience working in healthcare technology a real plus. Qualified candidates should have knowledge of system design principles, software development methodologies, project management methodologies, and some computer programming and/or system support experience. Exposure to managing both custom developed and vendor-supplied applications helpful. A working knowledge of the following is preferred: Client/Server application architecture, Clustering, VB and scripting tools; MS SQL Server, Oracle, My SQL, DB2 or Sybase; Web Architecture including HTML,JavaScript, Active Server Pages (ASP), PHP; Network topologies and protocols e.g. IEEE 802.3, 802.11a/b/g,802.1x, TCP/IP;SAN, NAS, virtualized storage environments. Proficient verbal and written communication skills using English.

Exemption status

Exempt

Compensation Detail

Required education, experience, and tenure may be considered along with internal equity when job offers are extended. The salary range every 2 weeks is approx. $3,171.00 - $4,439.00 based on a full-time position.

Benefits eligible

Yes

Schedule

Full Time

Hours / Pay period

80

Schedule details

Monday - Friday 8am to 5pm with flexibility for after hours maintenance and support.

Weekend schedule

Will be a part of an on-call rotation.

Remote

Yes

International Assignment

No

Site description

Mayo Clinic is located in the heart of downtown Rochester, Minnesota, a vibrant, friendly city that provides a highly livable environment for more than 34,000 Mayo staff and students. The city is consistently ranked among the best places to live in the United States because of its affordable cost of living, healthy lifestyle, excellent school systems and exceptionally high quality of life.

Shelly Weir

Black Knight is the premier provider of integrated technology, services, data and analytics that lenders and servicers look to first to help successfully manage the entire loan life cycle. Our deep understanding of regulatory and compliance issues complements the knowledge, technology and solutions we offer to help our clients achieve their business goals. Black Knight offers leading software systems; data and analytics offerings; and information solutions that facilitate and automate many of the business processes across the mortgage life cycle.
JOB FAMILY DESCRIPTION
Provides support to and maintains multiple production and/or non-production databases of significant and/or strategic impact across the enterprise. Responsible for standards and design of physical data storage, maintenance, access and security administration.
GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Performs backup and recovery on Database Management Systems, configures database parameters and prototype designs against logical data models, and defines data repository requirements, data dictionaries and warehousing requirements.
Optimizes database access and allocates/re-allocates database resources for optimum configuration, database performance and cost.
Ensures service level agreements are met for internal and external clients.
Provides status reports that detail issues for escalation to management.
Performs configuration, scripting, analysis, installation, monitoring, administration and tuning for database management systems.
Required to participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation.
Weekend work – Related to on-call and Company/Application Initiative’s and/or deployments
Performs data analysis to provide management with timely and accurate information and predict future requirements
Develops, implements and tests database backup and recovery policies and procedures.
Creates and maintains documentation for database policies, procedures, and processes.
Performs/schedules routine maintenance on databases to keep them running at peak performance.
Monitors database performance, availability, and capacity.
Participates in continuous business process redesign to improve internal operations.
Interfaces with user departments remotely and on-site to assist in the implementation of work requests and provide operational support.
Troubleshoots issues and recommends solutions.
Performs other duties as required.
EDUCATIONAL GUIDELINES
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.
GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Knowledge of database management systems.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment with minimal supervision.
Must be self-motivated, a team player, and have a strong track record in customer satisfaction.
Thorough database design and analysis skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to learn and apply new skills in a constantly changing technical environment.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of SQL and SQL performance and tuning.
Knowledge of UNIX platforms.
Experience with scripting languages.
Ability to monitor and tune databases and instances.
Ability to maintain and monitor availability, security, and integrity of databases.
Knowledge of backup and recovery operations for database management systems.
Demonstrated experience with successful system and project implementations.
Ability to adapt to the use of new software tools as they are acquired or adopted within IT.
Focused on production and customer needs.
Knowledge of relational database concepts and terminology.
Knowledge of programming with TSQL, PowerShell and similar scripting languages.
Knowledge of High Availability and Encryption.
Knowledge of tools like UIM/DPA/Splunk/Password Managers.
Interested in learning new skills/platforms, i.e., Job Schedulers, Open-Source Databases, etc.
Database Administrator II
Intermediate professional level role. Supports multiple services and multiple databases of medium to high complexity (complexity defined by database size, technology used, systems feeds and interfaces) with multiple concurrent users, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility of data. Works on multiple projects as a project leader or sometimes as a project advisor. May coach more junior technical staff. Typically requires four
(4) or more years of experience working with various database management systems in database design, testing, implementation, maintenance and administration in a multiple platform environment.
Although target pay range may vary by work location, a representative pay range is $63,910 to $87,880. Eligible to participate in medical, dental and vision insurance, life insurance and disability insurance, 401(k) plan and employee stock purchase plan. Eligible to participate in the discretionary annual performance bonus.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, and protected veteran or military family status. Our employees’ diversity is our strength, and when we embrace our differences, it makes us better and brighter. Black Knight’s commitment to inclusion is at the core of who we are, and motivates us in how we do business each and every day.
Location:
Remote
Time Type:
Full time

Job Title: CO - P6044 - PREP GIS/Data Projects Administrator
Description:
The Agency:

Do you desire a career that provides you with opportunities to improve the world around you? The Virginia Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) is seeking diverse individuals from all backgrounds to apply for a career position that will make a direct impact on improving the lives of Virginia citizens. At DEQ, our Mission is to protect and enhance Virginia’s environment, and promote the health and well-being of all citizens in the Commonwealth. Our Vision is that all Virginians enjoy cleaner water, better air quality, and the productive reuse of land that was once contaminated.

What you will be doing:

The Virginia Department of Environmental Quality Office of Pollution Response and Emergency Preparedness (PREP) seeks a qualified individual to manage the development, modification and maintenance of the program databases and information technology projects. The selected candidate will ensure the integrity of program data and technology solutions by evaluating data for timeliness, completeness and accuracy; identifying, developing and providing data systems training; providing technical support to program staff and agency programs that use the PREP technologies; developing data queries to support program operations and strategic planning; maintaining program GIS data layers and fact sheets for external and internal GIS viewers; providing GIS support to the PREP program for exercises and incidents; providing GIS support to agency VEST role; managing the DEQ STARS radios program; providing support for and evaluation of program technology solutions; supporting contracting and cost recovery associated with environmental emergency cleanups; supporting the DEQ Alerts system; maintaining PREP program internal and external web pages. The position serves as PREP Program business analyst; serves as the program representative on the DEQ GIS Expert Panel; serves as a STARS User Agency Requirements Committee (UARC) representative; serves as a program web author; and serves as a DEQ Alerts system administrator.

Environmental Specialist II (PREP GIS/Data Projects Administrator), #P6044
Richmond, Virginia
Minimum Starting Salary: $48,391 – Negotiable Based on Experience


Minimum Qualifications
The successful candidate will possess considerable knowledge of federal/state environmental laws and regulations, database management and GIS applications. Key competencies to include:

Environmental science
Program management
Problem solving and decision making
PC operations, database and data analysis operations
ArcGIS Online, ESRI Survey 123, ArcGIS Desktop, R programming language, and Emergency Alert System administration
Training development and delivery
Excellent verbal and written communications
Effective organization skills


Why DEQ?

DEQ employs a wide range of professionals in varying fields – from engineers and scientists to information technology and communications specialists. All positions work collectively toward one goal: safeguarding Virginia’s diverse and abundant natural resources, which benefit agriculture, industry, and commerce, and provide a rich environment for people, plants, and wildlife. If you seek to be a part of this Mission, Vision, and culture, while also enjoying a wide range of state benefits, we encourage you to join today. To learn more about our agency, please visit our website at: https://www.deq.virginia.gov.

Preferred Qualifications
Degree from an accredited college or university in natural or environmental science, GIS, or related field. A combination of education, experience, and training may substitute for a degree. Complete or provide certification of previous completion of the following National Incident Management (NIMS) courses: ICS-100, ICS-200.

Special Requirements
The Commonwealth does not provide sponsorship; therefore, applicants must be a citizen or national of the U.S., a Lawful Permanent Resident, or an alien authorized to work.

Excluding current DEQ Employees, the Selected Candidate MUST pass a criminal background check.

Special Instructions to Applicants
For consideration for this position, candidates MUST apply online at https://virginiajobs.peopleadmin.com. Applicants are encouraged to be specific regarding job-related knowledge, skills, and abilities. Resumes are encouraged but do not substitute submittal of the online application. Applications submitted via postal mail, email, or fax will not be considered. An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

Name Yolanda Powell

Phone 804-698-4110

Fax 804-698-4083

Email yolanda.powell@deq.virginia.gov

Address
1111 E. Main Street, Suite 1400
Richmond, VA 23219

Job Summary:
The Sr. DBA position works on a central team of Database Systems Engineers and Administrators supporting DBMS for Disney Connected, Advanced Technologies and corporate development teams and customers. Primary focus of this position will be Database support and service of operational and business processes for internet sites and corporate applications for The Walt Disney Company. Key responsibilities include DB technology evaluation, guidance and consultation, design support, task automation and scripting, best practice and standards development, capacity planning, optimization and tuning, system upgrades and migrations, performance management, monitoring, security, backup and recovery, issue troubleshooting, and documentation. Additional tasks as assigned.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for level 1 systems management and exercises project-level control over initiatives. Excellent technical expertise in relevant state of the art database technologies, stores, systems, and design. Carries out assignments with minimal coaching and guidance from others. Develops, enhances and adheres to engineering and administration standards. Upholds and maintains strong documentation.

The ideal candidate will have experience with Pubic Cloud providers like AWS and Azure and 4-6 years experience with DB2. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience is a plus.

Basic Qualifications:
4-6 years experience with DB2 is strongly preferred. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience, or similar relational database systems, is a plus.
4-6 years’ experience with Linux Server platforms and/or Windows Server
4-6 years’ experience with relevant scripting languages or programming frameworks desired (NodeJS, JavaScript, Python, Perl, C, windows script; PowerShell, sh, korne, bash)
Expertise in relational database administration including configuration, implementation, data modeling, maintenance, redundancy/HA/DR, security, troubleshooting/performance tuning, upgrades, database, data and server migrations, SQL
2 or more years of IT operational experience supporting robust e-commerce, gaming or online businesses in a 24X7 production environment (on call)
Thorough understanding in Security implementations (IAM, SSL, encryption, firewall, wall garden) on Database, storage, network and Cloud environments. Participated in auditing exercise
Knowledge in 1 or more Cloud Platforms including but not limited to: AWS, Azure, GCP, Oracle Cloud and hybrid cloud environments
Knowledge in Monitoring, Alerting tools such as Datadog, Cloudwatch, OEM, Quest
Expertise in configuring, implementing and supporting high availability redundancy strategies on systems including replication, clustering, log shipping, mirroring
Expertise in database design and architectural principles and methodologies
Expertise with Disaster Recovery planning and implementation
Experience with Linux system administration, configuration, troubleshooting, performance tuning, and security procedures; experience with Windows desired
Excellent knowledge of hardware, storage, RAID, and disk subsystems technologies as they pertain to DBMS systems, experience with SAN technologies highly desired
Excellent systems documentation and system diagraming skills
Experience with project management methodologies and handling complex projects
Ability to partner with relevant software vendors to determine near-term, long-term business impacts of product updates on our technology portfolio
Demonstrated experience with troubleshooting systems issues and effectively diagnosing problems
Knowledge of understanding of TCP/IP fundamentals (DNS, SSH), general networking technologies, AWS networking (VPC, security group), network architecture and connectivity troubleshooting
Preferred Qualifications:
Leads and completes tasks independently, with attention to detail and while under pressure
Excellent judgment, problem resolution, negotiation, and decision-making skills as well as the ability to work under continual deadline pressure
Identifies, analyzes, and drives problems to resolution, handling complex issues simultaneously while effectively communicating across teams
Builds team relationships across the organization
Effectively communicates technical actions and expectations to the appropriate audience
Delivers customer service excellence by knowing customer’s business needs, identifying appropriate technical solutions, and meeting/exceeding service expectations
Knowledge in 1 or more relevant areas including but not limited to: Cloud Computing, Internet Security, Hardware systems, Networking systems, Storage technologies, Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence, Data Center Facilities, Ecommerce platforms are desired
Required Education
Degree in computer science/information systems, engineering or related field required.

Preferred Education
Bachelor of Science in computer science/information systems, engineering or related field preferred.

Job Title: IT Database Administrator - Work From Home
Description:
As a leading provider of human capital solutions, we help our clients and their people navigate the complexity of health, wealth and HR. We combine data-driven, consumer-centered technology with personalized care and service to deliver a superior customer experience. Our dedicated colleagues across 28 global centers help 23 million people and their 11 million family members simplify work and life, both now and in the future. At Alight, we are reimagining how people and organizations thrive.
Alight Solutions LLC is looking for an entry level IT Database Administrator who is highly motivated, responsible and a detail-oriented team player. This individual will perform normal operational activities and level 1 triaging for internal customers leveraging multiple database platforms.
Minimum of 3 years of experience with platforms like Oracle / SQL Server / PostgreSQL
Database skills
Proficient with query tools like Toad, AQT, MS SQL Studio, etc.
Proficient in database data migration tools ex: Data Pump / Export-Import
Strong knowledge of indexes, index management, integrity checks, configuration, patching
Comprehension of database performance tuning and security
Understanding of HA/DR strategies and approaches related to DB platforms
Experience with other DB platforms like MongoDB / NoSQL desired.
Other technical proficiencies
Experience in navigating RHEL or other Unix platforms
Exposure to monitoring tools like New Relic, OEM, Idera, Mongo Ops Manager
Proficient with backup and restore utilities such as NetBackup, S3 specific to databases
Able to troubleshoot automation scripts like Shell scripting, PL/SQL
Able to troubleshoot using basic Linux commands
Knowledge of public cloud platforms like Azure / AWS recommended
Comprehension of the ITIL framework and process required
Soft Skills required
Ability to problem solve atypical problems with critical thinking and analytic skills.
Possess a keen interest and have aptitude for learning new technologies within database technologies
Passionate for helping others and providing excellent customer support to all types of users
Must possess organizational proficiencies to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment with minimum supervision
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Primary Responsibilities
Work with multiple infrastructure teams to ensure platforms are properly vetted and documented thoroughly for operational readiness
Identify enhancement opportunities to optimize existing processes via database technology improvements or enhanced automation technologies to reduce run-rate
Support DB platforms with nights/weekend on-call responsibilities
Formal Education & Certification
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Information System / Electronics Engineering or equivalent experience required
AWS Cloud experience and practitioner certification desired
ITIL Certification desired
Formal DBA certification welcomed
