The Database Analyst (DBA - Systems Analyst IV) focuses on providing deliverables through Oracle web-based applications used statewide in various stages of design, implementation, enhancement, and maintenance. Work involves programming, troubleshooting, customer support, planning, analyzing user requirements, procedures, and problems to maintain existing functionality, automate processing, and implement new functionality on existing systems. This position supports critical web-based enterprise systems and databases. Works under limited supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.


The DBA reports to the HHSC IT Administrative Applications Data Services Manager and is for U.S. Citizens or residents only.


Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.


Serves as junior Oracle database analyst. Performs mid-level Oracle systems development of applications and systems considering customer requirements, changes in systems requirements, software releases, equipment configurations, and relationships/dependencies between systems researching technical solutions, and performing assessment needs for HHSC and cross-agency solutions. (40%)


Converts information gathered from clients into functioning solutions. Provides technical assistance by responding to inquiries from others regarding errors, problems, or questions about programs. Serves as a Crystal Reports Developer by consulting with the users to gather information about program needs, objectives, functions, features, and input-output. (30%)


Assists with database and operating system patches by performing database-related shutdown and startup activities as well as testing connectivity. Supports Golden Gate replication. Monitors the replication components and may add new/modify objects for replication. (20%)


Makes presentations, and communicates technical information to all areas of management, customers, and technical and non-technical staff. (10 %)


Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) process for report development.

Knowledge of industry standards for databases such as Oracle and/or SQL Server.

Knowledge of Agile Methodologies (Scrum, for example).

Knowledge of software usability concepts.

Skilled in information technology equipment and computer systems.

Skill in writing and maintaining documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, changes, and corrections.

Skill in consulting with users to gather information about program needs, objectives, functions, features, and input-output requirements.

Skill in oral and written communications that convey technical analysis and data results in common business terms that management, executive, and non-technical customers can understand.

Skill in troubleshooting, performance tuning, Query Optimization and problem solving.

Ability to provide technical assistance by responding to inquiries from others regarding errors, problems, or questions about programs.

Ability to build consensus across multiple teams and working with teams located in different geographic locations.

Ability to provide excellent customer service.

Ability to learn and quickly comprehend new concepts.

Ability to accurately track time spent working on projects, as well the ability to accurately estimate changes or enhancements.

Ability to perform Root Cause Analysis.

Registration or Licensure Requirements:
None


Initial Selection Criteria:
Graduation from a four-year college or university with major coursework in business, communications, computer science, computer information systems, management information systems, or a related field. One year of appropriate experience may be substituted for the required education on a year-for-year basis.


Minimum of 4 (four) years of experience with Oracle.

Minimum of 3 (three) years of experience with SQL.

Minimum of 3 (three) years of experience with PL/SQL.

Experience with performance tuning/optimizing Queries, SQL or PL/SQL.

Experience working in an Enterprise Environment with large data sets.


Preferred experience as a DBA.

Preferred experience working in an Enterprise Environment with data sets.

Preferred experience with Oracle Golden Gate 11.x or above.

Preferred experience with Oracle RAC.

Preferred experience with Oracle Enterprise Manager (OEM).

Preferred experience with Reporting Tools such as Crystal Reports, Business Objects or Web Intelligence Report.

Requisition Number 498143


This position is for U.S. Citizens or residents only.

The Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services is seeking an experienced Database Administrator to support the ongoing implementation and support of complex technology solutions in an Oracle 12c database environment. The successful candidate will provide a technical role in maintaining VDACS Oracle databases and application servers to meet agency strategic goals, implementing effective support operations using agency approved technologies, and execute database administration tasks to maintain the agency’s database and application server capabilities. The incumbent will participate in Database Administration efforts on an ongoing basis. Additional duties include assisting in the design and planning of projects and standards, and supporting team efforts to continually improve skills and delivery practices. Telework, for up to two days per week, may be possible following an on-site training period, management approval, and in accordance with current policy.

Minimum Qualifications
Significant knowledge of and experience with administration of the Oracle database management systems (12c), database modeling, application architecture, performance monitoring and skills with tuning tools, techniques and utilities and knowledge of web-enabled computer paradigms, including web servers. Knowledge of web-enabled applications including Oracle Application Server/Weblogic, Oracle Application Express, HTML and PL/SQL. Basic knowledge of application testing techniques including application security. Proven skills to provide effective technical support for agency users and development staff in Oracle and Oracle related software. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to express complex technical information in user-friendly terminology; strong analytical and problem solving skills; effective time management and organizational skills; and an understanding of information and data security, access control theory, backup and recovery techniques. Ability to work independently and manage projects with minimal direction and to establish good working relationships with co-workers, the public, outside agencies, and vendors; to maintain technical documentation; and to use database management tools is essential. Demonstrated ability to provide timely, professional and courteous customer service is required. Current/recent experience DBA experience with Oracle 12c; experience patching Oracle database and related products, 12c or later; and experience working with information and data security, access control theory, backup and recovery techniques and security controls. H.S. Diploma/GED required.

Preferred Qualifications
Graduation from an accredited college or university with major study in Information Systems, Computer Science, mathematics, engineering or other related field. An equivalent combination of training and experience indicating possession of the preceding knowledge, skills and abilities may substitute for this education. Oracle DBA certification for Oracle 12c or later preferred.

Special Requirements
Final candidate must successfully complete a fingerprint-based criminal background check and complete and submit a Form I-9 (Employment Eligibility Verification) which will be entered into the Federal E-Verify system to confirm identity and work authorization. If the selected individual is a military veteran, they must also submit a copy of their DD214 form.

Employees who are not fully vaccinated must undergo weekly COVID-19 testing and disclose weekly the results of those tests to the VDACS Human Resource Office.

Department Summary:
Tufts Technology Services (TTS) is a university-wide service organization committed to delivering technology solutions in support of Tufts’ mission of teaching, learning, research, innovation, and sustainability. With staff across all of Tufts’ campuses, as well as a 24x7 IT Service Desk, we collaborate with schools and divisions to meet the demands of a global, mobile community. We promote a collaborative, flexible work environment, embrace diversity and inclusion, and encourage personal and professional development. Learn more about TTS on our website.
Job Summary:
The Senior DBA is required to have a deep understanding of relational databases with significant experience in Oracle technologies in order to provide support and maintenance for critical university database environments and comparable experience with other databases (MySQL, MS SQL server, etc.) to support other applications and services. S/he will work closely with the system administration, network engineering and storage teams to efficiently provision resources and troubleshoot issues. The successful individual will be responsible for providing all aspects of support for all environments; with a particular focus on operational details, but also play a major role in project related work and strategic roadmap planning. This position requires a good blend of technical and organizational skills to ensure optimal operation of the environments. The role also requires the knowledge to be able to evaluate emerging technologies in relationship to database environments. This is a remote position.

Qualifications
Basic Requirements:
Skills and experience typically acquired through a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field and 6+ years of work experience. At least 3 years of experience leading process re-design for IT projects.
Extensive knowledge of all aspects of Oracle 18c/19c, RMAN, OEM 13c, Windows, Linux, and shell scripting.
Oracle AWR/ASH reports
Knowledge of backup/recovery strategies
Knowledge of MySQL, MS SQL Server.
Oracle Golden Gate and In-Memory products
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to communicate ideas, both written and orally, to technical and non-technical audiences.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Oracle Data Guard
MS Office
Experience running and maintaining applications and services across multiple data centers.
Strong project management skills.
Linux and/or Windows System Administration
Familiarity with UCS/virtualization.
Familiarity with load balancer, firewall, DNS and other networking tools.
Working knowledge of Active Directory and other Identity Management tools.
Knowledge of Oracle PeopleSoft platforms including Oracle Middleware, web services and integration with databases.
Knowledge of HigherEd and experience supporting teaching, research and clinical services.

WebMD is the most recognized and trusted brand of health information and the leading provider of health information services, serving consumers, physicians, healthcare professionals, employers and health plans through our public and private online portals and WebMD the Magazine. The WebMD Health Network includes WebMD, Medscape, MedicineNet, eMedicine, RxList, theheart.org and Medscape Education. Our consumer portals and mobile health applications provide engaging, relevant and credible health and wellness information, personalized health assessment tools and access to online communities.


WebMD is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ancestry, color, religion, sex, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, medical condition, disability, veterans status, or any other basis protected by law.

WebMD’s Data Management team is looking for a Database Administrator with a passion for data and Devops. You don’t need to be a doctor to work the data at WebMD but will be able to diagnose and solve any data problems. We support databases that can respond in milliseconds or aggregate billions of rows in seconds. We manage and support data warehouses, data lakes, data marts. Our databases include both old schools and pioneers. Postgres, MySQL, MS SQL Server, MongoDB, InfluxDB, Vertica, Hadoop and Oracle are all in our territory.
This is your chance to use what you just learned in the real world. You probably coded in Java or Python, we use them. You probably had to write a Spark project; we manage them. You may stay up all night to wrap up a project with SQL or JavaScript. That’s fantastic. We need them.
As an Apprentice you will be paid $20/hr for your first 6 months and then based on performance you will be offered a full time salaried position with us.

Provide support to external DBAs

Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Client Innovation Center (CIC) in Monroe, Louisiana represents a center of excellence for delivery of consulting and technological services. It is part of the IBM Group and promotes a tailored culture leveraging on dynamism, passion and enthusiasm for new technologies such as Cloud, Internet of Things, S/4 Hana and modern software development techniques leveraging on DevOps and Agile approaches. Our style is unique! All of our employees work in a consultancy environment on a variety of exciting projects across a range of sectors. Every project has its own unique working environment - this enables our employees to build their experience, skillset and network. The Client Innovation Center offers a unique experience for talented and ambitious graduates and professionals who are keen to build their skills fast.

Be curious … come and visit our job opportunities!!!

About the Role:

As an Oracle Database Administrator, you will be designing, installing, upgrading, patching, tuning, monitoring and troubleshooting databases. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!
You will work with various projects and clients, working towards client specifications. Your role will involve:
Provisioning and configuring Oracle databases per client specifications.
Monitoring database health and availability.
Performing backups of database.
Managing database security and permissions.
Performing database recoveries.
Creating and refreshing Test and Staging databases from Production.
Keeping database versions current by patching regularly.
Required Technical and Professional Expertise
As an Oracle Database Administrator, we are looking for candidates with the following technical and professional background:
High School or College Graduation (Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics)
At least 4 years of experience as an Oracle Database Administrator
At least 4 years experience provisioning and configuring database servers.
Performing Database Migrations
Experience with database backup and recovery
Experience administering DBMS systems running on Unix/Linux..

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Knowledge and experience in Oracle Exadata Cloud@Customer
At least 2 years experience in Linux shell scripting
Oracle Database Certification
About Business UnitIBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.
This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.
Your Life @ IBMAre you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

The Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services is seeking an experienced Database Administrator to support the ongoing implementation and support of complex technology solutions in an Oracle 12c database environment. The successful candidate will provide a technical role in maintaining VDACS Oracle databases and application servers to meet agency strategic goals, implementing effective support operations using agency approved technologies, and execute database administration tasks to maintain the agency’s database and application server capabilities. The incumbent will participate in Database Administration efforts on an ongoing basis. Additional duties include assisting in the design and planning of projects and standards, and supporting team efforts to continually improve skills and delivery practices. Telework, for up to two days per week, may be possible following an on-site training period, management approval, and in accordance with current policy.

Minimum Qualifications
Significant knowledge of and experience with administration of the Oracle database management systems (12c), database modeling, application architecture, performance monitoring and skills with tuning tools, techniques and utilities and knowledge of web-enabled computer paradigms, including web servers. Knowledge of web-enabled applications including Oracle Application Server/Weblogic, Oracle Application Express, HTML and PL/SQL. Basic knowledge of application testing techniques including application security. Proven skills to provide effective technical support for agency users and development staff in Oracle and Oracle related software. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to express complex technical information in user-friendly terminology; strong analytical and problem solving skills; effective time management and organizational skills; and an understanding of information and data security, access control theory, backup and recovery techniques. Ability to work independently and manage projects with minimal direction and to establish good working relationships with co-workers, the public, outside agencies, and vendors; to maintain technical documentation; and to use database management tools is essential. Demonstrated ability to provide timely, professional and courteous customer service is required. Current/recent experience DBA experience with Oracle 12c; experience patching Oracle database and related products, 12c or later; and experience working with information and data security, access control theory, backup and recovery techniques and security controls. H.S. Diploma/GED required.

Preferred Qualifications
Graduation from an accredited college or university with major study in Information Systems, Computer Science, mathematics, engineering or other related field. An equivalent combination of training and experience indicating possession of the preceding knowledge, skills and abilities may substitute for this education. Oracle DBA certification for Oracle 12c or later preferred.

Special Requirements
Final candidate must successfully complete a fingerprint-based criminal background check and complete and submit a Form I-9 (Employment Eligibility Verification) which will be entered into the Federal E-Verify system to confirm identity and work authorization. If the selected individual is a military veteran, they must also submit a copy of their DD214 form.

Per the Governor’s Executive Directive Number Eighteen (2021) Ensuring a Safe Work Place, upon hire all new VDACS employees must disclose their vaccination status to the agency’s Human Resource Office. Employees fully vaccinated must also provide documentation to verify this status. Employees who are not fully vaccinated must undergo weekly COVID-19 testing and disclose weekly the results of those tests to the VDACS Human Resource Office.

Special Instructions to Applicants
Salary offers to selected applicants are based on the candidate’s experience and internal factors. The decision to interview an applicant is based on information provided in the application materials; therefore, it is essential to provide enough information to make this assessment. This website will provide a confirmation number when you have successfully applied. Please refer to your RMS account for the status of your application and this position. State employees who have been affected by Policy 1.3 Layoff and possess a valid Interagency Placement Screening Form (Yellow Card) or a Preferential Hiring Form (Blue Card) must submit the card BEFORE the closing date for this position. The card may be scanned and attached to the application or faxed to (804) 371-8879. Please include your name and the position number of the fax cover sheet. Optum is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work .(sm)
We are seeking a candidate to join our team of Operational DBA’s . This candidate will provide subject matter expertise and design input to the infrastructure, policies, and processes used to support PostgreSQL as a new enterprise offering. In parallel you will engage in operational support role for multiple database management systems (DBMS) and contributing to the evolution of our offerings to the enterprise. The environment is dynamic and will present many opportunities as the need to develop offerings for new database technologies is a constant. The team you will join is a group of dbas from varied backgrounds working together to provide operational support and automation for multiple database platform.
You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Operational support of Postgres 12 and 13
Contribute to design and testing of automated deploy of Postgres VMs
Design/testing/deploy of automation and monitoring for operations support of Postgres
Operational support of Mysql
Operational support of Oracle
Oncall rotation for operational issues in all three DBMS
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
3+ years of operational support of Postgres databases
1+ year of operational support of an additional RDBMS (preferably Oracle or Mysql)
Ability to read and decipher shell scripts used in administration tasks
Ability to participate in a 24X7 on call rotation
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with coding and deploying in automation tools (CHEF/ansible/Jenkins/etc)
A demonstrated desire to learn new technologies
Scripting experience (shell and or python)
Familiarity with Github as a source repository
UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.
Technology Careers with Optum. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the health care industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)

No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives

This role has the ability to work remotely Please note this position requires experience as an Oracle DBA.
Department Summary:
Tufts Technology Services (TTS) is a university-wide service organization committed to delivering technology solutions in support of Tufts’ mission of teaching, learning, research, innovation, and sustainability. With staff across all of Tufts’ campuses, as well as a 24x7 IT Service Desk, we collaborate with schools and divisions to meet the demands of a global, mobile community. We promote a collaborative, flexible work environment, embrace diversity and inclusion, and encourage personal and professional development. Learn more about TTS on our website.
Job Summary:
The Senior DBA is required to have a deep understanding of relational databases with significant experience in Oracle technologies in order to provide support and maintenance for critical university database environments and comparable experience with other databases (MySQL, MS SQL server, etc.) to support other applications and services. S/he will work closely with the system administration, network engineering and storage teams to efficiently provision resources and troubleshoot issues. The successful individual will be responsible for providing all aspects of support for all environments; with a particular focus on operational details, but also play a major role in project related work and strategic roadmap planning. This position requires a good blend of technical and organizational skills to ensure optimal operation of the environments. The role also requires the knowledge to be able to evaluate emerging technologies in relationship to database environments. This is a remote position.

Qualifications
Basic Requirements:
Skills and experience typically acquired through a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field and 6+ years of work experience. At least 3 years of experience leading process re-design for IT projects.
Extensive knowledge of all aspects of Oracle 18c/19c, RMAN, OEM 13c, Windows, Linux, and shell scripting.
Oracle AWR/ASH reports
Knowledge of backup/recovery strategies
Knowledge of MySQL, MS SQL Server.
Oracle Golden Gate and In-Memory products
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to communicate ideas, both written and orally, to technical and non-technical audiences.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Oracle Data Guard
MS Office
Experience running and maintaining applications and services across multiple data centers.
Strong project management skills.
Linux and/or Windows System Administration
Familiarity with UCS/virtualization.
Familiarity with load balancer, firewall, DNS and other networking tools.
Working knowledge of Active Directory and other Identity Management tools.
Knowledge of Oracle PeopleSoft platforms including Oracle Middleware, web services and integration with databases.
Knowledge of HigherEd and experience supporting teaching, research and clinical services.

An employee in this position must complete all appropriate background checks at the time of hire, promotion, or transfer.
Equal Opportunity Employer – minority/females/veterans/disability/sexual orientation/gender identity.

If you reside in the DC metro area and are seeking a telecommuting position, look no further. ASRC Federal Data Networks is looking for a new member for our Application and Reporting teams that supports the Energy Compensation System (ECS) for the Division of Energy Employees Occupational Illness Compensation (DEEOIC) at the US Department of Labor (DOL). The position is on site at the DOL facility at 3rd and Constitution in Washington DC and is conveniently located near the Judiciary Square Metro station. This is a full time DBA/SQL Developer position with emphasis on SQL Server Knowledge.

The selected candidate will perform the following:

Has overall responsibility of the design and implementation of the back end server solution for DEEOIC.
Will provide day to day support for Application and Reporting teams.
Will provide database support during development and maintenance in all of the DEEOIC different environments (development, integration, testing, and production).
Will proactively generate relevant ideas for new and improved use of technology, and must understand the impacts of new projects and technical impacts to the supported system.
Will be proficient at database design and modeling, and work with the government IT data lead and support contractors to create a comprehensive database design documentation and schemes.
Must be able to work with other development teams to help design, implement new database changes or designs.
Will contribute, write, and maintain DB scripts for system DB maintenance.
Must have the ability to work as part of a team as well as independently.
Demonstrate the ability to translate customer requirements into solutions.
Strong knowledge of SQL and dialect of SQL used for IBM DB2, T-SQL for Microsoft SQL server. Experience with an Agile Scrum development methodology is a plus.
Evaluate and recommend relational database structures, monitor and recommend tuning strategies for specific databases like SQL Server or My SQL database environments for improved system performance.
Provide guidance and assistance in the development, maintenance, administration and enforcement of database management standards and guidelines.
Participate in walkthrough with development staff and conduct DBA training and presentations.
Analyze database requirements
Review physical data models for design integrity and adherence to standards
Make recommendations for, and implement underlining storage and security structures
Review and approve application based scripts, utilities, stored procedures, functions and triggers.
Develop and execute appropriate Data Definition Language (DDL) to support the project
Provide query performance monitoring and tuning recommendations.
Provide input on database and environment parameter settings and tuning.
Provide general database expertise to application developers.
Responsible for database capacity planning for adequate database storage.
Insure change management and documentation for database changes
Will serve as the lead for the Data Engineering team and be responsible for the team’s performance and reporting weekly status.
Must perform on demand and scheduled DB replication and refreshing tasks.
Must maintain User accounts and Security policy and update as needed.
Must monitor DB and Server performance and resolve issues as needed.
Must provide recommendation for DB sanitization.
Must re-architect the application to reporting flow such that PowerBI can truly be utilized
Provide support to external DBAs
Telecommuting available for this position. We also offer an excellent salary and benefits package that includes money set aside for professional development, a matching 401k with immediate vesting and a culture that fosters a family-work life balance, respect, and recognition. If you reside in the DC metro area and are seeking a position that is "telecommuting", look no further! This is a full time DBA/SQL Developer position with emphasis on SQL Server Knowledge.


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or IT and an expert technical knowledge with 7 to 10 years demonstrated experience in database design and administration with very proficient knowledge in Microsoft SQL Server and MS SQL replication architectures and other relational databases such as DB2.
Sound understanding of Power BI implementations with MS SQL server is desired. Must have the ability to work as part of a team as well as independently towards assigned goals.
Demonstrate the ability to translate customer requirements into solutions and have strong knowledge of SQL, ERWin Diagrams, MS Access, Power BI, Azure, VM and MS Visio.
Must have experience as a SQL Server DBA.
Must have expert knowledge as a SQL Developer.
Must have knowledge of Data Migration.
Expertise with Physical database design issues
Must be able to operate in an Agile-based development and maintenance environment
Expertise with SQL tuning and SQL development including development of stored procedures.
Familiarity with SAP Business Objects Universe design methodology
Candidates must be detail oriented and have the ability to perform in high pressure situations
Knowledge of Case Management and Financial systems preferable
Must be a Team Player and have experience working closely with developers.
Must possess a well developed ability to communicate verbally and in written form with both technical and non technical audiences
U.S. Citizen or U.S. Permanent Resident
Candidate is required to possess or successfully complete a National Agency Check with Inquiries (NACI) and FBI Criminal History Check
Must be able to work with other development teams to help design, implement new database changes or designs.
Must have the ability to work as part of a team as well as independently.
Demonstrate the ability to translate customer requirements into solutions.
Strong knowledge of SQL and dialect of SQL used for IBM DB2, T-SQL for Microsoft SQL server. Experience with an Agile Scrum development methodology is a plus.
Must have knowledge of migration to Cloud services.
Must have strong Knowledge of SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Replication process and SQL server management Studio.
Must have experience in SQL server Agent Job Activity setup, DB backup, restore, snapshot and archive.

MS Office

Knowledge of HigherEd and experience supporting teaching, research and clinical services.

The Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services is seeking an experienced Database Administrator to support the ongoing implementation and support of complex technology solutions in an Oracle 12c database environment. The successful candidate will provide a technical role in maintaining VDACS Oracle databases and application servers to meet agency strategic goals, implementing effective support operations using agency approved technologies, and execute database administration tasks to maintain the agency’s database and application server capabilities. The incumbent will participate in Database Administration efforts on an ongoing basis. Additional duties include assisting in the design and planning of projects and standards, and supporting team efforts to continually improve skills and delivery practices. Telework, for up to two days per week, may be possible following an on-site training period, management approval, and in accordance with current policy.

Minimum Qualifications
Significant knowledge of and experience with administration of the Oracle database management systems (12c), database modeling, application architecture, performance monitoring and skills with tuning tools, techniques and utilities and knowledge of web-enabled computer paradigms, including web servers. Knowledge of web-enabled applications including Oracle Application Server/Weblogic, Oracle Application Express, HTML and PL/SQL. Basic knowledge of application testing techniques including application security. Proven skills to provide effective technical support for agency users and development staff in Oracle and Oracle related software. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to express complex technical information in user-friendly terminology; strong analytical and problem solving skills; effective time management and organizational skills; and an understanding of information and data security, access control theory, backup and recovery techniques. Ability to work independently and manage projects with minimal direction and to establish good working relationships with co-workers, the public, outside agencies, and vendors; to maintain technical documentation; and to use database management tools is essential. Demonstrated ability to provide timely, professional and courteous customer service is required. Current/recent experience DBA experience with Oracle 12c; experience patching Oracle database and related products, 12c or later; and experience working with information and data security, access control theory, backup and recovery techniques and security controls. H.S. Diploma/GED required.

Preferred Qualifications
Graduation from an accredited college or university with major study in Information Systems, Computer Science, mathematics, engineering or other related field. An equivalent combination of training and experience indicating possession of the preceding knowledge, skills and abilities may substitute for this education. Oracle DBA certification for Oracle 12c or later preferred.

Special Requirements
Final candidate must successfully complete a fingerprint-based criminal background check and complete and submit a Form I-9 (Employment Eligibility Verification) which will be entered into the Federal E-Verify system to confirm identity and work authorization. If the selected individual is a military veteran, they must also submit a copy of their DD214 form.

Per the Governor’s Executive Directive Number Eighteen (2021) Ensuring a Safe Work Place, upon hire all new VDACS employees must disclose their vaccination status to the agency’s Human Resource Office. Employees fully vaccinated must also provide documentation to verify this status. Employees who are not fully vaccinated must undergo weekly COVID-19 testing and disclose weekly the results of those tests to the VDACS Human Resource Office.

Special Instructions to Applicants
Salary offers to selected applicants are based on the candidate’s experience and internal factors. The decision to interview an applicant is based on information provided in the application materials; therefore, it is essential to provide enough information to make this assessment. This website will provide a confirmation number when you have successfully applied. Please refer to your RMS account for the status of your application and this position. State employees who have been affected by Policy 1.3 Layoff and possess a valid Interagency Placement Screening Form (Yellow Card) or a Preferential Hiring Form (Blue Card) must submit the card BEFORE the closing date for this position. The card may be scanned and attached to the application or faxed to (804) 371-8879. Please include your name and the position number of the fax cover sheet. Major Duties
Under general supervision of the Director of Marketing and Engagement, the Database Associate directly oversees all patron databases utilized by The Soraya, including the YSNC ticketing database and YSNC data in the Development database, Raisers Edge. The incumbent maintains audience information such as contact information, ticket buying and donation history, and more.

Ensures all data is kept up to date and frequently “cleans” data to ensure accuracy and oversees coordination of data transfers between databases as needed.

Independently completes complex quantitative analysis and generates standard reports that aggregate key information and directly informs strategic decisions made by the development and marketing staff.

Supports Director of Marketing and Engagement and Director of Development through the research, collection, and presentation of data.

Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university in a job-related field.
Equivalent to three (3) years of full-time, progressively responsible technical, analytical, or administrative experience.

Additional experience in job-related field may be substituted for up to two years of the required education, on a year for year basis.

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
Working knowledge of general practices, program, and/or administrative specialty and working knowledge of operational analysis and techniques. Thorough knowledge of data analytics.
Ability and specialized skills to expertly investigate and analyze problems with a broad administrative impact and implications.

Ability to: oversee and/or train others and provide lead work direction; interpret, and apply a wide variety of policies and procedures to develop conclusions and make recommendations; compile, write and present reports related to program or administrative specialty; and communicate clearly and effectively both orally and in writing.
Proficiency and extensive knowledge of patron management databases preferred, as well as excellent quantitative analysis skills.

Job Title: SQL DBA Administrator, Remote North America
Description:
Since 1992, Ciena has been driven by a relentless pursuit of network innovation. We believe in a network that grows smarter, more agile, and more responsive every day. This means that when you digitally interact in your world - picking up the phone, streaming video, texting a friend or loved one – your interactions are being enabled by Ciena technologies. Ciena makes your social / entertainment / business existence REAL.
DIMENSION & SCOPE
Must possess extensive production SQL Server design, support, and administration experience in a large enterprise and apply those skills with a proven ability to prioritize work across several complex tasks simultaneously.
Implements DBA best practices and optimizations across a complex continually evolving Azure/SQL Server environment. Understand and support complex backend integrations across multiple business technology platforms; leading ad-hoc cross functional efforts to troubleshoot and resolve production issues along with new features under development. Support the SQL development of custom applications within SDLC, ITIL, Change Control procedures in Development, Validation, Production, DMZ, and DR environments.
Demonstrate a strong work ethic and the ability to work flexible, long, sometimes odd hours in support of development, validation, and production initiatives across a globally distributed workforce. Demonstrate strong documentation, communication skills and effectively work with various IT groups across several different time zones.
SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES
Understand complex SQL Server designs to share ownership and optimize a mix of on-prem physical and Azure IaaS SQL Server environments
Manage physical and Azure Iaas SQL Infrastructure and optimization
Develop and help drive forward Azure SQL IaaS to Azure SQL PaaS
Maintain SOX compliance and GCC controls within SQL environments
Support several highly active custom application and software development groups in a controlled Dev/Test/Prod/DMZ/DR
Interact with internal and external customers to establish database requirements, designing and implementing complex resolutions
Good understanding of Azure cloud services like VNET, NSGs, Azure Automation, runbook etc.
Analyze, predict, and resolve database, system, storage and application issues, working with all levels of Infrastructure and Application teams.
Maintain and improve DR strategies and DBA Admin code
Support extensive SSIS/SSAS/SSRS implémentations
Lead Application SQL Support and OS/SQL upgrades and migrations
Monitor SQL job failures, debugging, root cause analysis, resolution, documentation and escalation of priority issues
Optimize and tune T-SQL application query performance
Configure, support, optimize, and evolve SQL Server configurations
Optimization of existing and new complex TSQL code
Continual study of SQL Server/Azure trends emerging technologies
Good understanding of Azure cloud platform
Working knowledge of powershell, python, json, Azure Devops, functions etc.
PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage, maintain, and optimize ~100 sql instances across multi-tiered SDLC environment
Provide 24/7 support to a production environment, and critical development operations
Support active globally distributed DevOps development and deployment of custom applications
Provide primary production on-call support during overnight North America hours
Flexible work schedule to overlap for collaboration with colleagues in North America and India
Optimize T-SQL, enhance application query performance and debug job/integration issues
Independently drive forward SQL Server DBA functions to continually improve Ciena SQL
Support Azure IaaS and drive forward upgrades from IaaS>PaaS (Azure SQL database, Azure SQL DataWarehouse, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, BigData technologies)
Configure, support, and optimize SQL Server configuration, providing full stack support of SQL Database platforms while deeply collaborating with local and off-shore Software Developers
Work closely with all levels of IT; sharing the vision, priorities, and projects of application and infrastructure teams providing exceptional service and value
About Ciena

Ciena is a network strategy and technology company with a passion to provide an experience, to you and our customers that is as rewarding as the outcome. We attract the best and brightest– those with outstanding talent, motivation, and the right attitude to contribute to our success. Our culture balances our openness and informality with professionalism and trust and is built on the foundation of our core values: Customer First, Integrity, Velocity, Innovation, and Outstanding People.
Ciena enables everyone to have a voice and a network that supports them while on the journey to discovering their passion and purpose. We trust each individual to do what they can to reach their full potential and make an impact on the business, whenever, wherever they are in the world. With Ciena’s highly innovative, forward-thinking business practices, we reward people for pushing the boundaries. Unlock your potential at Ciena!

Being You @ Ciena

As part of our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we want to foster an environment that values and respects all individual’s strengths, perspectives, ideas, and ability to meet the needs of our customers globally. Job Details
Description
About Us

Milliman IntelliScript is a specialty software-as-a-service (SaaS) unit of Milliman that pioneers industry-advancing risk management insurtech. IntelliScript has led our market since 2001, exceeding annual sales growth of 20 percent in the last several years. We create an entrepreneurial work environment, reward excellence, and offer competitive compensation and benefits. We honor each employee’s one-of-a-kind nature and the wholeness of who they are. Every single person has a voice in our company, and we challenge each other to push the outer limits of our full, diverse potential. We are looking for collaborative people who are ready to be part of our long-term success. Visit our LinkedIn page for a closer look at our company, and learn more about our cultural values here.

Role Description

The DBA is a vital part of a growing team, working in an innovative and collaborative environment. Working closely with the DBA, infrastructure and development teams, the DBA will maintain the health of the database servers, optimize performance of TSQL, and streamline SQL deployment processes. The DBA will be instrumental in working with development team resources for the maintenance of robust, scalable database structures and queries. This person will provide maintenance and management support for SQL Server environments (2019) and assist with future upgrades to approved SQL Server releases.

The right person for our team has 5 to 7+ years of experience developing and implementing database solutions to support business requirements; resolving technical issues through debugging, research, and investigation; writing and fixing code; testing and implementing database backups, restores and upgrades.

Responsibilities

Maintain database server health across all environments
Maintain and report on queries needing optimization and formulate solutions
Work with Development team to troubleshoot issues and optimize T-SQL code
Assist business power users on optimizing queries for reporting purposes
Assist in deploying new T-SQL code deployments in conjunction with development team code deployments
Continually look for automation opportunities and organize a plan to feed future projects
Ensure all system security requirements are met
Maintain database Availability Group environment to keep systems up to date
Comfortable communicating / translating specs and business needs between stakeholders and technical teams
Assist Infrastructure and/or IT staff with projects as needed
Mentor junior staff as needed on technical subjects
Maintain, manage and report on SQL backups across enterprise
Maintain the integrity and accuracy of system backups
Maintain and report on growth trending of all databases forecasting for future needs
Ensure proper management and maintenance of network infrastructure per policy and management directive

Professional Qualifications
5 to 7+ years of Microsoft SQL Server experience (2017 and higher) as a Database Administrator
High school diploma or GED in addition to some secondary education or continued learning / training
Able to speak knowledgably about SQL concepts and SQL server technologies
Solid grasp of database design concepts and techniques
Past experience working with software architects on database system design
Solid documentation skills
Skilled with TSQL, query tuning, relational database design and PowerShell scripting
Familiarity with working on large datasets

Attributes
Passionate about building high-quality database systems with industry standard best practices
Naturally curious, enjoys digging deep to uncover information
Demonstrated “let’s find a way to do it” attitude – no task is too big or too small
Customer-centric approach to finding solutions
Excellent communication skills, in person and through phone/email
Able to learn new concepts and adapt quickly to an existing, complex environment
Self-motivated, with the ability to work independently and in teams, with or without supervision
Strong work ethic: pitches in wherever needed
Collaborative by nature: seeks out the input and needs of others, shares insights and opportunities
Adapts to an established process, able to move projects along in a timeframe

Preferred

Continued education and/or advanced degree(s)
Ability to understand and refactor complex legacy software
Experience in environments subject to HIPAA and/or PCI regulations
Professional experience with project lifecycle planning such as Agile/Scrum
Experience using Team Foundation Server (TFS) or Azure DevOps

Location

This position will be based out of the Milliman office in Brookfield, WI; however, this position is open to remote work, with the exception of Colorado residents.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

The Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services is seeking an experienced Database Administrator to support the ongoing implementation and support of complex technology solutions in an Oracle 12c database environment. The successful candidate will provide a technical role in maintaining VDACS Oracle databases and application servers to meet agency strategic goals, implementing effective support operations using agency approved technologies, and execute database administration tasks to maintain the agency’s database and application server capabilities. The incumbent will participate in Database Administration efforts on an ongoing basis. Additional duties include assisting in the design and planning of projects and standards, and supporting team efforts to continually improve skills and delivery practices. Telework, for up to two days per week, may be possible following an on-site training period, management approval, and in accordance with current policy.

Minimum Qualifications
Significant knowledge of and experience with administration of the Oracle database management systems (12c), database modeling, application architecture, performance monitoring and skills with tuning tools, techniques and utilities and knowledge of web-enabled computer paradigms, including web servers. Knowledge of web-enabled applications including Oracle Application Server/Weblogic, Oracle Application Express, HTML and PL/SQL. Basic knowledge of application testing techniques including application security. Proven skills to provide effective technical support for agency users and development staff in Oracle and Oracle related software. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to express complex technical information in user-friendly terminology; strong analytical and problem solving skills; effective time management and organizational skills; and an understanding of information and data security, access control theory, backup and recovery techniques. Ability to work independently and manage projects with minimal direction and to establish good working relationships with co-workers, the public, outside agencies, and vendors; to maintain technical documentation; and to use database management tools is essential. Demonstrated ability to provide timely, professional and courteous customer service is required. Current/recent experience DBA experience with Oracle 12c; experience patching Oracle database and related products, 12c or later; and experience working with information and data security, access control theory, backup and recovery techniques and security controls. H.S. Diploma/GED required.

Preferred Qualifications
Graduation from an accredited college or university with major study in Information Systems, Computer Science, mathematics, engineering or other related field. An equivalent combination of training and experience indicating possession of the preceding knowledge, skills and abilities may substitute for this education. Oracle DBA certification for Oracle 12c or later preferred.

Special Requirements
Final candidate must successfully complete a fingerprint-based criminal background check and complete and submit a Form I-9 (Employment Eligibility Verification) which will be entered into the Federal E-Verify system to confirm identity and work authorization. If the selected individual is a military veteran, they must also submit a copy of their DD214 form.

Per the Governor’s Executive Directive Number Eighteen (2021) Ensuring a Safe Work Place, upon hire all new VDACS employees must disclose their vaccination status to the agency’s Human Resource Office. Employees fully vaccinated must also provide documentation to verify this status. Employees who are not fully vaccinated must undergo weekly COVID-19 testing and disclose weekly the results of those tests to the VDACS Human Resource Office.

Special Instructions to Applicants
Salary offers to selected applicants are based on the candidate’s experience and internal factors. The decision to interview an applicant is based on information provided in the application materials; therefore, it is essential to provide enough information to make this assessment. This website will provide a confirmation number when you have successfully applied. Please refer to your RMS account for the status of your application and this position. State employees who have been affected by Policy 1.3 Layoff and possess a valid Interagency Placement Screening Form (Yellow Card) or a Preferential Hiring Form (Blue Card) must submit the card BEFORE the closing date for this position. The card may be scanned and attached to the application or faxed to (804) 371-8879. Please include your name and the position number of the fax cover sheet. THIS IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE APPLICANT. Hearing Impaired 1-800-828-1120. VDACS is dedicated to recruiting, supporting, and maintaining a competent and diverse work force. Equal Opportunity Employer.

Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Client Innovation Center (CIC) in Monroe, Louisiana represents a center of excellence for delivery of consulting and technological services. It is part of the IBM Group and promotes a tailored culture leveraging on dynamism, passion and enthusiasm for new technologies such as Cloud, Internet of Things, S/4 Hana and modern software development techniques leveraging on DevOps and Agile approaches. Our style is unique! All of our employees work in a consultancy environment on a variety of exciting projects across a range of sectors. Every project has its own unique working environment - this enables our employees to build their experience, skillset and network. The Client Innovation Center offers a unique experience for talented and ambitious graduates and professionals who are keen to build their skills fast.

Be curious … come and visit our job opportunities!!!

About the Role:

As an Oracle Database Administrator, you will be designing, installing, upgrading, patching, tuning, monitoring and troubleshooting databases. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!
You will work with various projects and clients, working towards client specifications. Your role will involve:
Provisioning and configuring Oracle databases per client specifications.
Monitoring database health and availability.
Performing backups of database.
Managing database security and permissions.
Performing database recoveries.
Creating and refreshing Test and Staging databases from Production.
Keeping database versions current by patching regularly.
Required Technical and Professional Expertise
As an Oracle Database Administrator, we are looking for candidates with the following technical and professional background:
High School or College Graduation (Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics)
At least 4 years of experience as an Oracle Database Administrator
At least 4 years experience provisioning and configuring database servers.
Performing Database Migrations
Experience with database backup and recovery
Experience administering DBMS systems running on Unix/Linux..
Experience with database patching and upgrades
Experience with analyzing query execution plans and tuning the database accordingly.
Strong troubleshooting skills to investigate errors and performance bottlenecks
Willing to work in a 24x7 production mission critical environment, including weekends
Must be detail oriented and have critical thinking skills

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Knowledge and experience in Oracle Exadata Cloud@Customer
At least 2 years experience in Linux shell scripting
Oracle Database Certification
About Business UnitIBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.
This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.
Your Life @ IBMAre you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Job Title: CO - P6044 - PREP GIS/Data Projects Administrator
Description:
The Agency:

Do you desire a career that provides you with opportunities to improve the world around you? The Virginia Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) is seeking diverse individuals from all backgrounds to apply for a career position that will make a direct impact on improving the lives of Virginia citizens. At DEQ, our Mission is to protect and enhance Virginia’s environment, and promote the health and well-being of all citizens in the Commonwealth. Our Vision is that all Virginians enjoy cleaner water, better air quality, and the productive reuse of land that was once contaminated.

What you will be doing:

The Virginia Department of Environmental Quality Office of Pollution Response and Emergency Preparedness (PREP) seeks a qualified individual to manage the development, modification and maintenance of the program databases and information technology projects. The selected candidate will ensure the integrity of program data and technology solutions by evaluating data for timeliness, completeness and accuracy; identifying, developing and providing data systems training; providing technical support to program staff and agency programs that use the PREP technologies; developing data queries to support program operations and strategic planning; maintaining program GIS data layers and fact sheets for external and internal GIS viewers; providing GIS support to the PREP program for exercises and incidents; providing GIS support to agency VEST role; managing the DEQ STARS radios program; providing support for and evaluation of program technology solutions; supporting contracting and cost recovery associated with environmental emergency cleanups; supporting the DEQ Alerts system; maintaining PREP program internal and external web pages. The position serves as PREP Program business analyst; serves as the program representative on the DEQ GIS Expert Panel; serves as a STARS User Agency Requirements Committee (UARC) representative; serves as a program web author; and serves as a DEQ Alerts system administrator.

Environmental Specialist II (PREP GIS/Data Projects Administrator), #P6044
Richmond, Virginia
Minimum Starting Salary: $48,391 – Negotiable Based on Experience


Minimum Qualifications
The successful candidate will possess considerable knowledge of federal/state environmental laws and regulations, database management and GIS applications. Key competencies to include:

Environmental science
Program management
Problem solving and decision making
PC operations, database and data analysis operations
ArcGIS Online, ESRI Survey 123, ArcGIS Desktop, R programming language, and Emergency Alert System administration
Training development and delivery
Excellent verbal and written communications
Effective organization skills


Why DEQ?

DEQ employs a wide range of professionals in varying fields – from engineers and scientists to information technology and communications specialists. All positions work collectively toward one goal: safeguarding Virginia’s diverse and abundant natural resources, which benefit agriculture, industry, and commerce, and provide a rich environment for people, plants, and wildlife. If you seek to be a part of this Mission, Vision, and culture, while also enjoying a wide range of state benefits, we encourage you to join today. To learn more about our agency, please visit our website at: https://www.deq.virginia.gov.

Preferred Qualifications
Degree from an accredited college or university in natural or environmental science, GIS, or related field. A combination of education, experience, and training may substitute for a degree. Complete or provide certification of previous completion of the following National Incident Management (NIMS) courses: ICS-100, ICS-200.

Special Requirements
The Commonwealth does not provide sponsorship; therefore, applicants must be a citizen or national of the U.S., a Lawful Permanent Resident, or an alien authorized to work.

Excluding current DEQ Employees, the Selected Candidate MUST pass a criminal background check.

Special Instructions to Applicants
For consideration for this position, candidates MUST apply online at https://virginiajobs.peopleadmin.com. Applicants are encouraged to be specific regarding job-related knowledge, skills, and abilities. Resumes are encouraged but do not substitute submittal of the online application. Applications submitted via postal mail, email, or fax will not be considered. An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

Name Yolanda Powell

Phone 804-698-4110

Fax 804-698-4083

Email yolanda.powell@deq.virginia.gov

Address
1111 E. Main Street, Suite 1400
Richmond, VA 23219

Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Client Innovation Center (CIC) in Monroe, Louisiana represents a center of excellence for delivery of consulting and technological services. It is part of the IBM Group and promotes a tailored culture leveraging on dynamism, passion and enthusiasm for new technologies such as Cloud, Internet of Things, S/4 Hana and modern software development techniques leveraging on DevOps and Agile approaches. Our style is unique! All of our employees work in a consultancy environment on a variety of exciting projects across a range of sectors. Every project has its own unique working environment - this enables our employees to build their experience, skillset and network. The Client Innovation Center offers a unique experience for talented and ambitious graduates and professionals who are keen to build their skills fast.

Be curious … come and visit our job opportunities!!!

About the Role:

As an Oracle Database Administrator, you will be designing, installing, upgrading, patching, tuning, monitoring and troubleshooting databases. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!
You will work with various projects and clients, working towards client specifications. Your role will involve:
Provisioning and configuring Oracle databases per client specifications.
Monitoring database health and availability.
Performing backups of database.
Managing database security and permissions.
Performing database recoveries.
Creating and refreshing Test and Staging databases from Production.
Keeping database versions current by patching regularly.
Required Technical and Professional Expertise
As an Oracle Database Administrator, we are looking for candidates with the following technical and professional background:
High School or College Graduation (Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics)
At least 4 years of experience as an Oracle Database Administrator
At least 4 years experience provisioning and configuring database servers.
Performing Database Migrations
Experience with database backup and recovery
Experience administering DBMS systems running on Unix/Linux..
Experience with database patching and upgrades
Experience with analyzing query execution plans and tuning the database accordingly.
Strong troubleshooting skills to investigate errors and performance bottlenecks
Willing to work in a 24x7 production mission critical environment, including weekends
Must be detail oriented and have critical thinking skills

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Knowledge and experience in Oracle Exadata Cloud@Customer
At least 2 years experience in Linux shell scripting
Oracle Database Certification

IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

The Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services is seeking an experienced Database Administrator to support the ongoing implementation and support of complex technology solutions in an Oracle 12c database environment. The successful candidate will provide a technical role in maintaining VDACS Oracle databases and application servers to meet agency strategic goals, implementing effective support operations using agency approved technologies, and execute database administration tasks to maintain the agency’s database and application server capabilities. The incumbent will participate in Database Administration efforts on an ongoing basis. Additional duties include assisting in the design and planning of projects and standards, and supporting team efforts to continually improve skills and delivery practices. Telework, for up to two days per week, may be possible following an on-site training period, management approval, and in accordance with current policy.

Minimum Qualifications
Significant knowledge of and experience with administration of the Oracle database management systems (12c), database modeling, application architecture, performance monitoring and skills with tuning tools, techniques and utilities and knowledge of web-enabled computer paradigms, including web servers. Knowledge of web-enabled applications including Oracle Application Server/Weblogic, Oracle Application Express, HTML and PL/SQL. Basic knowledge of application testing techniques including application security. Proven skills to provide effective technical support for agency users and development staff in Oracle and Oracle related software. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to express complex technical information in user-friendly terminology; strong analytical and problem solving skills; effective time management and organizational skills; and an understanding of information and data security, access control theory, backup and recovery techniques. Ability to work independently and manage projects with minimal direction and to establish good working relationships with co-workers, the public, outside agencies, and vendors; to maintain technical documentation; and to use database management tools is essential. Demonstrated ability to provide timely, professional and courteous customer service is required. Current/recent experience DBA experience with Oracle 12c; experience patching Oracle database and related products, 12c or later; and experience working with information and data security, access control theory, backup and recovery techniques and security controls. H.S. Diploma/GED required.

Preferred Qualifications
Graduation from an accredited college or university with major study in Information Systems, Computer Science, mathematics, engineering or other related field. An equivalent combination of training and experience indicating possession of the preceding knowledge, skills and abilities may substitute for this education. Oracle DBA certification for Oracle 12c or later preferred.

Special Requirements
Final candidate must successfully complete a fingerprint-based criminal background check and complete and submit a Form I-9 (Employment Eligibility Verification) which will be entered into the Federal E-Verify system to confirm identity and work authorization. If the selected individual is a military veteran, they must also submit a copy of their DD214 form.

Per the Governor’s Executive Directive Number Eighteen (2021) Ensuring a Safe Work Place, upon hire all new VDACS employees must disclose their vaccination status to the agency’s Human Resource Office. Employees fully vaccinated must also provide documentation to verify this status. Employees who are not fully vaccinated must undergo weekly COVID-19 testing and disclose weekly the results of those tests to the VDACS Human Resource Office.

Special Instructions to Applicants
Salary offers to selected applicants are based on the candidate’s experience and internal factors. The decision to interview an applicant is based on information provided in the application materials; therefore, it is essential to provide enough information to make this assessment.
