About DMI:
DMI (Digital Management, LLC.), the world’s first end-to-end mobility company, combines all the skills and services necessary to deliver mobile enterprise solutions. Built to reinvent business through mobility, DMI has expertise in mobile strategy, UX, web, and app development, omni-channel commerce, brand and marketing, IoT and big data analytics, and secure device and app management. The company’s unique, integrated approach to mobility has resulted in dramatic growth as well as an expanding client base, which includes hundreds of Fortune 1000 commercial clients and all fifteen U.S. Federal Departments. DMI is headquartered in Bethesda, MD, with satellite offices around the world. The company was named one of the 2018 Top Workplaces in the Washington, DC area by The Washington Post and received Inc. Magazine’s Hire Power Award as one of the top 100 Private Job Creators in the US. Additional information is available at www.dminc.com and on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

About the Opportunity:
DMI (Digital Management LLC) is looking for ADABAS Data Base Specialist remotely

Qualifications:
These personnel provide highly technical expertise and guidance in the interrelationship of the enterprise DBMS within the system software environment.
Each ADABAS Data Base Specialist must meet all the qualifications listed under Mandatory Core Competencies.
The ADABAS Data Base Specialist is responsible for installing, customizing, and maintaining the Data Center’s ADABAS Cluster Services environment and associated suite of Software AG (SAG) products.
ADABAS Cluster Services is fundamental to the Data Center high availability and continuous operating ADABAS environment. Availability of information and information systems are critical to OPM meeting its mission.

Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
1. Planning, installing, customizing, configuring, and implementing SAG suite of ADABAS software products.
2. Planning and executing disaster recovery for ADABAS and ADABAS related products.
3. Planning, creating, and managing table spaces in support DBAs.
4. Planning, configuring, and implementing ADABAS Cluster Services and its add-on tools.
5. Planning, configuring, and implementing new DBMS technologies following OPM Change Control process.
6. Planning and implementing ADABAS support for structured and unstructured data.
7. Planning, configuring, and implementing ADABAS support for SQL.
8. Planning, configuring, and implementing Natural and ADABAS security.
9. Planning, installing, configuring, customizing, and implementing ADABAS SAF security.
10. Planning and implementing performance improve that reduces CPU consumption.
11. Planning, configuring, and implementing ADABAS buffering of data and indexes in main memory to decrease the number of physical reads and increase database performance.
12. Planning, configuring, customizing and implementing ADABAS Cluster Services.

Enterprise Mainframe Systems Support PWS
13. Planning, installing, configuring, and implementing ADABAS Online System (AOS).
14. Planning, configuring, and implementing Nucleus 64-bit processing support.
15. Planning, configuring, and implementing ADABAS reporting of performance and resource consumption data through SMF.
16. Planning, configuring, and implementing ADABAS to comply with audits and regulatory requirements.
17. Providing technical assistance to PMOs’ DBMS programming and systems design staff.
18. Assisting in evaluating and setting database parameters.
MANDATORY CORE COMPETENCIES: ADABAS Data Base Specialist

Responsible for leading the installation, configuration, creation and administration of Oracle Database in Linux (Redhat, Oracle), Windows (2000/2003/2008) and VWware ESK platforms; direct and support the installation and configuration of Oracle Clusterware and Oracle RAC (Real Application Clusters) Databases for high availability; lead the implementation of Oracle databases for high availability; oversee implementing of Oracle database security (roles, privileges, authentication); creating and managing physical/logical database objects; allocating and managing physical/logical storage structures; support Oracle table partitioning and maintenance, as well as Oracle GoldenGate bidirectional replication; lead the installation and configuration of Goldengate 12.1.2 and 12.2.2 versions on 11G databases and 12c on 2,4,6,8 node Cluster’s and EX-DATA servers; oversee the installation and configuration of Oracle Enterprise Manager Cloud Control 12c; responsible for tuning the database for performance by running ASH/AWR report and by changing the initialization parameters and SGA memory structures; utilize Linux, VWare ESK platforms, Oracle RAC Database, Golden Gate and REDHAT to perform duties; optimizing database performance by analyzing tables and indexes; support Oracle Database Migration and upgrade from 10g to 11g and applying the patch sets and CPU patches; responsible for the upgrades and various Oracle various Oracle versions and databases; support database monitoring using Oracle Grid control; responsible for standards and design of physical data security administration; lead capacity planning of database objects for future storage requirements and writing scripts to create database objects with proper storage parameters; support developing Korn shell, SQL, PL/SQL and Windows scripts to automate daily routing DBA tasks, and also On-Call rotation..

Location: Canton, MI and multiple undetermined worksites throughout the US;

Education: Masters – Information Systems, Computer Science, or in a related field of study (will accept equivalent foreign degree);

Training: None

Experience Required: One (1) year in the position above, as an Oracle Database Administrator, as a Database Analyst, or in a related occupation;

Other Requirements: Experience must include one (1) years use of Linux, VWare ESK platforms, Oracle RAC Database, Golden Gate and REDHAT.

Will also accept any suitable combination of education, training, and/or experience.

Salary: $85,000 per year

Link Solutions is seeking a SQL Database Administrator (DBA) at Fort Huachuca, AZ.

Familiar with SQL reporting services including creating, modifying, and managing custom reports

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs
The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?

As Senior DBA of Database Management organization at Honeywell, you will have opportunity to work with large footprint of various database technologies and make a difference by establishing a solid foundation for innovation, performance, reliability, and scalability working on on-prem and public cloud solutions leveraging multiple database technologies.


You will have opportunity to work on MS SQL database development, architecture, and operations that are responsible for setting the database strategy and delivering a scalable and reliable data platform that supports Honeywell’s Digital Platform and Applications. Additionally, you will also participate and provide your guidance for the design and implementation of databases in global high availability and high-performance environments. You will be working with leads to maintain the MS SQL database models across all applications, design new solutions at the cutting edge of distributed database technology and will deliver large scale systems that will have an impact on revenue growth.
Key Responsibilities:
Involve on adoption of strategic platforms for MS SQL database - on-premise and Cloud Infrastructure
Collaborate on Database Automation activities to improve process efficiency and risk compliance
Drive Stability initiatives by proactively reviewing and addressing Database performance and capacity trends
Effectively participate and guide - 24x7 operational support shift model
Mentor and guide DBAs blended with young and experienced.
Ready to learn other core database technology like Oracle, MySQL, open source databases.
Stay focused, aggressive, active, lead by example, coordinate and guide the leadership team, and provide value as a strong team player.
Implement High Availability database solutions in MS SQL.
Lead and manage high severity database issues impacting revenue applications working cross functionally across leads of infrastructure, network, and application teams
Ensure centralized 24x7 Database Monitoring and Auditing Tools in place and effective in operation
Create and maintain reliable CMDB inventory for your area of responsibility along with connected assets.
Review consistently on the usage of database inventory on-going basis and work on consolidation, migration and deletion of assets associated and ensure savings to IT spend
Make sure to delete the vendor unsupported environments and stay in compliance to protect data and systems from any vulnerability
Effective governance of third-party vendor both onshore and offshore
Engage completely into full lifecycle of Database environment (Plan, Build, Patch, Run)
Risk and Control oversight of DB environment ensuring engagement with DB Security and Engineering teams
Provide guidance to Operational Database Support teams to troubleshoot and investigate Business impacting performance issues on need basis.

Apply knowledge of concepts and procedures to resolve issues
Create and maintain processes and documentation for various database activities including architecture, user access, user termination, DB creation, DB migration, DB security, Service Now knowledge etc.,
Contribute to formulation of strategies for infrastructure technologies functional areas across various business sectors
Ensure ongoing compliance with regulatory requirements, evaluate controls to help mitigate negative outcomes through prevention, detection and correction – SOX/PCI/GDPR/Export compliance etc.,
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Honeywell, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing.

Job Title: Senior Manager Database Specialist SA - Nationwide Opportuni...
Description:
Proven design and implementation experience with relational databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle or SQL Server. Be involved in different stages of the lifecycle (schema design, Query Tuning and Optimization, HA/DR implementation and operational management)
Proven track record in building inclusive organizations and working across teams to achieve common goals.
Demonstrated experience in establishing a solutions architecture practice and developing scaling mechanisms that can be leveraged across an organization.
Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization.
Business fluent English is required for customer interactions, internal communication, and collaboration with the worldwide teams.

In this role, you need to be technically capable and credible in your own right, as well as useful in shaping the customer and solutions-focused skills of your team. You must enjoy learning and introducing new technology to help colleagues and customers embrace and adopt new technology. Furthermore, establishing thought leadership by looking beyond the technology, considering the value technology creates for our customers, and helping to change technology perspectives is an essential aspect of the role. You will help team members ramp-up on AWS as well as develop speaking, writing, presentation, and executive interaction skills. You need to be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with internal teams within AWS such as our service and engineering teams, business development, marketing, and professional services, as well as representing your team to executive management.

You will also enjoy developing technical talent to achieve great things. You have a passion for educating, training and enabling relational database experts for a diverse and challenging set of commercial customers. Have a strong understanding of commercial and open source based relational databases. The ideal candidate has prior experience leading a team of solution architects or consultants. You enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones so that you can make substantial contributions to in-depth architecture discussions.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Engage with customers and critical AWS business partners such as product teams, business development, professional services , partners, and support.
Hire, onboard, train, and develop new database Specialist Solutions Architects from internal and external sources
Educate commercial customers on the value proposition of AWS, and participate in deep architectural discussions to design purpose-built database solutions for successful deployment in the cloud
Build and coach the team on the skills needed to conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions so they can transfer deep technical skills to customers who are considering or using AWS
Capture, share and scale best-practice knowledge amongst customers, and the AWS solutions architect community
Build deep relationships with decision makers within customer accounts to enable them to be "Cloud advocates."
Act as a conduit and liaison between customers and service engineering teams and shape service offerings.
Academic background Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent professional experience
Experience communicating and working with Developers, IT, Chief Data/Technology/Product Officers to articulate database strategies and plans.
Experience of data migration techniques and process planning including transaction processing, security, logging and monitoring.
Experience of advanced deployment architectures such as availability, resiliency and fault tolerance.
Deep understanding of AWS services related to databases highly desirable, particularly Amazon RDS, Amazon Aurora
Demonstrated effectiveness working across multiple business units to achieve results
Experience managing technical teams

RECRUITMENT IS OPEN UNTIL FILLED OR UNTIL A SUFFICIENT NUMBER OF APPLICATIONS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED. RECRUITMENT MAY CLOSE AT ANY TIME.


The Information Services Department is offering an outstanding career opportunity to a dedicated professional to manage the City's databases, which include standards and procedures relating to the integrity of City-wide information systems; serving as an expert technical resource on database architecture, design, and administration; recommending and maintaining City-wide and industry standards for database design and database administration; and maintaining system security. Incumbents may serve as a lead worker to other staff. The ideal candidate should be highly skilled in Oracle and/or Microsoft SQL Server databases (including Microsoft SQL Server 2012, 2016, 2017 and newer), operating systems (Windows, Linux, Unix), Esri SDE Geodatabases, as well as project management. Experience with Accela, human resource, financial, and utility billing applications is advantageous.

The current vacancy exists in the Information Services Department. Immediate and future vacancies will be filled from this eligible list for a period of six (6) months from the date the eligible list is created, with the option of extending that period at the City's discretion. If the examination process is suspended for this recruitment, the eligible list may be limited to three (3) months.


Conditions of Employment

The following applies to applicants who apply on or after 10/14/2021: As required by Emergency Order 2021-02, section 7.8, newly hired City employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 regardless of the employee¿s duty location or work arrangement (e.g., telework, remote work, etc.), subject to such exceptions as required by law. If selected, you will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit documentation of proof of vaccination before appointment or onboarding with the City. The City will provide additional information regarding what information or documentation will be needed and how you can request of the agency a legally required exception from this requirement.


Pay,Benefits, & Work Schedule

BENEFITS: UNIT 13: City of Fresno Professional Employees Association (CFPEA)

RETIREMENT: Fresno City Retirement System, one of the best funded public systems in the state. Reciprocity with other public California systems. The City does not participate in Social Security. Vested in Retirement benefits after 5 years of service.
HEALTH INSURANCE: The City contributes toward monthly premiums for PPO medical, dental and vision for employee and dependents.
FLEXIBLE SPENDING ACCOUNT: IRS 125 Plan for health and dependent care expenses.
DEFERRED COMPENSATION: Increase your retirement savings with the City¿s 457 plan.
MANAGEMENT LEAVE: 60 hours per fiscal year.
ANNUAL LEAVE: Twenty (20) days per year of Annual Leave with cash out provisions.
HOLIDAYS: Ten (10) City-observed annual holidays plus birthday and one (1) personal day.
LIFE INSURANCE: Benefit equal to annual salary; premium paid by the City.
LONG-TERM DISABILITY: Benefit equal to 66.66% of monthly salary up to $7,500 per month after 30 days of disability; premium paid by the City.

Additional information regarding the City of Fresno benefits is available at www.fresno.gov.


The Requirements

Applicants must meet the minimum qualifications on or before the posted filing deadline in order to qualify for the examination and does not assure a place on the eligibility list.


A Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Systems, or related fields (A copy of diploma must be scanned and attached to your online application).

-AND-


Two (2) years of experience involving application development, operation and maintenance of system software, and database administration functions.


A copy of degree or college transcripts must be uploaded and included in your on-line application for verification of requirement. Applicants lacking the documentation may be rejected if relying upon education to meet the Minimum Requirements.


Additional Requirements

The selected eligible candidates certified will be required to successfully pass a Department interview and a Department of Justice fingerprint prior to employment with the City of Fresno.

Possession of a valid California Driver's License required at time of appointment. Candidates considered for hire must provide proof of a valid driver's license and current copy of their driving record.


Eligibles certified to the Police Department for consideration must successfully complete a polygraph test, an extensive background investigation, and a department interview before receiving conditional offers of employment. Individuals receiving a conditional offer of employment must successfully complete the Department of Justice fingerprinting process before receiving a final offer of employment.


How To Apply

APPLICANTS MUST COMPLETE AN ON-LINE APPLICATION. PLEASE VISIT www.fresno.gov/jobs. TO APPLY. For information on how to complete an on-line application, please view "Instruction Guide" on the City's website, Personnel Services Career Opportunities page, or call (559) 621-6950 for assistance. Resumes will not be accepted in lieu of a completed employment application.


ALL CORRESPONDENCE regarding this recruitment and exam process will be sent via e-mail. All applicants will acknowledge such understanding when they complete their on-line application. Verify we have your correct e-mail address before you submit your application. It is an applicant's responsibility to check their email frequently to ensure they receive all pertinent communication from the Personnel Services Department on a timely basis. Applicants will receive an automatically generated confirmation e-mail upon a successful application submittal. The e-mail is the only proof of submittal.


It is an applicant's responsibility to check their email account and to ensure it is set up to accept emails from the City of Fresno. Dependent upon your settings, notices from the City of Fresno may be directed to the junk mail or spam folders. It is the applicant's responsibility to check these folders.

Applications must be submitted by midnight on the filing deadline or they will not be accepted for any reason. FOR THIS RECRUITMENT, IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT PERMANENT FRESNO CITY EMPLOYEES APPLY THROUGH PEOPLESOFT SELF SERVICE.


Selection Process

The examination process may consist of the following:


Application review - Qualifying Only: Applications which meet the minimum qualifications will be reviewed and a limited number of the most qualified candidates will be invited to the Oral Examination. Selection of the most qualified candidates will be based upon those applications demonstrating the greatest breadth and depth of applicable education, experience, skills and training. Therefore, applicants are urged to submit sufficiently detailed information in their application materials for evaluation.


Oral Exam 100%: A panel of subject matter experts will conduct a job-related oral examination to evaluate a candidate's knowledge of: current technology of operating systems and database administration; data structure design and implementation; system design and analysis; along with relevant technical knowledge of database systems; oral and written communication skills; and ability to establish positive working relationships. Candidates must achieve a passing score to qualify for the eligible list.


The oral examination has been tentatively scheduled for the week of November 15, 2021.


Veteran Preference Regulations

Candidates applying for veteran's preference are required to submit a copy of their DD214 with their application during the specified filing period. Evidence must be presented to indicate that the candidate was discharged honorably from the military service. SEE how you can make a difference! Be part of an innovative company that cares about its associates and helps members enjoy the wonders of sight through healthy eyes and vision.

Versant Health provides vision care to 38 million members nationwide! To ensure your continued success we provide opportunities for advancement and development.

Scope and Purpose of Position

The role of the Database Analyst is to develop automated and scalable reporting capabilities for internal and external customers. This includes the development, design and maintenance of reporting capabilities utilizing SQL programming and ETL tools available within the business.

Essential Functions


Development of standardized SQL queries and stored procedures across multiple disparate servers/databases
Development of ETL processes utilizing Informatica Power Center and/or SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Creation of new claim reports for clients showing submission volumes, dollar amounts, client/state acceptance percentages and rejection volumes by reason code
Creation of reconciliation controls and reporting to ensure data submissions align with core system counts as well as responses from states and clients for file/data completeness
Ensure the timely and accurate generation of internal/external reporting, consistency and standardization amongst the various types of reports and databases and manage the various reporting tools utilized by Versant Health
Active participation in the development of data warehouse’s, data stores and other supplemental reporting enhancements, including the creation of new reporting templates and analytical reports, maintain a reporting schedule and documentation of reporting procedures
Collaborate with internal departments and external entities to identify and implement changes that will enhance core system data quality
Analyze, interpret and report financial and operational performance trends from various channels & departments, identifying areas performing outside of expected results
Develop efficiencies to consolidate and increase the effectiveness of outbound file development and reconciliation, and maintain departmental reports used internally and externally
Maintain current knowledge of regulations, data files, and their structures and associated database tables in the IT systems
Meet all time sensitive outbound file and data delivery dates
Interact with Client Management and Clients directly to discuss reporting requirements and deliver reporting results
Perform ad hoc duties in accordance with business needs

Education and Experience


Preferred Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent combination of experience and education
5+ years SQL development experience; advance SQL skills required
3+ years’ ETL development experience using Informatica PowerCenter and/or SSIS
Experience within health care industry and knowledge of claims data highly desirable
Extensive experience with Microsoft Excel, Access and/or other data analysis reporting tools
Preferred experience with application logic with an ability to read/develop programs and review the logic of programs developed by others as well as to read file layouts
Ability to work onsite and participate in interactive onsite meetings on a regular and predictable basis
Ability to initiate immediate interaction, coordination and collaboration with team members, clients, customers etc.

HIPAA & Security Requirements
All Associates must comply with the Health Insurance Portability Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) as it pertains to disclosures of protected health information (PHI) as described in the Notice of Privacy Practices and HIPAA Privacy Policies and Procedures. As a component of job roles and responsibilities, Associates may have access to covered information, cardholder data or other confidential customer information which must be protected at all times. As a result, Associates must explicitly adhere to all data security guidelines established within the Company’s Privacy & Security Training Program.

Cass Information Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ: CASS) is a leading provider of integrated information and payment management solutions. The Database Systems team plays a critical role in supporting our database platforms which includes Oracle, SQL Server and DB2 Mainframe. The team manages data security and privacy including data integrity, conducts data backup and recovery, tunes database performance, and improves query processing performance. This team is a collection of well-rounded database administrators supporting and maintaining the database environment to ensure high performance to avoid any business disruptions.
As a S enior Database Administrator , you will manage our Oracle, SQL Server and DB2 Mainframe databases. Your collaboration with teammates and other technical team members will allow you to identify and mitigate any potential issues with the data. In turn, this will ensure the integrity of the bank’s data and it is secure.
The Database Systems team is a close-knit group of database professionals with a shared commitment of providing a strong and robust database environment. Trust and open communication are the cornerstones of how we roll, and we have plenty of fun while doing it! Self-education, peer consultation, mentor guidance, and formal training/seminars are some of the methods that we share information and knowledge.
How you’ll spend your time:
Installing, configuring, maintaining and upgrading the applicable database software on the corresponding hardware platforms.
Proactively monitoring databases and its performance, and tuning the databases accordingly to ensure peak performance.
Tending to regular database backups and performing any recovery activities when required.
Conducting database change management.
Interacting with users and technical teams to ensure data integrity and data security.
We’re excited to talk with you if:
You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or related field and at least 4 years of database administration experience, OR at least 7 years of database administration experience.
You have at least 7 years of experience using Oracle (10g/11g/12c) , SQL Server (2008R2/2012/2014/2016) , and/or DB2 Mainframe. It is preferred that you have experience with all three databases, but we will provide training on the database with least experience.
You have solid knowledge of the databases and related tools to support, administer or diagnose the RDBMS.
You have experience with UNIX shell scripting, ssh configurations, and PL/SQL including UNIX commands and architecture for an Oracle database.
You have experience with SQL Profiler and SQL Networking including SSAS, SSIS or SSRS for a SQL Server database.
You have solid experience with z/OS for a DB2 database.
Open to qualified remote candidates.

THIS POSTING WILL BE USED TO CONDUCT ONGOING RECRUITMENT AND WILL REMAIN OPEN UNTIL POSITION HAS BEEN FILLED
Why does the job exist?
The IT Database Administrator position designs, develops, monitors, and optimizes the Workers Compensation Administration's (WCA) database technologies. The WCA's database administrator is responsible for database creation and implementation, performance monitoring and tuning, troubleshooting, backup and recovery, and security.
How does it get done?
Configure, install, test and maintain SQL 2012 or higher database and Windows 2012 or higher server including associated software such as security updates and patches. Also, monitor and manage database performance and troubleshoot database problems.
Design and implement database security layers to include user rights, access, and encryption. Establish coding standards and practices for data elements.
Perform database backup on a regularly scheduled basis, and database recovery when required.
Produce and maintain documentation (i. e. data dictionary, Entity Relationship Diagrams)
Who are the customers?
Both internal and external users associated with WCA.
Ideal Candidate
The ideal candidate for this position has experience in the following:
Database administrationAdministering SQL server 2012 or higherSQL scripting, security hardening, and database operations and maintenanceSQL server performance tuning, backup and recovery solutions, perform disaster recovery setupinstalling and configuring both Windows Server 2010 or higher and SQL 2012 or higher, including all required security patches and updates

Associate's degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems (MIS), Information Technology, Engineering or similar technical degree and two (2) years of experience in data analysis, design, storage and security. Substitutions Apply. See Substitution Table below.

Job Research
Primary Location TN-Nashville-Robinson Research
Organization Clinical Pharmacology - Lab 104341
Shift Days
Sr. Database Administrator - Clinical Pharmacology
ABOUT THE JOB
The Senior Database Administrator supports research activities as part of an accomplished research team in the Clinical Pharmacology Division at Vanderbilt University Medical Center. The overall theme of research is mechanisms underlying variability in response to drug therapy, with a particular focus on therapies used to treat cardiac arrhythmias. The individual projects focus on emerging models in molecular medicine and genetics.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Applications: Maintain and handle requests for research data formatting tools, as requested. Applications may include but are not limited to R/web app, dbGaP SRAtoolkit, RedCap, Jupyter Hub management, Rstudio management.
Routine analysis: Polygenic risk score calculations, genotype imputation and quality control, HLA imputation, data download and preprocessing for WES/RNAseq/Genotype, Misc. 1-off analyses, mostly in R (plotting, correlations, associations, binning, case/control matching).
Data exploration: E.g. specific variant frequencies within database populations, absence/presence of novel variants, gene expression reports.
Server Management: Create user accounts, resolve access and permission issues, balance data usage across multiple partitions as they change, install R/Python/Perl/System packages when requested. Replace hardware (e.g. failed drives) and order new equipment, OS reinstalls, new website configuration/management, backup configuration/management.
The responsibilities listed are a general overview of the position and additional duties may be assigned.

Department Summary:
The scientific mission of the Clinical Pharmacology Division is to understand the mechanisms of drug action in humans in order to improve therapeutics. The research of the Division members bridges the basic and clinical sciences. In addition to conducting state-of-the-art research, members of the Division also lead many institutional and national efforts to train clinical and translational investigators and to support infrastructure for translational research.
Position Shift: 1st shift

It is a place where your diversity — of culture, thinking, learning and leading — is sought and celebrated. It is a place where employees know they are part of something that is bigger than themselves, take exceptional pride in their work and never settle for what was good enough yesterday. Vanderbilt’s mission is to advance health and wellness through preeminent programs in patient care, education, and research.

Healthcare’s Most Wired: Among the nation’s 100 “most-wired” hospitals and health systems for its efforts in innovative medical technology.

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer-facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience with C-Level/Director level customers in IT/Business to craft their Enterprise Architecture and IT Strategies
Relevant Application/Database replatforming experience (Commercial to Open Source Engines)
Knowledge of replication technologies such as Oracle GoldenGate, Amazon Database Migration Service, or similar
Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Experience in writing procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, T-SQL, PL/pgSQL, stored procedures
Experience in AWS Platforms and Service
Experience with Custom/COTS Applications and their implementation/maintenance is highly desired
Experience with TCP/IP Networking
Experience with MS Office (Excel)
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired

Job Title: SAP Platform – Senior HANA Database Administrator
Description:
Who We Are
Collaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world's most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We're looking for diverse, talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.
Who We're Looking For
Toyota's ITx/DCX-Finance, Accounting, Procurement Department is looking for a passionate and highly motivated SAP Platform – Senior HANA Database Administrator.
The primary responsibility of this role is to focus on design, implement and maintain a strategic view of TMNA's HANA database modeling, responsible for maintaining the HANA roadmap. The successful candidate must have experience monitoring, tuning, and troubleshooting SAP HANA systems, implementing SAP HANA Table management techniques - data compression, table partition, compression techniques, and load/unload table into memory. A HANA system administration using SAP HANA Cockpit and HANA Studio and experience with high availability and the backup mechanism is also required for this position.
Reporting to the Senior Manager, ITX EO - SAP Platform, the person in this role will work closely with the ERP Delivery team and support activities of Toyota North America's various SAP initiatives. This role will engage closely with the ERP Experience team, ERP Delivery team, Functional Process Owners, Design Leads, and COE to efficiently receive knowledge from the implementation team and support critical business activities.
What You'll Be DoingMaintain the overall health of S/4Hana databases, responsible for database monitoring, backup, and restore activities, performing failover scenarios, and optimizing the database costs.
Collaborating regularly with SAP basis team members and other areas delivering value across the enterprise, managing technical debt, and maximizing technical investment in SAP.
Being highly reliable for complex enterprise system environments.
Understand the overall SAP enterprise system landscape and can perceive functional requirements between SAP components within the core ERP solution being deployed as well as integrate to Non-SAP applications in the enterprise environment.
Involved in all phases of the life cycle implementation, including blueprinting, mapping, prototype, design, configuration, testing, go-live, user training, and post-release support.
Design, implement and maintain a strategic view of TMNA's HANA database modeling, responsible for maintaining the HANA roadmap. Experience in monitoring, tuning, and troubleshooting SAP HANA systems. Implementing SAP HANA Table management techniques - data compression, table partition, compression techniques, and load/unload table into memory. HANA system administration using SAP HANA Cockpit and HANA Studio. Experience with high availability and backup mechanism.
Strategic planning for continuous improvement and upgrading of the SAP platform. Enhance SAP efficiency, stability, security, and reduce total cost of ownership. Develop a vision to monitor data growth and suggest database level efficiencies.
Lead in all phases of the HANA DB upgrades, including POC, blueprinting, mapping, design, configuration, testing, go-live, and support.
Create and maintain standard operating procedures and guidelines. Create/follow up on problem reports, root cause analysis in case of any outages.
What You Bring
Experience in SAP HANA database administration, hosting, problem-solving, managing data growth proactively.

Experience in HANA DB version upgrades, patching, supporting license audits.
Experience in operational excellence - Sets up alerts and checks to detect potential problems creeping up and use knowledge and skills to prevent them from happening.
Experience in HANA Installation, Data Provisioning, ongoing tuning of HANA systems.
Experience with troubleshooting and debugging complex integrated applications.
Experience in full cycle implementations (prior experience in defining/implementing worldwide solutions across multiple legal entities in highly complex systems and project environments) serving as Hana administrator lead.
Must have excellent verbal and written communications skills to work across teams to develop and implement complex projects.
Added Bonus If You HaveBachelor's degree.
HANA 2.0 experience.
Ability to work with large distributed teams with diverse competencies, skills, and abilities.
Ability to work under pressure.
Experience implementing systems using any of the Agile methodologies.
Experience in full life cycle implementations (prior experience in defining/implementing worldwide solutions across multiple legal entities in highly complex systems and project environments) serving as lead PO/PI lead.
Experience in working in an onshore/offshore model.
Strong business process knowledge and association of processes to technical areas in SAP is desired.
Ansible scripting is a plus.
What We'll Bring
During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect.
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement.
Vehicle purchase & lease programs.

Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family.
Flextime and virtual work options (if applicable).
Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute.
Paid holidays and paid time off.
Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools, and more.
Flexible spending accounts.
Relocation assistance (if applicable).
Belonging At Toyota
Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members' efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong. As a company that has been one of DiversityInc's Top 50 Companies for Diversity and a member of The Billion Dollar Roundtable supporting minority and woman-owned suppliers for over 10 years, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business.
Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics.
Have a question or need assistance with your application? Check out the How to Apply section of our careers page on Toyota.com.
To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time.

WE ARE HIRING!!! Opportunity for a Database Administrator – TS/SCI Poly – Annapolis Junction, MD
CyberCore Technologies provides Services for Government and Commercial Clients. We have procured, integrated, and delivered over $2.6B in Information Technology products. CyberCore provides a wide range of professional services and solutions with specific strengths in Cyber Security, Networking, Engineering/Operations, and Software Development.
Job Responsibilities:
This will be a 5 year effort to build a scalable, automated Malware Analysis Solution.
The Database Administrator shall provide database administration for development and production environments, provide database application support to development teams, consult with software development teams on database schema design optimization, and engage in ongoing database performance tuning efforts to assure optimal performance for database applications. The Database Administrator shall create and maintain performance benchmarks and metrics, make recommendations on hardware and software specifications for optimal database performance, administer Oracle, SQL Server and MySQL database servers, support certification and accreditation activities, and perform all duties related to on-going operation of the database infrastructure. Tasks shall include, but not be limited to, database and application troubleshooting, installation, backups, configuration and performance tuning, development support, scripting, and producing documentation. Assist with all duties related to on-going operation of the database infrastructure.
Required Candidate Qualifications:
Active TS/SCI Poly.
Eight (8) years demonstrated experience designing, developing and/or maintaining databases, data warehouses or multidimensional databases. A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Information Systems or Related Discipline may be substituted for four (4) years of experience, or a Master of Science Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Information Systems or Related Discipline may be substituted for six (6) years’ experience.
Four (4) years demonstrated direct experience administering database servers (e.g Oracle, SQL Server or MySQL).
Experience shall include database installation, configuration, performance tuning and backups.
Four (4) years demonstrated experience administering database servers and/or cloudbased systems. Particular type of database server will be dependent on the position being filled. Experience shall include database installation, configuration, performance tuning and backups.
Two (2) years demonstrated experience with scripting languages.
CyberCore has, on many occasions, expressed support and commitment to the principles of diversity and equal employment opportunity. It is CyberCore’s policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote individuals, as well as administer all personnel actions, without regard to race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, veteran status or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal or state law. CyberCore will not tolerate unlawful discrimination and any such conduct is prohibited. CyberCore is committed to ensuring that CyberCore’s workforce and volunteers reflect America’s diverse population. CyberCore knows that such diversity will enrich the company with the talent, energy, perspective and inspiration we need to achieve our mission.

SIG is seeking an experienced Oracle DBA specializing in the Ellucian Banner ERP. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of five to ten years’ experience working as a consultant or at a college or university as a DBA responsible for the Ellucian Banner product with technical project lead responsibilities. SIG offers competitive salaries and benefits. This role is remote. SIG is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
Required Qualifications of the Oracle Banner DBA:
Experience serving as a leader and Oracle Banner expert within the IT department at a college or university
Thorough understanding of the technical architecture of the Ellucian Banner software suite, including the latest release – Banner 9
Experience installing and configuring Banner 9 and all related tools and products
Five to ten years of experience supporting an Oracle database environment and related tools
Five to ten years of experience conducting database tuning, maintaining security, conducting backups, and optimizing Oracle Banner technical environments
Demonstrated experience supporting the integration and maintenance of third-party applications that integrate with the Banner ERP. Examples include Touchnet, Cashnet, Atomic, NelNet, Kronos, Webfocus, Evisions Intellecheck and learning management systems such as Canvas or Moodle
Experience with tools such as GIT, Ellucian Solution Manager (ESM), Application Navigator, Banner 9 Admin Pages and Self-Service, Jenkins Agent and Ellucian Ethos Identity and Integration services
Ability to quickly and accurately troubleshoot database issues and offer effective solutions
A demonstrated understanding of application single sign-on for the Banner 9 release
Ability to manage multiple complex and time sensitive projects simultaneously
Responsibilities of the Oracle Banner DBA:
Provide support of the Oracle database and related tools for multiple clients
Review and install updates and patches for the Banner ERP and related 3rd party products
Conduct database tuning, security, backups, and optimization of the database for the Banner ERP
Create, maintain and upgrade ERP environment including Tomcat and Webfocus servers
Provide troubleshooting assistance with issues related to user logins and single sign on for Banner9
Provide senior technical leadership to assist clients with complex technical planning and task management for clients implementing all the Ellucian Banner products

At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
Are you seeking a position within a growing company? Broadridge is hiring! Our mission is to attract, develop and retain outstanding talent. Being a place where exceptionally driven and hardworking people want to work is how we deliver award-winning services to our customers and ultimately build customer value. We’re seeking an Oracle Database Administrator to join our stellar team! You will have the opportunity to support our cutting edge products while working with the newest technologies.
Responsibilities:
Perform database build using automated procedures where available.
building databases using procedures/automation scripts that have been tested and developed by senior level DBA or DB Engineers
Participate in designing a database solution to perform within pre-defined bounds in areas as space, memory, CPU utilizations, and response times.
Ensure database backups are being run on a regular basis per backup and retention policies.
Ensure that recovery procedures and scripts are in place on all database servers.
Database maintenance including gathering of statistics, reorgs, memory tuning.
Monitor databases using pre-defined processes and procedures to ensure that they are performing within pre-defined bounds in such areas as space, memory, cpu utilizations, response times, etc.
Perform and validate database / schema changes.
Perform data movement tasks such as import, export, load, refreshes, etc.
Ensure that DR processes are tested and in working order during regular DR exercises.
Provide first level problem support.
Identifies current initiatives and key issues related to organizational technological policies.
Describes expected benefits of effective organizational IT policies, standards and procedures
Qualifications
Minimum 3 years experience in large organization
You should have Oracle DBA experience and knowledge with minimum Oracle 12c to 19c
Experience with Linux, crontab and shell scripting
Familiarity with AWS/Cloud knowledge.
Knowledge of HA and DR architecture and solutions for database recovery.

Company Description
Medable's mission is to get effective therapies to patients faster. We provide an end-to-end, cloud-based platform with a flexible suite of tools that allows patients, healthcare providers, clinical research organizations and pharmaceutical sponsors to work together as a team in clinical trials. Our solutions enable more efficient clinical research, more effective healthcare delivery, and more accurate precision and predictive medicine. Our target audiences are patients, providers, principal investigators, and innovators who work in healthcare and life sciences.
Our vision is to accelerate the path to human discovery and medical cures. We are passionate about driving innovation and empowering consumers. We are proactive, collaborative, self-motivated learners, committed, bold and tenacious. We are dedicated to making this world a healthier place.

RECRUITMENT IS OPEN UNTIL FILLED OR UNTIL A SUFFICIENT NUMBER OF APPLICATIONS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED. RECRUITMENT MAY CLOSE AT ANY TIME.


The Information Services Department is offering an outstanding career opportunity to a dedicated professional to manage the City's databases, which include standards and procedures relating to the integrity of City-wide information systems; serving as an expert technical resource on database architecture, design, and administration; recommending and maintaining City-wide and industry standards for database design and database administration; and maintaining system security. Incumbents may serve as a lead worker to other staff. The ideal candidate should be highly skilled in Oracle and/or Microsoft SQL Server databases (including Microsoft SQL Server 2012, 2016, 2017 and newer), operating systems (Windows, Linux, Unix), Esri SDE Geodatabases, as well as project management. Experience with Accela, human resource, financial, and utility billing applications is advantageous.

The current vacancy exists in the Information Services Department. Immediate and future vacancies will be filled from this eligible list for a period of six (6) months from the date the eligible list is created, with the option of extending that period at the City's discretion. If the examination process is suspended for this recruitment, the eligible list may be limited to three (3) months.


Conditions of Employment

The following applies to applicants who apply on or after 10/14/2021: As required by Emergency Order 2021-02, section 7.8, newly hired City employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 regardless of the employee¿s duty location or work arrangement (e.g., telework, remote work, etc.), subject to such exceptions as required by law. If selected, you will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit documentation of proof of vaccination before appointment or onboarding with the City. The City will provide additional information regarding what information or documentation will be needed and how you can request of the agency a legally required exception from this requirement.


Pay,Benefits, & Work Schedule

BENEFITS: UNIT 13: City of Fresno Professional Employees Association (CFPEA)

RETIREMENT: Fresno City Retirement System, one of the best funded public systems in the state. Reciprocity with other public California systems. The City does not participate in Social Security. Vested in Retirement benefits after 5 years of service.
HEALTH INSURANCE: The City contributes toward monthly premiums for PPO medical, dental and vision for employee and dependents.
FLEXIBLE SPENDING ACCOUNT: IRS 125 Plan for health and dependent care expenses.
DEFERRED COMPENSATION: Increase your retirement savings with the City¿s 457 plan.
MANAGEMENT LEAVE: 60 hours per fiscal year.
ANNUAL LEAVE: Twenty (20) days per year of Annual Leave with cash out provisions.
HOLIDAYS: Ten (10) City-observed annual holidays plus birthday and one (1) personal day.
LIFE INSURANCE: Benefit equal to annual salary; premium paid by the City.
LONG-TERM DISABILITY: Benefit equal to 66.66% of monthly salary up to $7,500 per month after 30 days of disability; premium paid by the City.

Additional information regarding the City of Fresno benefits is available at www.fresno.gov.


The Requirements

Applicants must meet the minimum qualifications on or before the posted filing deadline in order to qualify for the examination and does not assure a place on the eligibility list.


A Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Systems, or related fields (A copy of diploma must be scanned and attached to your online application).

-AND-


Two (2) years of experience involving application development, operation and maintenance of system software, and database administration functions.


A copy of degree or college transcripts must be uploaded and included in your on-line application for verification of requirement. Applicants lacking the documentation may be rejected if relying upon education to meet the Minimum Requirements.


Additional Requirements

The selected eligible candidates certified will be required to successfully pass a Department interview and a Department of Justice fingerprint prior to employment with the City of Fresno.

Possession of a valid California Driver's License required at time of appointment. Candidates considered for hire must provide proof of a valid driver's license and current copy of their driving record.


Eligibles certified to the Police Department for consideration must successfully complete a polygraph test, an extensive background investigation, and a department interview before receiving conditional offers of employment. Individuals receiving a conditional offer of employment must successfully complete the Department of Justice fingerprinting process before receiving a final offer of employment.


How To Apply

APPLICANTS MUST COMPLETE AN ON-LINE APPLICATION. PLEASE VISIT www.fresno.gov/jobs. TO APPLY. For information on how to complete an on-line application, please view "Instruction Guide" on the City's website, Personnel Services Career Opportunities page, or call +91-XXXXXXXXXX for assistance. Resumes will not be accepted in lieu of a completed employment application.


ALL CORRESPONDENCE regarding this recruitment and exam process will be sent via e-mail. All applicants will acknowledge such understanding when they complete their on-line application. Verify we have your correct e-mail address before you submit your application. It is an applicant's responsibility to check their email frequently to ensure they receive all pertinent communication from the Personnel Services Department on a timely basis. Applicants will receive an automatically generated confirmation e-mail upon a successful application submittal. The e-mail is the only proof of submittal.


It is an applicant's responsibility to check their email account and to ensure it is set up to accept emails from the City of Fresno. Dependent upon your settings, notices from the City of Fresno may be directed to the junk mail or spam folders. It is the applicant's responsibility to check these folders.

Applications must be submitted by midnight on the filing deadline or they will not be accepted for any reason. FOR THIS RECRUITMENT, IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT PERMANENT FRESNO CITY EMPLOYEES APPLY THROUGH PEOPLESOFT SELF SERVICE.


Selection Process

The examination process may consist of the following:


Application review - Qualifying Only: Applications which meet the minimum qualifications will be reviewed and a limited number of the most qualified candidates will be invited to the Oral Examination. Selection of the most qualified candidates will be based upon those applications demonstrating the greatest breadth and depth of applicable education, experience, skills and training. Therefore, applicants are urged to submit sufficiently detailed information in their application materials for evaluation.


Oral Exam 100%: A panel of subject matter experts will conduct a job-related oral examination to evaluate a candidate's knowledge of: current technology of operating systems and database administration; data structure design and implementation; system design and analysis; along with relevant technical knowledge of database systems; oral and written communication skills; and ability to establish positive working relationships. Candidates must achieve a passing score to qualify for the eligible list.


The oral examination has been tentatively scheduled for the week of November 15, 2021.


Veteran Preference Regulations

Candidates applying for veteran's preference are required to submit a copy of their DD214 with their application during the specified filing period. Evidence must be presented to indicate that the candidate was discharged honorably from the military service. Veterans, including City employees, must resubmit proof of honorable service for every examination for which veteran's preference credit is requested. Qualified veterans who pass the examination will have five (5) points added to their final score.

Build IT that Develops Financial Futures
At Vanguard, technology is integral to helping our clients reach their personal goals. We depend on IT 24/7 to run our investors’ assets. That puts your expertise in Technology Operations at the heart of our business.
As a Database Administrator, you will be joining the Database Operations team supporting Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server and various AWS database technologies. You will work with application developers, fellow DBA’s, and IT leadership to improve the efficiency, resiliency, production stability, automation, and reliability of Vanguard’s database infrastructure. The Database Operations team is responsible for ensuring the operational excellence of Oracle, SQL Server, and cloud data platforms. The team is also responsible for architecture, upgrades, administration, performance and tuning, automation, and feature/function research and development for database infrastructure.
The ideal candidate should have working knowledge of:
DBA best practices and concepts: database backup & recovery, database performance tuning, database monitoring, and maintenance.
Knowledge of Oracle, SQL Server, and contemporary relational DBMS platforms.
Troubleshoot complex systems to identify bottlenecks (SQL, IO, hardware, query related, etc.) and resolve database related issues.
Ability to support multiple releases, including Oracle 12c/18c/19c, Microsoft SQL Server 2016/2019, etc.
Designing databases and data modeling concepts.
Automation and scripting skills; PowerShell, Shell Scripting, PL/SQL, T-SQL, etc.
Working knowledge of Cloud Providers & Solutions / AWS preferred.
Great communication and documentation skills that leads to internal problem resolutions documents, lessons learned, how to, and knowledge transfer.
Strong skills with troubleshooting, researching and resolving blocking/deadlocking, connectivity issues, data corruption, security issues etc.
Oracle Skill set should include:
DBA in database development and supports Oracle versions of 12c, 18c and 19c on a Linux platform.
Strong skills using Bash/Korn shell scripting & PL/SQL for automation of database administration tasks and notifications.
Experience with High Availability using RAC and Disaster Recovery using Data Guard.
Troubleshooting and resolving database integrity, blocking/deadlocking, connectivity issues, security issues, etc.
Knowledge of RMAN for backups and recovery using a catalog.
Experience using OEM 13c for monitoring & alerting.
Knowledgeable of the Linux environment.
Experience with basic Performance Tuning.
Knowledge of Oracle tools, (Toad, SQL Developer, OEM, OID, etc.).
SQL Server Skill set should include:
DBA in database development and supports MS SQL Server 2016/2019 on a Windows platform.
Strong skills using PowerShell scripting & T-SQL for automation of database administration tasks and notifications.
Experience with Disaster Recovery/High Availability using Always ON Availability Groups, Replication, and Mirroring.
Troubleshooting and resolving database integrity, blocking/deadlocking, connectivity issues, security issues, etc.
Knowledge of backups, restores and recovery models.
Experience using SCOM for monitoring & alerting.
Knowledgeable of the Windows Server environment.
Experience with basic Performance Tuning.
Knowledge of SQL Server tools, (SSMS, SCOM, Extended Events, SQL Profiler, Query Store, Brent Ozar procedures, etc.).
Non-Technical Skill set should include:
Welcome challenges with enthusiasm, high-energy and a sense of urgency.
Thrive on driving outcomes in an ambiguous environment through the people they work with to deliver innovative solutions and influence at the team level.
Independently keep up with technology trends and apply that to their day to day work.
Manage multiple priorities and work effectively to provide thought leadership to IT management.
In this role you will:
Work closely with application developers for critical business applications/databases with the largest numbers of interfaces and users.
Resolve complex Production database problems.
Perform database administration for Oracle, SQL Server, and AWS databases, including installations, upgrades, configurations, and patch applications. Perform day to day monitoring, optimizing, and developer support for creation of databases, tables, and indexes. Build backup and recovery jobs.
Recommend implementation technology to application developers.
Conduct performance analysis of applications and database management systems.
Administer and maintain production, test, and development databases.
Test and evaluate IT vendor products.
Review application designs for compliance with Production acceptance requirements. Ensure backup, recovery, security, reliability, and performance of the systems.
Provide key technical input and expertise in large scale projects.
What it takes:
Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination or training and experience.
Minimum of three years database administrator, data modeling, business systems analyst, development, or related work experience.
Certification in Oracle, SQL Server, or AWS, preferred but not required.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including interviewing and presentation skills.
Strong relationship management, analytical, problem solving and organizational skills.
Broad knowledge of the financial services industry.
Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks and/or projects concurrently.
Flexibility, strong decision-making skills and effective time management skills.
Proven ability to work with attention to detail under tight time constraints.
Working knowledge and experience with some or all the following:
Windows and/or Linux-based operating systems.
Virtualization – VMware.
Distributed Computing Hardware Technologies.
Network Technologies – SDN, Ethernet Fabrics, Firewalls, Load Balancers, WAN, WiFi, etc.
Directory Services – Active Directory/LDAP.
Public Cloud Providers – AWS preferred.
Middleware and monitoring administration.
Backup and restoration services.
Disaster recovery services.
Core Responsibilities
1. Provides intermediate level DBA services and performs physical database design for business applications and databases with an intermediate number of interfaces and users.
2. Maintains database logs and bug lists. Understands the business requirements for applications and implements supporting database technical capabilities.
3. Performs database administration for mid-tier server databases. Performs day to day monitoring and optimizing, and provides developer support for creation of databases, tables, and indexes. Provides recommendations for improvement, and builds backup and recovery jobs.
4. Reviews application designs for compliance with production acceptance requirements. Develops and maintains policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of a database.
5. Resolves issues elevated from staff with less experience.
6. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Minimum of three years database administrator, data modeling, business systems analyst, development, or related work experience.
Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience.
About Vanguard
We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.
For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.
We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.
Inclusion Statement
Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”
We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.
When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.
Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Job Title: Oracle/ Ms SQL Server DBA Position
Description:
Description:
This position is within a global team that provides 24/7 technical support, administration, and monitoring for Microsoft SQL, Oracle Database, and Informix Database servers. This administrator must quickly resolve database performance, integrity, capacity, replication, and other distributed data issues. A strong background in indexing, performance tuning, and the ability to troubleshoot production environments quickly is required. This position relies on extensive database experience and judgment to both accomplish goals and provide high database uptime and performance.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Design, implement, and support development, QA, staging, reporting, and production database instances
Create new tables, views, indexes, scheduled jobs, triggers, logins, etc. based on system specifications
Write T-SQL administrative scripts to automate both user and administrative processes
Create, execute and test database backup and recovery policies
Maintain integrity and reliability of data access
Collect information through traces and other logging facilities
Maintain security of database instances (Active Directory and/or standard SQL authentication)
Configure and schedule indexing, index statistics, and column-based statistics
Troubleshoot production environments quickly with an emphasis on root cause analysis
Support fault tolerant (clustered) and standalone SQL Server database environments on both physical and virtual platforms
Install, configure, and tune SQL Server default, named (standalone), and named (clustered) database instances
Perform routine DBA activities such as patching, rollbacks, security, and database migrations
Perform routine capacity management analysis (processor, memory, local disk, and shared disk)
Implement and configure third-party monitoring tool(s) and/or adequate customized solution(s) covering all supported database instances; serves to proactively monitor database/server health and alert DBA(s) of both warning and critical database/server events and conditions
Design and troubleshoot ETL packages in Business Intelligence Development Studio
Serve as backup to all database and middleware instances
Build and enforce database change management, security standards, and best practices across all database environments and ensure processes are adhered to and documented
Work in global environments and collaborate effectively with team members in remote offices
Consult application staff on programming issues, data access, and structure changes
Collaborate with other Vertiv teams, teammates, vendors, and users on issues, access, upgrades, etc.
Generate and maintain technical documentation
Knowledge of data warehouse, database design, data definitions, system capabilities, and data integrity issues

Job Summary: Assumes overall responsibility for all projects within team and/or site. Coordinates the assessment, plan, implementation and evaluation of projects, including the acquisition of hardware and software. Assigns I/S staff and coordinates these with those of departmental personnel in a matrix relationship to various projects and directs their activities for the project. Evaluates performance of staff and prepares reviews. Assumes responsibility for customer service within their team.

Minimum Requirements: Work requires the level of knowledge normally acquired through the completion of a Bachelor of Science degree or appropriate long term experience in Computer Science or related field.

Minimum of 8 years progressive experience in Information Services with 3 years leadership experience in Information Services.

Work requires understanding of the organization; customer service initiatives and the ability to educate and mentor staff in customer service. Work requires the ability solve complex problems with minimal direction, involving multiple hardware and software platforms. Work requires strong project management skills and experience with large project leadership. Work requires effective interpersonal, communication and leadership skills to promote growth as individuals, teams and as an organization. Work requires the ability to communicate effectively and efficiently to all levels of staff within the organization, in the written and oral form.. Work requires knowledge of a wide range of hardware and software for mainframes, PC's and networks to manage technical experts in the respective sections.


Preferred Qualifications: Master's degree preferred

Eight to Ten (8-10) years progressive experience in Information Services, five to seven (5-7) years experience supporting and/or managing large enterprise databases (i.e Epic Cache, Microsoft SQL, Oracle). (3) years leadership experience.
