Job Title: Senior SQL Server Developer / SQL DBA
Description:
We have been retained by our growing client, an excellent organization, located in Dallas, Texas to deliver an Senior SQL Server Developer / SQL DBA on a regular full-time, direct-hire basis. Work remote two (2) days a week. You will join a company that is solid as a rock with one the main, core line of business is very profitable and growing, and another financial information technology invention that may provide another line of business as a software as a service. This company is growing it’s core line of business and a SQL Developer / SQL DBA developer is needed to join this company using cutting edge technology, and begin with some rigorous SQL Server tuning or query optimization including improvements and refactoring on T-SQL, stored procs, queries, joins, and indexes. As well as more design, SQL architecture, SQL development of stored procs, indexes, joins and development of a new applications features, and reporting, as you learn more about this fairly complex business logic. Any banking experience is definitely a plus, but not required.
Perform development on SQL Server, including query optimization, refactoring of SQL, improvements to joins, indexes, and business logic on the SQL Server side. This position is much more of pure SQL Server Developer, there is a DBA tool, but we need mostly a pure SQL developer, T-SQL, performance tuning, refactoring the code. We need a SQL Developer candidate first, versus a Production SQL DBA, second, but both skill sets can be applied in this role. You will spend some time SQL Profiler. You will write new stored procs, and tune existing stored procs. fine tune performance issues, refactor the code. Understand the execution plan, find query speed gains, improve stored procs, however there can be production issues needing you to debug the code, but again looking at the joins, the code. There have been multiple developers over the years, consulting firms, or team members who have written this code. The ability to read the existing SQL and understand the business logic will be needed. But you will have new functionality with new stored procs, as well as perform some maintenance of the existing application and SQL Server backend. Fix issues that occur. What types of issues will you be focused on?: performance issues, stored procedures, joins, indexes, fine tune indexes, any joins, joined properly on indexed stored procedures, and error handling. We prefer a SQL Server developer candidate with near 10 years experience or mor, who can pick up and learn the existing SQL code, learn the business logic, refactor and improve the performance or speed the queries run.
Requirements: If a candidate has 7-8+ years if SQL Server development experience with banking or financial services business domain experience, then no Bachelors degree required. Otherwise, a bachelors degree is required. We prefer candidates with 10+ years experience. We prefer a candidate with 2-4+ years of experience cloud hosting of databases on any cloud (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Provider, IBM cloud). Experience needs to include significant development of SQL Server, T-SQL, (transact SQL), stored procedures, queries, joins, SQL Profiler including query optimization, indexing, joins as well as financial reporting, translating requirements into data solutions, data governance, data management, permissions, data recovery, data security and monitoring of transactions and transaction logs. Agile, Scrum and some waterfall. We prefer a senior SQL Developer candidate who can switch hit to production side on issues, indexing, and troubleshooting.
Employment Type: Regular Full-Time, Direct-Hire
Salary Range: $110,000 - $130,000 / year
Benefits: bonus, life, health / medical, dental, vision, 401k matching, paid vacation, paid holidays, paid sick days. strong benefits. excellent total package. Relocation assistance.
Location: Dallas, Texas - near downtown Dallas.
work remotely from home up to 2 days a week
Immigration: US citizens and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor H1b candidates at this time. However, H1B Visa transfers may be allowed.
No third parties. No consulting firms. Principals only.

40% Configure, maintain and troubleshoot advanced Oracle Database systems. Includes routine maintenance of client databases, evaluating performance trends, evaluation and installation of database security patches, migration of databases between servers or environments, installation and maintenance of new Oracle databases as needed.
20% Participate in the design, development, documentation and testing of new software. Provide technical feedback and advise when needed during the development cycle. Review and validate SQL scripts deployed with new releases.
10% Configure and troubleshoot basic server operating system software systems to be used with Oracle. Provide oversight and assistance as needed for operating system updates installed on Oracle database servers.
10% Maintain application and industry knowledge base on Oracle for best practices, updates, planned new releases and security patches.
10% Assist with support efforts by sharing technical expertise, assist with trouble shooting reported query and performance issues.
10% Provide guidance and direction for other implementation and support positions when needed.

Job Details
Description
Akerman LLP, a top 100 U.S. law firm serving clients across the Americas, is seeking a SQL Database Administrator for its National Information Technology Department. The location for this position is flexible.

QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

Strong command of MS SQL and MS SQL server tools
Advanced knowledge of database security, backup and recovery, and performance monitoring standards
Strong command of SSAS, SSIS, SSRS
Strong experience with MS SQL Server licensing and SQL Server architecture
Extensive knowledge of various clustering strategies (CrossBox and Always on Availability Groups.
Extensive knowledge of Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery in relation to high availability and failover for SQL server clusters
Experience with troubleshooting, good technical writing, documentation and application installation and configuration experience are also desired.
Experience with report development

OVERALL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Manage extensive SQL Server environment
Configure and maintain database servers and processes
Ensure high levels of performance, availability, sustainability and security
Analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time
Provide suggestions for solutions
Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes
Assist developers with query tuning and schema refinement
Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems
Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Demonstrate excellent multi-tasking abilities, setting priorities and meeting deadlines.
Ability to work independently and as a team member.
S/he must treat all office matters with strict confidence.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum of 5 years of experience managing a large SQL environment
Experience in a law firm environment a plus
Experience with cloud services a plus

We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package. Please submit your resume, cover letter and salary requirements. EOE

ABOUT ORLANDO HEALTH
Orlando Health, headquartered in Orlando, Florida, is a not-for-profit healthcare organization with $7.1 billion of assets under management that serves the southeastern United States.
Founded more than 100 years ago, the healthcare system is recognized around the world for its pediatric and adult Level One Trauma program as well as the only state-accredited Level Two Adult Trauma Center in Pinellas County. It is the home of the nation’s largest neonatal intensive care unit under one roof, the only system in the southeast to offer open fetal surgery to repair the most severe forms of spina bifida, the site of an Olympic athlete training facility and operator of one of the largest and highest performing clinically integrated networks in the region. Orlando Health is a statutory teaching system that pioneers life-changing medical research. The 3,200-bed system includes 15 wholly-owned hospitals and emergency departments; rehabilitation services, cancer and heart institutes, imaging and laboratory services, wound care centers, physician offices for adults and pediatrics, skilled nursing facilities, an in-patient behavioral health facility, home healthcare services in partnership with LHC Group, and urgent care centers in partnership with CareSpot Urgent Care. Nearly 4,200 physicians, representing more than 80 medical specialties and subspecialties have privileges across the Orlando Health system, which employs nearly 22,000 team members. In FY20, Orlando Health served nearly 150,000 inpatients and nearly 3.1 million outpatients. During that same time period, Orlando Health provided approximately $760 million in total value to the communities it serves in the form of charity care, community benefit programs and services, community building activities and more. Additional information can be found at http://www.orlandohealth.com, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and Twitter @orlandohealth.

Core Responsibilities
1. Provides expert level DBA servicesand performs physical database design and development for critical business applications and databases with the largest numbers of interfaces and users.
2. Develops and maintains database logs and bug lists. Understands the business requirements for applications and implements supporting database technical capabilities.
3. Performs database administration for mainframe and server databases. Performs day to day monitoring and optimizing, and provides developer support for creation of databases, tables, and indexes. Builds backup and recovery jobs.
4. Conducts performance analysis of applications and database management systems. Identifies opportunities for continuous quality improvement of technical standards, processes, and technologies. Utilizes logical models to ensure efficient and reliable database performance.
5. Reviews application designs for compliance with production acceptance requirements. Ensures backup, recovery, security, reliability, and performance of the systems. Develops and maintains policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of a database.
6. Trains and mentors staff. Resolves the most complex issues elevated from staff with less experience.
7. Tests and evaluates IT vendor products.
8. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Minimum of eight years database administrator, data modeling, business systems analyst, development, or related work experience.
Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience.
About Vanguard
We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.
For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.
We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.
Inclusion Statement
Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”
We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.
When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.
Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Job Description:
Line of Business Role Description
Reporting specialist for Global Trade Operations. Responsible for the day-to-day resolution of simple to complex reporting requests from various business partners across the organization., validating/maintaining existing report inventory, as well as providing project support.
Functions may include:
Collaborating with end users to ensure data is presented in easy to understand formatActively monitoring existing reporting to ensure accuracyAsking pertinent questions to gather relevant facts surrounding a problem, issue, or objective; weighing the relative importance, adequacy, and validity of information to form fact-based opinions, solve problems and make sound recommendationsCommunicating effectively (both written and oral) with colleagues and leadership using clear, concise, and understandable languageMaintaining robust documentation for the methodology of analyses conducted, their outcome, and information gathered through supplemental conversations
Required Skills:
Highly proficient with MS Office suite: Advanced knowledge of MS Access and Excel (advanced formulas and pivot tables)
Experience in data management, specifically with validating and integrating data and reports from multiple systems
Strong orientation toward global collaboration/partnership
Strong adaptability and capacity to work in fast-paced environments
Detail oriented with excellent time management and organizational skill
Excellent communication skills
Strong analytical skills with a focus on finding practical solutions
Ability to work independently and remotely from manager/colleagues
Desired Skills:
Microsoft Access VBA scripting
Experience developing Tableau Dashboards
Experience with MicroStrategy Development
Trade Knowledge

Description

Apptega is one of the fastest-growing cybersecurity software companies in the industry and this is a great opportunity for you to grow your career and make an immediate impact on the company. We are seeking an experienced and high-energetic Database Administrator to help take the adoption of the Apptega B2B SaaS platform to the next level. You will take the lead on key projects and tasks while assisting the Apptega team with the product roadmap and customer-requested items. Great opportunity to be part of an exciting and fast-growing tech company in the security space.

The DBA will keep the database up and running smoothly 24/7 and help us rearchitect the database to ensure data quality on load. They will also assist with client-requested data changes and reporting needs. The goal is to provide a seamless flow of information throughout the company, considering both backend data structure and frontend accessibility for end-users.

Responsibilities
Build and rearchitect database systems of high availability and quality
Design and implement database in accordance to end users information needs and views
Define users and enable data distribution to the right user, in an appropriate format, and in a timely manner
Use high-speed transaction recovery techniques and backup data
Minimize database downtime and manage parameters to provide fast query responses
Provide proactive and reactive data management support and training to users
Determine, enforce and document database policies, procedures, and standards
Perform tests and evaluations regularly to ensure data security, privacy, and integrity
Monitor database performance, implement changes, and apply new patches and versions when required
Requirements
Experience with AWS hosted MySQL (Amazon Aurora)
Excellent knowledge of data backup, recovery, security, integrity, and SQL
Familiarity with database design, documentation, and coding
Hands-on experience with database standards and end-user applications
Problem-solving skills and ability to think algorithmically
Proven working experience as a Database Administrator
Benefits

Why you should be on the Apptega Bandwagon

Be an early contributor in a company that is changing the way companies organize cybersecurity with lots of upward mobility
Work with passionate people that have experience growing and scaling technology organizations
Get into a company early and have an opportunity to put your stamp on the culture

Position Perks

You will work with an amazing team you can learn from and teach
You will experience joining a company as it scales up for growth with unlimited opportunities for advancement
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k with Matching Funds)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
Training & Development
Work From Home
Free Food & Snacks
Wellness Resources
Stock Option Plan

8+ years of DBA experience in Oracle, SQL Server, or other commercial/open source platforms
Experience with mission critical environments from one platform to another
Experience working with high availability, disaster recovery and server tuning strategies including parameters, resources, contention, etc.
Experience in Shell/Perl/ Scripting
Bachelor's degree in Computer science or equivalent experience

Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer-facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience with C-Level/Director level customers in IT/Business to craft their Enterprise Architecture and IT Strategies
Relevant Application/Database replatforming experience (Commercial to Open Source Engines)
Knowledge of replication technologies such as Oracle GoldenGate, Amazon Database Migration Service, or similar
Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Experience in writing procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, T-SQL, PL/pgSQL, stored procedures
Experience in AWS Platforms and Service
Experience with Custom/COTS Applications and their implementation/maintenance is highly desired
Experience with TCP/IP Networking
Experience with MS Office (Excel)
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. A database administrator (DBA) is responsible for the performance, integrity and security of a database. They will also be involved in the planning and development of the database, as well as troubleshooting any issues on behalf of the users.

Job Description:
The Role
The Application DBA will be accountable for project level database deliveries and provide database production support. This person will use their DBA technical knowledge to translate the project requirements by designing and implementing the appropriate database technology solution. You must be ready to work in a fast paced, pressured and highly ambiguous environment with new technologies and high business risks.
Provide DBA technology skills for migrating and supporting all the Asset Management database technology assets to the Cloud. AMT provides global technology solutions and a scalable infrastructure to the investment advisor community in a manner that helps advance their business objectives. If you are a senior level technology DBA with a passion for analyzing, delivering, and supporting technology products and services in fast paced evolving environments then a DBA career in AMT may be right for you
The Expertise and Skills You Have
In-depth hands-on experience of the concepts, architecture and administration of Oracle database and replication technologies such as Golden Gate
Worked in an Agile environment and utilize Agile practices to prioritize and drive business value for our partners
Familiarity and awareness of implementing and supporting databases in an AWS Cloud Infrastructure environment.
Drive technology product lifecycle management and deliver cross dependency application database infrastructure initiatives
You are an expert Oracle technical DBA who can analyze and implement database technology infrastructure solutions with minimal support and demonstrate the technical capability to prioritize and resolve technical issues quickly.
You can collaborate well with your team members and influence your technology peers
You demonstrate the aptitude to learn and communicate benefits of new technology solution
You can evaluate, design, and implement project database design solutions
Deliver database technology solutions that meet the business requirements within the agreed upon timeframes.
Perform application database administration functions including database performance tuning, database application design, physical data modeling, and environment support
Engage with Technology Engineering and Infrastructure groups to plan and support changes into the production environment
Resolve database technical issues efficiently whilst mitigating the impact to the business
Be the key technical member of the project delivery team
Certifications:

To provide skilled services necessary to perform Multimedia and Information System Management Support Services at the Defense Equal Opportunity Management Institute (DEOMI) at Patrick Air Force Base.
Responsibilities:

Develop database applications using Access, SQL Server, Visual Basic.Net and Visual Basic for Applications in a multi-user client/server environment using Windows operating systems.
Develop forms, reports, basic and class modules to support mission specific functionality.

Develop applications that interface directly with both Internet & Intranet web servers.
Involvement in all phases of project life cycle including design, development, unit testing and maintenance.
Maintain, modify, and upgrade existing databases and applications.
Must possess superior knowledge of Microsoft Windows 10 operating systems, Visual Basic.Net, Visual Basic for Applications, Microsoft Access 2016 and newer, and Microsoft Office Applications.
Must work well with others and possess superior skills in all facets of database management.
Must have ability to evaluate client requirements and develop applications to satisfy these requirements.
Must be able to provide training to clients on use of developed applications.

Mandatory:
Must have Associates degree or higher or ten (10) or more years of experience in database application development and administration.
Reasonable Accommodation:
It is CGS, LLC business philosophy and practice to provide reasonable accommodations, according to applicable state and federal laws, to all qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities.
Equal Employment Opportunity:
Chugach is an Equal Opportunity Employer. 8+ years of DBA experience in Oracle, SQL Server, or other commercial/open source database platforms
Experience with migrating mission critical database environments from one platform to another
Experience working with high availability, disaster recovery and server tuning strategies including parameters, resources, contention, etc.
Experience in Shell/Perl/ Scripting
Bachelor's degree in Computer science or equivalent experience

Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems
Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience with C-Level/Director level customers in IT/Business to craft their Enterprise Architecture and IT Strategies
Relevant Application/Database replatforming experience (Commercial to Open Source Engines)
Knowledge of replication technologies such as Oracle GoldenGate, Amazon Database Migration Service, or similar
Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Experience in writing procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, T-SQL, PL/pgSQL, stored procedures
Experience in AWS Platforms and Service
Experience with Custom/COTS Applications and their implementation/maintenance is highly desired
Experience with TCP/IP Networking
Experience with MS Office (Excel)
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired

About the job:

The Red Hat IT team is looking for an experienced Senior Database Administrator to work with Oracle Applications to join us. In this role, you will be responsible for the overall management and maintenance of information databases used to operate Red Hat’s infrastructure and technology platforms. You'll partner with technical teams to ensure that database performance adheres to service level agreements set with the enterprise. You’ll plan databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long-range requirements, operational guidelines and protection. You’ll ensure accuracy and completeness of data in master files and various support tools, such as base dictionaries. Successful applicants must reside in a state where Red Hat is registered to do business.
What you will do:
Support and maintain Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) databases and applications
Monitor and maintain uptime of EBS systems
Respond and resolve customer requests within specified service level agreement
Design, implement, and manage redundant systems, policies, and procedures for disaster recovery, data archiving, and backup plan to ensure effective protection and integrity of data assets
Clone and refresh non-production Oracle Applications of non-production from production backups
Participate in the team’s 24x7 on call rotation and provide occasional off-hours support based on the project requirements
Design and deliver overall database architecture strategy, standards, and practices as part of a team and align with the Enterprise Architecture team
Improve database service availability and scalability through tuning, automation, tools, and process
Maintain dashboards and create and present health reports of databases and Oracle applications regularly and maintain dashboards
Administer security and access related requests coming from business customers
Work with support vendors like Oracle, AWS, and integrated applications vendors to take actions as per service requests
Migrate code from lower environments to non-production and production
Maintain and add new existing databases in the environment
Work along with developers to troubleshoot various issues in the database domain
Monitor standby database process
Develop, implement, administer, and maintain policies and procedures for ensuring the security
Maintain integrated applications like Oracle Application Express 5.0 or higher, MarkView, AventX, Noetix, and Cybersource
Handle SSL certificate using openSSL and Oracle Wallet Manager
What you will bring:
7+ years of moderate to advanced Linux or UNIX experience, preferably with Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 6.x +
10+ years of experience in IT
Database administration skills, preferably in a Linux or UNIX environment
Oracle Data Guard implementation and support experience
Scripting knowledge with languages like Shell, Python, Perl, or BASH
Familiarity with configuration management systems, like Ansible
Experience with Oracle Database 11i, 12c and 19c
Experience with Oracle EBS R12.1.0 and R12.2.0 or higher
Ability to solve problems, make sound decisions, and use good judgement
Good written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Logical and analytical thinking with attention to detail
Skilled at working within a team-oriented and collaborative environment
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent
The following will be considered a plus:
Experience with Windows Servers
Knowledge of Oracle Application Express, Markview, Noetix
Knowledge of metrics and logging systems (Splunk, Grafana, or SignalFX)
Experience handling service requests using platforms like ServiceNow, Jira, Rally
#LI-REMOTE

Red Hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.

UF Information Technology (UFIT) is currently seeking a professional level Systems/Database Administrator to join Infrastructure and Communication Technology (ICT), a unit within UFIT.

Employment with UFIT provides an excellent opportunity to work with other employees dedicated and focused on understanding and interpreting the technological needs of the University of Florida’s innovative and inspirational community.

Infrastructure and Communications Technology (ICT) provides shared IT Infrastructure to meet the needs of the University of Florida. ICT aims to consolidate and standardize IT Infrastructure. ICT also replaces, retires, and keeps the campus IT infrastructure and communication services current to optimize and maximize all IT provided services.

System administration - Linux/Windows

About UF Information Technology

The UF Information Technology division is comprised of seven departments reporting to the Vice President & Chief Information Officer. UF is one of the nation’s top-5 universities and a dynamic and rewarding place to work. The University seeks to recruit and retain a diverse workforce as a reflection of its commitment to serve a diverse global community. Plus, UF is in Gainesville, one of Florida’s most livable cities. Known for its natural attractions (wetlands, forests, springs, wildlife) and cultural offerings (music, theater, visual arts, and historic districts), the area also is gaining a reputation as a thriving hub for high-tech start-ups, as well as invention and research collaborations. We are excited about what’s happening here and know you will want to be a part of it.

UF Information Technology is committed to attracting, hiring, and retaining a diverse workforce and values diversity of thoughts, background, and experience. Description
Job Description:
The NISC IV program at Leidos is looking for a Database Management!
The candidate will provide support with developing a Database Management System (DBMS) solution for the electronic management of all Environmental, Occupational Safety and Health (EOSH) compliance data and information for the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). Areas of Support include proper management of the Database Management System; training and database support to users; and making the Database Management System available for presentation to a wide range of potential FAA customers.
We are seeking a talented and energetic candidate to work with the best and brightest employees around the country in creating innovative all-encompassing solutions for our programs. You will work in a fast-paced and diverse environment, enjoy flexible work arrangements, and will have a management team that encourages your career development and growth.
Primary Responsibilities
Specific tasks will include:
Develop a Database Management System user-friendly interface with the ability to handle multiple types of data (e.g. documents, spreadsheets, pictures).
Facilitate the collection, storage, analysis, reporting, and metric tracking of all EOSH compliance data and information.
Ensure the EOSH Database Management System can interface, import, and incorporate information from other FAA database/systems.
Facilitate in the testing of the Database Management System; data security; and administration of the Database Management System with the wide range of stakeholders.
Assist with troubleshooting and debugging Database Management System software issues during the creation and maintenance of the new database.
Provide updates and modifications to the Database Management System based on user/customer feedback.
Develop a written Database Management System User Guide and update as changes occur.
Provide training to FAA employees who will function as Database Administrators.
Provide Knowledge Sharing Network (KSN) support.
Make the Database Management System available for presentation to a wide range of FAA senior management, EOSH workforce, and support contractors.
Position requires approximately 10% travel.
Please Note: This is a 100% Full Time Remote Work at Home position.
** Prefers candidate to be in Denver/Longmont, CO**
** Candidate has to live in Denver/Longmont, CO OR within the Western Service Area locations (i.e. California, Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, Oregon, Utah, Washington, and Wyoming) **
Required Skills:
Server Database development, design and implementation; smart device applications; cloud drives and storage (e.g. Amazon Web Service, Google Drive, DropBox, OneDrive, etc.); and data analysis.
Relational database experience within a multi-tiered environment.
Microsoft SharePoint (Knowledge Sharing Network), Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Access experience.
Bachelor’s degree related to Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent; and have a minimum of 4+ years hands-on experience in a database developer role.
Ability to obtain and/or maintain Public Trust security clearance.
Preferred Skills:
Very experienced and proficient with programming languages such as Structured Query Language (SQL) and/or Phython.
Must possess and demonstrate highly effective written and verbal communications with excellent presentation skills.
Must be skilled at understanding inter-dependencies and relationships from complex technical data sets and be a creative problem-solver with strong analytical skills.
Must be a self-starter, demonstrate initiative, and possess excellent organizational and time management skills.
Permanent telework status is acceptable, and ensure easily accessible communications with Government Technical Interpreter (GTI) and EOSH team members is provided.
Microsoft certified.

Job Description:
The Role
The Application DBA will be accountable for project level database deliveries and provide database production support. This person will use their DBA technical knowledge to translate the project requirements by designing and implementing the appropriate database technology solution. You must be ready to work in a fast paced, pressured and highly ambiguous environment with new technologies and high business risks.
Provide DBA technology skills for migrating and supporting all the Asset Management database technology assets to the Cloud. AMT provides global technology solutions and a scalable infrastructure to the investment advisor community in a manner that helps advance their business objectives. If you are a senior level technology DBA with a passion for analyzing, delivering, and supporting technology products and services in fast paced evolving environments then a DBA career in AMT may be right for you
The Expertise and Skills You Have
In-depth hands-on experience of the concepts, architecture and administration of Oracle database and replication technologies such as Golden Gate
Worked in an Agile environment and utilize Agile practices to prioritize and drive business value for our partners
Familiarity and awareness of implementing and supporting databases in an AWS Cloud Infrastructure environment.
Drive technology product lifecycle management and deliver cross dependency application database infrastructure initiatives
You are an expert Oracle technical DBA who can analyze and implement database technology infrastructure solutions with minimal support and demonstrate the technical capability to prioritize and resolve technical issues quickly.
You can collaborate well with your team members and influence your technology peers
You demonstrate the aptitude to learn and communicate benefits of new technology solution
You can evaluate, design, and implement project database design solutions
Deliver database technology solutions that meet the business requirements within the agreed upon timeframes.
Perform application database administration functions including database performance tuning, database application design, physical data modeling, and environment support
Engage with Technology Engineering and Infrastructure groups to plan and support changes into the production environment
Resolve database technical issues efficiently whilst mitigating the impact to the business
Be the key technical member of the project delivery team
Certifications:
Company Overview

At Fidelity Investments, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. As a privately held company with a rich 75-year history, our mission has remained the same since our founding: to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.

Join Us

At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning and growth so you can build the career you’ve always imagined. We welcome associates from different backgrounds and with different perspectives to help us innovate and make a difference for our customers and our communities.

We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.
Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.

Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. Overview:

The Database Administrator is an expert in planning, design, implementation and managing of business-critical enterprise database technologies and cloud databases. They provide a seamless flow of information throughout the company, considering both backend data structure and frontend accessibility for end-users. The DBA performs day-to-day administration and operational support of database integrity including collecting and reporting performance data, outage data, review of log files and other monitoring. They participate in continual process improvements, in project planning, coordination and implementation.
This position supports the Enterprise Information Services for Department of Energy (DOE) Savannah River Operations Office (DOE-SR) federal government staff and site contractors at the Savannah River Site (SRS) in Aiken SC.
Responsibilities:
Expert who is aware of all organization data sources
Manage database security roles
Install, configure and maintain SQL instances and security baselines
Install, upgrade and manage database applications (SSRS, SSIS, SSAS)
Diagnose and troubleshoot database errors, including after hours and weekends
Create and update databases and tables
Configure table indexes and relationships
Create and update stored procedures
Create, update, and manage reports, visualizations, and dashboards
Create automation for repeatable database tasks
Create and maintain documentation (Security baselines, Metadata Standards, Entity Relation Diagram (ERD), dataflow diagrams)
Configure and maintain SQL Server monitoring utilities
Monitor and tune performance of database systems
Perform back-up and restore operations
Testing back-ups on a monthly/quarterly frequency
Deploy database change scripts
Create and maintain a data dictionary
Annual database needs assessment
Perform database migrations and upgrades
Experience in SQL Server and Oracle
Work with C-Level/Director level customers in IT/Business to craft their Enterprise Architecture and IT Strategies
Experience leading client specific strategic engagements involving customer/partner teams
Migrate mission critical database environments from one platform to another
Work with high availability, disaster recovery and server tuning strategies including parameters, resources, contention, etc.
Write complex procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, TSQL PL/PgSQL, stored procedures
Perform Shell/Perl/Python Scripting
Reports to the IT/Cyber Program Manager
Qualifications:
Requires 8 years of experience with BS/BA or 5 years with MS/MA or 3 years with PhD or 12 years of experience in lieu of degrees.
Q level or Top-Secret level security clearance preferred
Experience in SQL Server and Oracle
Experience with C-Level/Director level customers in IT/Business to craft their Enterprise Architecture and IT Strategies
Experience leading client specific strategic engagements involving customer/partner teams
Experience with migrating mission critical database environments from one platform to another
Experience working with high availability, disaster recovery and server tuning strategies including parameters, resources, contention, etc.
Experience in writing complex procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, TSQL PL/PgSQL, stored procedures
Experience in Shell/Perl/Python Scripting
Industry certs a plus

St. Charles Community College is located just west of St. Louis, nestled in the heart of growing St. Charles County. Established in 1986, SCC is a public, comprehensive two-year community college offering associate degrees and certificate programs in the arts, business, sciences and career-technical fields. SCC also provides workforce training and community-based personal and professional development as well as cultural, recreational and entertainment opportunities.

We are seeking a full-time Database Administrator who will be responsible for the administration, architecture and maintenance of the College's Unidata and MS SQL Server databases.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned:

Install and manage entire lifecycle of MS SQL servers in a high-availability environment.
Ensure the security, reliability, and integrity of all databases. Stay current with best practices for database security and availability.
Review, evaluate and implement requests for changes to database architecture.
Analyze, troubleshoot and optimize system and database performance. Tune and balance clustered SQL servers.
Assist end-users in developing and using database reporting tools.
Manage and provide capacity planning.
Monitor database server performance and health.
Create and administer a proper database backup strategy as a part of a Managed Information Lifecycle.
Configure and tune MS SQL server on current and future versions of Microsoft server operating systems to achieve maximum uptime and performance.
Oversee and perform upgrades, conversions, and deployments.
Write technical documentation for internal IT audiences.
Comply with IT procedure for reporting child pornography on SCC equipment.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology or related discipline plus four years full-time relevant experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience with implementations, upgrades and patching databases.
Proficiency in developing, troubleshooting and optimizing SQL.
Highly organized and detail-oriented with strong troubleshooting ability.
Have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Be a creative problem solver with project planning skills and a desire to learn new technologies.
Experience with Unidata databases and higher education strongly preferred.

Job Description
Experience Required
Mid-Senior level
Location
Miami, Florida, United States
Employment Type
Full Time

8+ years of DBA experience in Oracle, SQL Server, or other commercial/open source database platforms
Experience with migrating mission critical database environments from one platform to another
Experience working with high availability, disaster recovery and server tuning strategies including parameters, resources, contention, etc.
Experience in Shell/Perl/ Scripting
Bachelor's degree in Computer science or equivalent experience

Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems
Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience with C-Level/Director level customers in IT/Business to craft their Enterprise Architecture and IT Strategies
Relevant Application/Database replatforming experience (Commercial to Open Source Engines)
Knowledge of replication technologies such as Oracle GoldenGate, Amazon Database Migration Service, or similar
Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Experience in writing procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, T-SQL, PL/pgSQL, stored procedures
Experience in AWS Platforms and Service
Experience with Custom/COTS Applications and their implementation/maintenance is highly desired
Experience with TCP/IP Networking
Experience with MS Office (Excel)
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired

Our Government & Public Sector Systems Engineering team delivers large-scale software applications and integrated systems, and assists clients with architecture design, assessment and optimization, and definition. Description
Job Description:
Why wake up every day and want more when YOU CAN HAVE IT? Do you love KNOWING at the end of each day that your work made a difference? We embrace and solve some of the world's toughest challenges. We’re focused on ensuring our intelligence customers have the right tools, technologies, and tactics to keep pace with an ever evolving threat landscape and succeed in their mission to protect people and critical assets around the world. Who wouldn’t be fulfilled being part of that every day? We know once you join Team Leidos, you are sure to go home at the end of every day knowing YOU MADE A DIFFERENCE, resulting in one of the most REWARDING careers you could have imagined. EACH DAY MATTERS!
We have an IMMEDIATE NEED for a Database Administrator to provide SQL and PostgreSQL support to Agile DevOps software development and to IT mission critical systems. The DBA will perform database administrator tasks including monitoring user access and security, monitoring performance and managing parameters to provide fast responses to front-end users, mapping out the conceptual design for a planned database, refining the logical design, installing and testing new versions, and refining the physical design to meet system storage requirements and conduct capacity planning
Primary Responsibilities
Act as the SME and provide best practice recommendations for SQL and PostgreSQL
Provide SQL infrastructure engineering to include database architecture maintenance, database upgrades, server configurations, and application configurations.
Install, configure, and manage multiple SQL server environments with high availability and disaster recovery, to include monitoring, analysis, reporting, and data warehouse services and solutions
Architect and design the configuration and operation of SQL platforms on all environments.
Ensure proper integration of SQL with applications to include but not limited to SharePoint, Active Directory, etc…
Ensure that storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly
Work closely with IT Project Managers and Software Developers
Communicate with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security
Commissioning and installing new applications and customizing existing applications
Support on-call activities as needed
Basic Qualifications
Clearance Required to be considered for this role is a Top Secret
5+ years of experience administering, patching, performance tuning and securing PostrgeSQL database
Preferred 3+ year administering Microsoft SQL Server
4+ years of AWS RDS management experience
Experience with scripting using Ansible, Python or similar dynamic languages
Must have excellent communications and documentation skills
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to effectively troubleshoot, resolve, or escalate problems
Experience in Federal Grants Management is a plus
BS degree and 12 – 15 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 10 – 13 years of prior relevant experience.
Preferred Qualifications

Job Description:
The NISC IV program at Leidos is looking for a Database Management!
The candidate will provide support with developing a Database Management System (DBMS) solution for the electronic management of all Environmental, Occupational Safety and Health (EOSH) compliance data and information for the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). Areas of Support include proper management of the Database Management System; training and database support to users; and making the Database Management System available for presentation to a wide range of potential FAA customers.
We are seeking a talented and energetic candidate to work with the best and brightest employees around the country in creating innovative all-encompassing solutions for our programs. You will work in a fast-paced and diverse environment, enjoy flexible work arrangements, and will have a management team that encourages your career development and growth.
Primary Responsibilities
Specific tasks will include:
Develop a Database Management System user-friendly interface with the ability to handle multiple types of data (e.g. documents, spreadsheets, pictures).
Facilitate the collection, storage, analysis, reporting, and metric tracking of all EOSH compliance data and information.
Ensure the EOSH Database Management System can interface, import, and incorporate information from other FAA database/systems.
Facilitate in the testing of the Database Management System; data security; and administration of the Database Management System with the wide range of stakeholders.
Assist with troubleshooting and debugging Database Management System software issues during the creation and maintenance of the new database.
Provide updates and modifications to the Database Management System based on user/customer feedback.
Develop a written Database Management System User Guide and update as changes occur.
Provide training to FAA employees who will function as Database Administrators.
Provide Knowledge Sharing Network (KSN) support.
Make the Database Management System available for presentation to a wide range of FAA senior management, EOSH workforce, and support contractors.
Position requires approximately 10% travel.
Please Note: This is a 100% Full Time Remote Work at Home position.
** Prefers candidate to be in Denver/Longmont, CO**
** Candidate has to live in Denver/Longmont, CO OR within the Western Service Area locations (i.e. California, Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, Oregon, Utah, Washington, and Wyoming) **
Required Skills:
Server Database development, design and implementation; smart device applications; cloud drives and storage (e.g. Amazon Web Service, Google Drive, DropBox, OneDrive, etc.); and data analysis.
Relational database experience within a multi-tiered environment.
Microsoft SharePoint (Knowledge Sharing Network), Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Access experience.
Bachelor’s degree related to Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent; and have a minimum of 4+ years hands-on experience in a database developer role.
Ability to obtain and/or maintain Public Trust security clearance.
Preferred Skills:
Very experienced and proficient with programming languages such as Structured Query Language (SQL) and/or Phython.
Must possess and demonstrate highly effective written and verbal communications with excellent presentation skills.
Must be skilled at understanding inter-dependencies and relationships from complex technical data sets and be a creative problem-solver with strong analytical skills.
Must be a self-starter, demonstrate initiative, and possess excellent organizational and time management skills.
Permanent telework status is acceptable, and ensure easily accessible communications with Government Technical Interpreter (GTI) and EOSH team members is provided.
Microsoft certified.

What is it that we do at Colonial Pipeline Company?
Colonial Pipeline is the largest refined products pipeline in the United States, transporting more than 100 million gallons or 2.5 million barrels per day. About the Senior Database Administrator Position
As a Senior SQL Database Administrator (DBA), you will be responsible for implementation, configuration, maintenance, and performance of business critical Microsoft SQL Server databases and act as secondary support for Oracle systems. You will also be part of a growing Data & Analytics team that supports many corporate applications, business functions, and new exciting digital transformation initiatives across Colonial. You are someone who has the ability to be flexibility to changing requirements and/or priorities.
What You Get to Do:
Provide database support for key applications serving multiple business needs by creating/cloning of environments, patching, maintenance activities, and transitioning systems to more highly available environments, as required.
Administer the database(s) to provide highly available systems with minimal to no downtime in order to support business requirements.
Work with development team and application owners to design technical solutions for database related activities including setup, upgrades, migrations, refreshes, interface support, granting data access control and custom reporting as necessary across multiple databases.
Develop and maintain standards, procedures and methodologies for effective operation, access control and backup recovery of all database systems.
Design, implement and modify physical database structures; evaluate, test and implement database management systems, utilities and tools.
What You Bring to the Table:
Bachelor’s degree in information technology or related field from an accredited college or university; will consider a combination of experience and/or education.
Ideally, 5+ years of database administration; will also consider ideally, 8+ years of database administration in lieu of Bachelor’s degree.
Experience with multiple versions of Microsoft SQL Server, e.g., 2008, 2012, 2014, 2017, 2019.
Performed migrations and upgrades of SQL Server environments.
Ability to setup and configure SQL Server HA clusters.
Scripting, stored procedures, triggers and performance tuning where needed.
Engages in best practices as it relates to SQL Server Database Administration.
Ability to potentially work off hours in a support role for critical issues, when required.
Commitment to consistently adhere to policies and procedures and be a positive example for others by demonstrating the Company’s core values of Respect, Accountability, Innovation, Safety, and Excellence in completing work assignments.
Self-motivated, have phenomenal work ethic and looking for the right company to support your growth.
Got Extra to Bring?
Master’s Degree in Information Technology, or related field from an accredited college or university.
Database Certification such as Microsoft SQL Server or Oracle Certification.
Familiarity with working with virtual servers and their architecture.
Linux and Windows operating systems.
Experience with other RDMS platforms, preferably Oracle.
Experience with reporting and analytics platforms such as Microsoft Power BI, Alteryx
Setup and configure new or existing online presence in any of the following hosting environments – i.e. Azure, AWS.

Job Summary
As a DBA, the successful candidate will be responsible for administrating and monitoring enterprise class database technologies. Candidate should be proficient with SQL Server in a highly transactional environment and experience in AWS and PowerShell is highly desired. The DBA should possess strong technical, administration and potential leadership qualities to plan, design, develop, document, and implement strategies for the database administration of new and existing enterprise scale applications. These qualities should be used effectively to work with developers, architects, engineers, system administrators and analysts to resolve complex system issues as well as communicating the results to upper management. These communication skills should also be used to effectively manage the internal and external expectations from customers.
Experience working with monitoring tools across multiple database servers. The candidate will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining database administration and support plans, release management strategies that ensure database development is within the prescribed best practices for all assigned software systems. These responsibilities must be met while ensuring compliance with system specifications. The candidate must maintain a high degree of process, and documentation on all software releases to support existing development efforts as well as the maintenance of deployed solutions.
Job Responsibilities
Manage SQL Server databases through multiple product lifecycle environments, from development to mission-critical production systems.
Support performance tuning and verify availability and integrity of system backups
Configure and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring of system health and performance, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security.
Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end.
Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes
Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems.
Participate in on-call rotations
Must be available for remote call-out support and to perform remote system maintenance when needed after normal business hours
Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours.
Perform database administration maintenance activities while maintaining high database system availability and reliability for business applications
Implement approved database configuration changes
Perform data restoration and recover activities as needed
Assist with addressing database vulnerability issues
Assist with database account management, access and security

Qualifications
Expertise in administration of SQL Server versions 2012 and above in a replication and Always On Availability environment
Expertise in Performance Tuning
Experience with AWS
Experience in PowerShell
Expertise in tuning highly transactional OLTP as well as large Data warehouse implementations
Experience in using performance monitoring tools built in SQL Server as well as tools like Zabbix, Foglight, Dynatrace, Splunk etc., to analyze and isolate issues, and work with Development teams to resolve them
Experience with backups, restores and recovery models
Ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams
Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Familiar with the Windows and Linux operating systems

Desired Skills
Experience with administration of at least one of these databases: DB2, MongoDB, MySQL, Postgres, DocumentDB
Excellent oral and written communications and customer service skills
Bachelor's degree in science, technology, engineering, or a similar field
7+ years of DBA experience

Location: New Orleans, LA 70139 (Central Business District area)
Description:
Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology? A roll-up-your-sleeves SQL Database Administrator who wants be part of a collaborative environment? A leader who can incorporate new ideas in a think-tank and share new ideas with your colleagues? If so, consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center - we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.


Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below ...


Work you'll do/Responsibilities


The SQL team does end to end care of a large-scale enterprise MS SQL Servers
Help the application teams and developers with requests for anything from new users/roles to standing up an entire new clustered instances that is fully compliant with security standards.
Actively support our internal IT teams as well as our government clients performing regular maintenance/patching for a wide variety of MS SQL server deployment.
Work with several on prem and cloud MS SQL Servers that we support.


The Team


Our Government & Public Sector Systems Engineering team delivers large-scale software applications and integrated systems, and assists clients with architecture design, assessment and optimization, and definition. We develop service-oriented architecture (SOA) and other integration solutions to enable information sharing and management between business partners and disparate processes and systems, and we deliver technology enablement to support CIO services transformation.


Government & Public Sector Systems Engineering professionals focus on key client issues that impact the core business by maximizing operational value, driving down the cost of quality, and enhancing technology innovation. Our teams deliver a wide range of services, including application architecture design and optimization, application modernization, business process management and solution integration, custom application design and development, and large-scale technology delivery program efforts.


Required Qualifications


Bachelors degree or equivalent years of experience
Must have an Active Top-Secret Clearance or completed and SSBI background check
6+years of SQL database administration and troubleshooting
6+ years of SQL database Migration
Patching with clustering and standalone SQL instances
SQL Audit Logs, STIG standards
Experience with large-scale enterprise MS SQL Server
Travel up to 20% annually (While 20% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)
Prefer to have a Security+ Certification
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available
Travel up to 10% annually
