Apex DevOps Staff
Principal Database Administrator (IC4)
Job Summary
As part of the Software Development organization that is responsible for building Oracleâ€™s vision for Low Code SaaS, this Organization delivers Enterprise-grade service management to support Oracle Business Units and customers, focusing on next generation of cloud SaaS on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.
We are looking for a Principal Database Administrator to be a key a member of this new global team, where this challenging and highly rewarding role will allow the successful candidate to use their skills to develop and extend Oracle Apex services that will help any business generate revenue and maintain margins.
Oracle Apex provides all the tools you need to build applications in a single, low code extensible platform and runs as a part of the Oracle Database. Apex helps Oracle eliminate service complexity and deliver results faster to our customers. Focusing on devops for this new wave of SaaS services, the team will rapidly test and deploy new capabilities to add service value and customer satisfaction.
Responsibilities
We are looking for a self-driven professional that possesses a strong combination of IT engineering and IT operations skills, with a sound knowledge of Oracle database, SQL and Shell scripting.
You will solve technical challenges by defining, designing, deploying, and troubleshooting Oracle Cloud services, platforms, and infrastructure, with a focus on reliability, scalability, resilience, security, and performance.
Duties will be varied and complex requiring independent judgment and proactive action with the role including, but not limited to, the following:
Work with a world class global team to provide Oracle Database Administration support for Apex services in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.
Provide database performance monitoring, application-related run-time monitoring.
Provide database administration and application support with a high degree of customer service, technical expertise, and timeliness.
Provide accurate and creative solutions to user problems of moderate nature to ensure user productivity.
Provide On-Call support for critical production applications and databases for 24/7 operations.
Install, configure and administer Oracle databases.
Manage schemas, tables, indexes, etc. in Oracle databases 18c and upcoming versions.
Perform Weblogic deployments and configurations
Perform database system management functions (e.g. software installs, version upgrades, security patching and configuration management, fixing environment vulnerabilities, backup and recovery)
Work independently as well as communicate effectively and work across multiple geographically-diverse functional teams.
Collaborative with various members of the team to implement various security measures to safeguard data.
Research and investigate the potential impact of new threats and exploits
Define and document Standard Operating Procedures
What youâ€™ll work with
The role requires a sound knowledge of Oracle database, SQL, PLSQL scripting, Shell scripting, Weblogic administration, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure and Dev-ops tools.
Required Skills and Experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related fields or equivalent experience.
7+ years of experience on database administration in Enterprise or Cloud systems.
Strong expertise in SQL, PLSQL scripting, Oracle packages, procedures and functions, Linux bash scripting, SQL Tuning.
Good Knowledge of Oracle database technologies like RMAN, Data Pump and Data Guard.
Knowledge with Python, Ruby, Perl, Shell scripting or Java.
Good system administration skills including Linux internals, TCP/IP, DNS, load balancing technologies.
Knowledge of WebLogic Server System Administration and deployments.
Experience in developing scripts to automate application deployments and installations.
Excellent verbal and written English Language communication skills who can communicate well with middle to senior management.
A self-motivated individual who can demonstrate strong prioritization skills to retain focus on key objectives
Proficiency in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure services or equivalent
Experience with the following will be an advantage
Oracle Apex
Resolving common vulnerabilities such as: Cross-Site Scripting, SQL Injection, Cross-Site Request Forgery, HTTP Response Splitting
Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) methodology
Configuration management solutions such as Chef, Puppet, etc.
Continuous deployment and source control such as Jenkins, GIT, Maven, etc.
Knowledge of Kubernetes and Docker technologies
Practical knowledge of cryptography, encryption, ciphers, certificate and key based technologies

A database administrator (DBA) is responsible for the performance, integrity and security of a database. They will also be involved in the planning and development of the database, as well as troubleshooting any issues on behalf of the users.

Duties
Performs duties as an Oracle Database Administrator (DBA) for daily operations, maintenance and testing of multiple database instances of Oracle across several business platforms. Conducts tuning and daily database monitoring to include creating and monitoring backup and recovery procedures. Develops and tests SQL queries based on user defined conditions and requests. Monitors performance and provides recommendations to customers regarding opportunities for performance improvements. Installs, patches, and upgrades Oracle Relational Database Management Systems IAW best practices, to include compliance requirements, DISA STIGs, NIST, and any needed remediations. Works with the system administration team to create clones, establish standbys, perform backups via a variety of mechanisms (e.g., shell scripts, snapshots, exports), and create and configure new Database servers, consistent with best practice and compliance guideline established for the enclave. Ensures database availability and security.
Plans, organizes work and manages internal resources to ensure maximum productivity and economies. Safeguards Marine Corps Community Services (MCCS) data, information, funds, merchandise, supplies, equipment, and property to preclude or minimize the potential for fraud, waste and abuse.
Keeps technical skills sharp and acquires knowledge of new technology and additional RDBMS, as needed. Performs other related duties as assigned.

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
See Duties and Qualifications
EVALUATIONS:
Qualifications
A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Systems is highly preferred. Four years of experience in information technology, with three years of progressive technical experience working with current Oracle versions in a Unix environment (e.g., RHEL, Unix, AIX). Must have a strong understanding of RDBMS system architecture and components, and a solid knowledge of Oracle, SQL, and UNIX are required. Must have experience with and expertise in Oracle database administration sufficient to work independently or with light supervision. This includes monitoring, performance tuning, back-up and recovery, security administration, daily database operation and troubleshooting procedures. Experience using Oracle database administration tools such as TOAD and Oracle cloud Grid is preferred.
While not required, knowledge of and experience in the following are highly desirable:
DISA STIGs, checklists, and Risk Management Framework, Data warehouses, ETL processes and tools (e.g., Informatica), Database cloud technology, MicroSoft SQL Server, and Imperva Securesphere Database Firewall.
Must possess excellent communication and documentation skills, including having the ability to express ideas and concepts clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.
Certification in Oracle database administration, (e.g., Oracle Certified Associate, Oracle Certified Professional) or similar per DoD 8570.01-M is required within six months of employment. As an authorized and privileged user of Department of Defense Information Systems must possess or receive Information Assurance awareness by completing the Security+ CE. Certification as a condition of access within six months of employment, and thereafter must complete annual Information Assurance awareness training and maintain the Security+ CE certification.
This position has been designated as a position of trust. The incumbent must be eligible for an Access National Agency Check and Inquiries (ANACI/ Tier 3) background investigation to satisfy IT Level II designation. Appointment and continued employment is subject to a favorable adjudication of the security investigation.
Eligible for incremental telework as determined by MR/MF policy.

As a Mainframe DB2 DBA, candidate will be responsible for at least :

Administration, design, develop, implement and support highly available and scalable Mainframe DB2 database solutions.

Research and recommend innovative, and where possible, automated approaches for system administration tasks.

Collaborate with teams to understand their data access needs, recommend data models and create data structures to comply with standards and best practices.

Monitor key performance metrics, measuring the utilization, performance and overall health of the database environments.

Provide up to Level 3 on call support for the 24/7 DB2 production database environment.

Taking on such other tasks as may be required to ensure a secure, stable, and compliant environment.

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including :

10+ years of experience in Db2 z/OS Database Administration in a large complex Database Environment.

3+ years of experience in IBM Infosphere Data Replication (Q Replication).

Experience with Database Design, Performance analysis and Query tuning, Disaster Recovery.

Experience with Database administration tools like BMC Mainview for Db2, CA Platinum tools for Db2.

BMC Mainview for MQ is preferable.

Looking for extensive experience in SQL, REXX and JCL.

ACF2/RACF security system knowledge as relates to Db2.

Ability to work in an on-call 24x7 environment.

Proficiency in installing and configuring complex database management system environments.

Demonstrated ability to implement automated process to improve database system availability and reliability.

Ability to collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish common goals.

Strong technical problem-solving skills, written and oral communication capabilities, ability to influence and successfully interface with others.

Ability to communicate technical information clearly and manage risk appropriately.

Ability to thrive in a team-oriented, fast-paced environment.

Greenberg Traurig (GT), a global law firm, has an exciting full-time employment opportunity for a Senior Database Administrator in the Technology Department of our Doral (Miami) or Atlanta (ACE) office. We offer competitive compensation and an excellent benefits package.
Position Summary:

The Senior Database Administrator (Senior DBA) will administer our SQL Server database servers and
work with application owners to ensure that all enterprise databases are secure, reliable, and scalable.
The Senior DBA will provide guidance and direction to other individuals who access the information
from any enterprise database. This person will also develop and execute ad-hoc queries and custom
reports.
Duties & Responsibilities:

Maintain all enterprise SQL database operations including SQL server updates and patches.
Review current architecture, update and optimize all the firm's enterprise database systems.
Architect new database systems.
Create custom queries, data-driven SSRS subscriptions, migration scripts, and execute other tasks database-related tasks as needed.
Skills & Competencies:

Demonstrable experience configuring, operating and maintaining Microsoft SQL Server.
Sound understanding of SQL Server technology features and limitations.
Ability to create performance projections based upon hardware, OS, databases design, query structures and interactions between external systems with the database servers.
Ability to evaluate and recommend technological changes in the database environment to support business objectives.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to effectively communicate technical details to persons without technical experience.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Ability to accurately follow documented procedures and a strong aptitude for learning new technologies as they are incorporated into the computing environment.
Qualifications & Prior Experience:

Bachelor's degree plus minimum 5 years’ experience in design, development, administration, and maintenance of enterprise-level MS SQL Server database systems.
In-depth, advanced knowledge of SQL Server database structures, security, storage solutions, virtualization, replication, and clustering.
Demonstrable experience in database design, creating standards and processes, capacity planning, disaster recovery planning, accessibility, scalability and documentation for SQL Server.
Demonstrable experience in development of complex queries, SSIS Packages and SSRS reports.

Requirements

DBAs must have a minimum of ten years experience with Oracle in a production environment. Specific knowledge is required in the areas of performance tuning, file distribution, memory management and tuning SQL statements. Candidates must be skilled in the development of backup and recovery procedures and have an excellent operating system foundation.

Preferred Skills:
RAC
Grid Control
Data Guard
Identity Management
Strong Oracle internals knowledge

Responsibilities for the SQL Server Database Administrator

You will assist with administration of LLR's Microsoft SQL Server databases to include the administration of LLR's consolidated licensing system.
You will serve to coordinate all modification of database program code including the backup and integrity of the code in multiple instances and environments of the consolidated licensing system.
You will administer all database modifications with regard to efficiency, data security, user security, and system integrity.
You will support development of systems and database systems with the creation of stored procedures, functions, and job as required.
You will create and maintain both import and export specifications for various internal and external sources.
You will maintain the physical descriptions of database components.
You will develop standards, data definitions, documentation and design of security systems.
You will ensure maximum online availability of LLR databases by the use of clustered database environments.
You will maintain contact with internal and external customers for database support and problem resolution.
You will serve as a support and backup for LLR's server farm to include VMWare and Storage Area Networks.
You will monitor and report, as needed, problems and issues with servers to appropriate individuals.
You will be responsible for backups for LLR's consolidated database systems.

The Melanoma Research Foundation (MRF) seeks a Database Manager to coordinate the development, utilization and maintenance of data in accordance with the needs and objectives of the MRF. The Database Manager is responsible for training development and programmatic colleagues with key functions of the database in order to optimize its efficiency and accuracy. The Manager also manages vendor relationships relative to daily database work and coordinates with the Foundation’s financial team to ensure accuracy and timeliness of reporting.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Maintain data processing systems to: receive, code and correct donor data; eliminate and minimize duplication of records; import and export data, and archive and retrieve records
Manage data entry personnel or vendors
Actively engage in Blackbaud trainings and webinars to increase the Foundation’s efficiency in the software
Troubleshoot data-related problems
Work collaboratively with staff and external consultants to run mailing lists for fundraising, special events, marketing and newsletters in a timely and efficient manner
Process annual pledge reminders and acknowledgements
Handle incoming donor calls regarding making a gift to the Foundation or questions about an existing gift or tax receipt
Provide ongoing training on database best practices
Develop and communicate data policies and procedures
Work collaboratively with staff and outsourced accounting to produce accurate and timely revenue reports, projections, and analyses
Understand non-profit structure and strategy and how it corresponds with database structure and reporting

Additional details and position requirements can be found in the official position description. Qualified candidates should submit a resume and cover letter to MRF Senior Project Officer Ivis Alfaro at ialfaro@melanoma.org.

Key Responsibilities

Configure, update, maintain and monitor the health status, availability, performance, storage and jobs of the MS SQL environment, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security.

Follow specifications for building new or changing existing integrations.

Design and implement ETL processes with Azure Databricks, Spark SQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Database, and Azure DevOps

Maintain SQL Backups, restores, migrations, and availability groups

Create and maintain adequate documentation for all processes and environment.

Daily checks of all integration jobs for failures and engage third party vendors for support

Ability to prioritize on-going tasks and projects with distractions while maintaining attention to detail; Ability to meet deadlines and deal with shifting priorities.

4 + years of SQL Server Development using SQL, SSIS, SSRS for SQL Server 2012+

2 + years of SQL Server database administration

Advanced T-SQL capabilities

5 + years of IT experience

Bachelor's degree in Information Systems or Computer Science preferred but not required

Must be able to work collaboratively within a multi-disciplinary team.

Must have strong verbal and written communication skills.

Proficient use of all Microsoft Office Suite programs

SQL performance improvement using various methods

Self-motivated and directed with sharp attention to detail

Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate Applications from Oracle/SQL*Server databases to Aurora-PostgreSQL/MySQL or other Open Source platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL*Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora-PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You be required to travel to client locations to deliver professional services when needed.

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate Applications from Oracle/SQL*Server databases to Aurora-PostgreSQL/MySQL or other Open Source platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL*Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora-PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You be required to travel to client locations to deliver professional services when needed.

Experience in AWS Platforms and Service
Experience with Custom/COTS Applications and their implementation/maintenance is highly desired

Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms (e.g. Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Netezza, Teradata, Vertica, etc.) desired
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired

Are you an experienced Oracle/SQL*Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open Source Database platforms such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the Customer's IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate Applications from Oracle/SQL*Server databases to Aurora-PostgreSQL/MySQL or other Open Source platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL*Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora-PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You be required to travel to client locations to deliver professional services when needed.

UVA Medical Center is seeking a SQL Server Database Administrator. The SQL DBA performs advanced implementation/support for systems application and monitoring; is responsible for installing, configuring, and maintaining operating system workstations and servers, including web servers in support of business processing requirements; performs software installations and upgrades to operating systems and layered software packages; schedules installations and upgrades and maintains them in accordance with established IT policies and procedures; monitors and tunes the system to achieve optimum performance; develops and promotes standard operating procedures; conducts routine hardware and software audits of server to ensure compliance with established standards policies and configuration guidelines; develops and maintains comprehensive operating system hardware and software configuration database/library of all supporting documentation; provides integrated team support and maintenance of Technical Services hardware and software; provides design and implementation support for server hardware Microsoft Windows operating systems virtualization Active Directory Group Policy TCP/IP/DHCP/DNS IIS SQL Exchange, Clustering, Load Balancing, SAN/NAS and advanced support.
The preferred candidate will have:
1. Experience installing/upgrading SQL versions, applying SQL patches, backup/recovery, and migration of data.

2. Experience with the SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, T-SQL, and SQL Server Powershell.

3. Ability to set up and maintain statistics, indexes, and agent jobs.

4. Advanced understanding of SQL Security including hardening and addressing SQL Server health assessment reports.

5. Provide Technical support for MSSQL databases including responding to help desk tickets and working with customers to resolve issues.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field required. Relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a degree
3 years of relevant experience with Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Windows Server (versions 2012/2016/2017/2019 for both).
Must be available to be on-site in Charlottesville, Virginia . Relocation reimbursement may be provided for the right candidate.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
This is primarily a sedentary job involving extensive use of desktop computers. The job does occasionally require walking some distance to attend meetings, and programs.
This position will not sponsor applicants for work visas.
Position Compensation Range: $32.48 - $51.98 Hourly

Job Title: SQL Server Database Administrator - Information Management
Description:
Join South Carolina state government where you can have a meaningful career, incomparable benefits, and a positive work-life balance!

Responsibilities for the SQL Server Database Administrator

You will assist with administration of LLR's Microsoft SQL Server databases to include the administration of LLR's consolidated licensing system.
You will serve to coordinate all modification of database program code including the backup and integrity of the code in multiple instances and environments of the consolidated licensing system.
You will administer all database modifications with regard to efficiency, data security, user security, and system integrity.
You will support development of systems and database systems with the creation of stored procedures, functions, and job as required.
You will create and maintain both import and export specifications for various internal and external sources.
You will maintain the physical descriptions of database components.
You will develop standards, data definitions, documentation and design of security systems.
You will ensure maximum online availability of LLR databases by the use of clustered database environments.
You will maintain contact with internal and external customers for database support and problem resolution.
You will serve as a support and backup for LLR's server farm to include VMWare and Storage Area Networks.
You will monitor and report, as needed, problems and issues with servers to appropriate individuals.
You will be responsible for backups for LLR's consolidated database systems.

A bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or a related field and experience in systems development and maintenance, technical support, or the support of complex database management systems. Related experience may be substituted for the bachelor's degree on a year-for-year basis.

Description

Do you like to work in the team responsible for providing SME support for 16,000 PostgreSQL and Oracle databases?
Would you like to be part of the team to influence IT Stakeholders and Customers on the latest database technologies?
DBA is required to work within the global database and data analytical organization to provide high-level database expertise for day-to-day support of production and development environments.

You’ll be working in the Domain Expert team in the Infrastructure and Platform function in Nashville. We provide database design, administration and build a database road map for 16000 databases for the client.
We maintain very large databases (350TB largest) and implemented many proven Oracle and PostgreSQL technologies like Data Guard, Real Application Cluster, Goldengate, Patroni, Oracle Enterprise Manager, OID, etc. to support high availability and BCM resiliency.

This benefits our customers to host Trading, Clearing, Regulatory and Financial systems for all business streams. As a DBA, you’ll play an important role in maintaining SLAs, achieving MTTR, certifying database products, implementing automation to improve processes and tools.

Req. #251432164
What You’ll Do
Develop and implement automated solutions by leveraging DevOps construct
Own SME for Database Product and functionalities in PostgreSQL and Oracle
Analyze and Resolve Database performance issues
Support the Service & Product Manager across several technical domains
Eensure workflows, processes, tooling and applications are of the highest quality standard
Contribute expertise to the management of existing and new IT database products and services
Define workarounds for known errors and initiate process improvements
Perform SME activities for complex High Availability and Disaster Recovery, performance tuning and troubleshooting, Database administration
Requirements
3 to 5 years of hands-on experience with PostgreSQL or Oracle database administration
Proficient with software development tools, such as python, iPSoft, Splunk, Data science analytical tools
Ability to solve complex issues, good at problem statement analysis and solution design thinking
Track record of influencing senior IT stakeholders and business partners
Confident communicator that can explain technology to non-technical audiences
Capable of understanding client needs and translating this into products and services

UVA Medical Center is seeking a SQL Server Database Administrator. The SQL DBA performs advanced implementation/support for systems application and monitoring; is responsible for installing, configuring, and maintaining operating system workstations and servers, including web servers in support of business processing requirements; performs software installations and upgrades to operating systems and layered software packages; schedules installations and upgrades and maintains them in accordance with established IT policies and procedures; monitors and tunes the system to achieve optimum performance; develops and promotes standard operating procedures; conducts routine hardware and software audits of server to ensure compliance with established standards policies and configuration guidelines; develops and maintains comprehensive operating system hardware and software configuration database/library of all supporting documentation; provides integrated team support and maintenance of Technical Services hardware and software; provides design and implementation support for server hardware Microsoft Windows operating systems virtualization Active Directory Group Policy TCP/IP/DHCP/DNS IIS SQL Exchange, Clustering, Load Balancing, SAN/NAS and advanced support.
The preferred candidate will have:
1. Experience installing/upgrading SQL versions, applying SQL patches, backup/recovery, and migration of data.

2. Experience with the SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, T-SQL, and SQL Server Powershell.

3. Ability to set up and maintain statistics, indexes, and agent jobs.

4. Advanced understanding of SQL Security including hardening and addressing SQL Server health assessment reports.

5. Provide Technical support for MSSQL databases including responding to help desk tickets and working with customers to resolve issues.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field required. Relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a degree
3 years of relevant experience with Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Windows Server (versions 2012/2016/2017/2019 for both).
Must be available to be on-site in Charlottesville, Virginia . Relocation reimbursement may be provided for the right candidate.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
This is primarily a sedentary job involving extensive use of desktop computers. The job does occasionally require walking some distance to attend meetings, and programs.
This position will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

Performs necessary steps to assure agency data and database infrastructure are kept in a consistent and recoverable state.

Updates documentation to include diagrams and application associations.
Troubleshoots errors and optimize database performance as necessary.
Evaluates emerging technology and recommend solutions.Works in a collaborative team oriented environment with modern tools and technology.
Who are the customers?
The (Taxation and Revenue Department (TRD) Database Administrator II position supports data and applications for multiple environments within TRD which affect tax and motor vehicle operations.

Ability to lead client specific strategic engagements involving customer/partner teams

Are you an experienced Oracle/SQL*Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open Source Database platforms such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the Customer's IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate Applications from Oracle/SQL*Server databases to Aurora-PostgreSQL/MySQL or other Open Source platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL*Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora-PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You be required to travel to client locations to deliver professional services when needed.

Experience in AWS Platforms and Service
Experience with Custom/COTS Applications and their implementation/maintenance is highly desired
Experience with TCP/IP Networking a plus
Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms (e.g. Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Netezza, Teradata, Vertica, etc.) desired
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired

Abile Group has an exciting and challenging opportunity for a Database Administrator supporting an Intelligence Community Customer. We have an IMMEDIATE NEED for a Database Administrator to provide SQL and PostgreSQL support to Agile DevOps software development and to IT mission critical systems. The DBA will perform database administrator tasks including monitoring user access and security, monitoring performance and managing parameters to provide fast responses to front-end users, mapping out the conceptual design for a planned database, refining the logical design, installing and testing new versions, and refining the physical design to meet system storage requirements and conduct capacity planning.
The right candidate will possess the below skills and qualifications and be ready to handle all responsibilities independently and professionally.
Responsibilities:
Act as the SME and provide best practice recommendations for SQL and PostgreSQL
Provide SQL infrastructure engineering to include database architecture maintenance, database upgrades, server configurations, and application configurations.
Install, configure, and manage multiple SQL server environments with high availability and disaster recovery, to include monitoring, analysis, reporting, and data warehouse services and solutions
Architect and design the configuration and operation of SQL platforms on all environments.
Ensure proper integration of SQL with applications to include but not limited to SharePoint, Active Directory, etc.
Ensure that storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly
Work closely with IT Project Managers and Software Developers
Communicate with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security
Commissioning and installing new applications and customizing existing applications
Support on-call activities as needed
Qualifications:

Clearance Required: Top Secret
Degree and Years of Experience:
BS degree and 12 – 15 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 10 – 13 years of prior relevant experience
5+ years of experience administering, patching, performance tuning and securing PostrgeSQL database
Preferred 3+ year administering Microsoft SQL Server
4+ years of AWS RDS management experience
Desired Certifications:
Oracle Database Administrator Certifications a plus
Relevant AWS certification preferred
Required Skills:
Experience with scripting using Ansible, Python or similar dynamic languages
Must have excellent communications and documentation skills
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to effectively troubleshoot, resolve, or escalate problems
Experience in Federal Grants Management is a plus

Abile Group, Inc. was formed in July 2004 to partner with the Intelligence Community and their Contractors in the areas of Enterprise Analytics & Performance Management, IT & Systems Engineering and Program & Project Management. We are looking for high performing employees who enjoy providing advice and guidance along with solutions development and implementation support, crafted by combining industry best practices with the clients’ subject matter experience and Abile’s breadth of expertise.

At FNBO, our employees are the heart of our story—and we’re committed to their success! Please see below the details of this career opportunity and how it fits into our organization’s success.
We are looking for a CMDB Administrator who is experienced with the day-to-day configuration and management of the ServiceNow CMDB focused on ensuring operational integrity of the ServiceNow CMDB, Discovery processes, integrations, audit and data clean-up activities.
Key Responsibilities:
Create and maintain CMDB architecture and technical design documentation.
Design, implement, manage, and ensure the effectiveness of the integration of the CMDB with external sources of data. (i.e., SCCM, Flexera (FNMS), Discovery, etc.)
Develop, document, and implement CI data governance processes and procedures for effectively managing CI data.
Develop and monitor CI data health reports / dashboards and resolve any issues.
Ensure the quality of the CMDB data is maintained and that target metrics are established and met, resolving issues in a timely manner.
Work with stakeholders and CI data owners to ensure the quality of the CMDB data is maintained, and all CIs are up-to-date.
Proactively identify CI classes, attributes, and relationship types that are required.
Proactively identify and resolve CI data, metric, process, or functionality gaps in the CMDB.
Ensure the CIs are created or updated using only approved processes and procedures.
Develop, document, and implement CI data audits and address any issues that arise.
Create and manage enhancement stories from request to deployment.
Validate CMDB functionality as part of ServiceNow platform upgrades and deployments.
Provide guidance and training in support of the maintenance and growth of the CMDB.
Participate in ServiceNow upgrade testing and validation.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business Administration or seven years of equivalent experience.
3 years experience with the ServiceNow CMDB and how it supports other ITSM processes such as Incident, Problem, Change, and Asset Management.
Experience managing CI data in a ServiceNow CMDB.
Experience connecting data and building relationships in ServiceNow CMDB. (i.e., Business Applications, Services, Assets, CI, Software Models)
Experience defining, documenting, and implementing CMDB governance processes and procedures.
3 years experience with ServiceNow CMDB configuration.
Effective communications and collaboration skills; ability to work with management and technical staffs of all levels and skill sets.
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong organizational, analytic, and complex problem-solving skills.
ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA)
ITIL Foundation certified
Knowledge of the ServiceNow Common Service Data Model (CSDM) is a plus
Highly effective speaking, listening, writing, and interpersonal skills.

FNBO strives to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve in the makeup of our workforce.

Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer-facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms

Come work with us at Spencer's & Spirit Halloween, where you'll be working with the best and brightest colleagues as you help us deliver the most fun experience and product possible to our guests. We're fast-paced and take our work seriously, but we always have a good laugh at the end of the day. Walk through our stores or the halls of our corporate office and you'll see firsthand that we're laidback and irreverent. We're firm believers in being true to YOU, so tattoos and piercings are as common as watercooler convos. Whether it's critiquing our new exclusive costumes or quality testing newly implemented software technology, our teams understand the importance of working collaboratively to challenge status quo and achieve our goals. We keep pushing ourselves to go above and beyond and are looking for top talent to become a part of our team!

30% discount on merchandise
competitive salary
career advancement
Bonus opportunity
an excellent benefits package including Vacation/Sick/Holiday pay, Medical/Dental/Disability/Life and AD&D insurance & 401k.

Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members.

Excellent written and verbal communication

Introduction
As an IBM Application Architect, you directly help clients transform their business and solve complex problems. You will define the scope and vision for projects that deliver customized solutions using your knowledge of IBM platforms. You are a technical leader, serving as a liaison among business partners, technical resources, and project stakeholders.

Your Role and Responsibilities
This position is expected to support the Basis leads in managing Oracle databases on SAP and non-SAP databases in non-production and production. This person is responsible for parameter changes, reorganizations, performance, patch application, upgrades and/or availability. In addition, this person must also be able to setup and troubleshoot issues and is required to monitor production on a scheduled basis. This position is expected to support the Basis leads in administrating LAN (Local Area Networks) and WAN (Wide Area Networks). This individual must have experience working NMCI as well as ERP application infrastructure networks. This individual also leads the Basis systems engineering component on this program at Navy ERP.SAP HANA Certified Professional, preferred but not essential Federal experience desired (DoD experience preferred)

Job Duties:
Responsible for ensuring availability and performance of HANA / SAP systems used by the client
Proactively monitor the database systems to ensure secure services with minimum downtime.
Responsible for problem escalation to the operations team and third parties as appropriate
Work with the team to ensure that the associated hardware resources are optimally allocated to the databases and to ensure high availability and optimum performance
Responsible for providing trend analysis to the production support, system administration and development teams to enable them to make informed decisions regarding resource management
Defining systems strategy, developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines
If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $81,000 to $162,000 based on a full time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately

#SAPNAVY

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Minimum 2 years of experience as an SAP HANA DBA
Minimum 6 years of experience as a Basis Administrator
Responsible for supporting Suite on HANA business applications
Configuration and Management of HANA System Replication (HSR)
SAP Basis administration experience on Linux (preferably RedHat) environments
HANA Database performance tuning experience
SLT, BOBJ and/or AWS Experience is a big plus
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

None
About Business UnitIBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.
This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.
Your Life @ IBMAre you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Utilize high-performance hardware and industry standard software to administer MySQL and PostgreSQL databases. Analyze queries to fine-tune performance for a variety of workloads and support developers writing database-driven applications.

Duties and Responsibilities

Under minimal guidance from the System Administration manager, maintain database systems in accordance with company requirements
Ensure performance and availability of database systems
Utilize advanced monitoring to identify and remediate bottlenecks or problems
Analyze and optimize database queries for efficiency
Verify the integrity and availability of database backups
Produce and maintain documentation relevant to the configuration, operation and support of database servers
Act as the X-ES point of contact with external database support vendor(s) as necessary
Provide support for developers

Desired Qualifications

Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Database Administration, System Administration or a related field.
Experience with RDBM systems, preferably MySQL and/or PostgreSQL
System Administration experience with Linux distributions and Bash or Python scripting
Ability to work independently, identify and implement improvements, and engage with customers across the organization
Experience with virtualization, container, or database replication technologies is a plus

Summary:
The Database Administration Manager is responsible for managing the Database Administration function and its employees as well as organizing and participating in configuration, troubleshooting, and maintenance of the company’s Production and Development environment databases. The holder of this role will be primarily responsible for prioritization, ownership, tracking, and resolution of all database-related incidents and requests to meet SLA requirements and development goals. The primary responsibilities are to ensure a stable and performant SQL service in support of our Software as a Service platform. Secondarily, serve as a subject matter expert in support of the development team, especially concerning (but not limited to) database structures, database performance, data security, and query optimization. As the manager, be responsible for mentoring the team and ensuring that work is coordinated efficiently across multiple team members.
Essential Functions/ Responsibilities:

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Database Design
Continuous improvement of the database schema in conjunction with development
Recommendations and best practices for table structures, indexing, database partitioning to ensure scalability of the platform
SQL Server Maintenance:
Backing up, restoring, and defining recovery models
Responsible for database clustering
Proactively monitor SQL platform to ensure stability and uptime against SLA
Understand SQL Server use of underlying operating system platform and communicate requirements and standards to the system and network administrators
Evaluate, test, and deploy new releases, patches, and upgrades of the Microsoft SQL Server Platform
Reporting
Define and implement performance monitoring in a continuous improvement cycle
Define and implement capacity monitoring in a continuous improvement cycle
Produce regularly scheduled and ad hoc reports as needed
Performance Tuning
Performance tuning and optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Index creation and management
SQL Automation
Work with Process Engineering and IT Operations team to tune automated SQL server deployment within pre-production environments
Implement operational automation using scripts and scheduling
Work with Process Engineering to automate frequently performed tasks in non-production environments for ad hoc development use
SQL Security
Table, field, and database encryption per industry best practices
Server permissions model and monitoring of exceptions
Documentation creation and maintenance
Annotated schema layouts
Server configuration
Procedures
Design decisions and rationale
Other related documents as required
Production Support
On-Call rotation in support of Database Platform
Ad hoc management of data
Respond to alerts
Cross-train to support multiple database platforms
Team Leadership
Manage ticket-workflow across all users
Build consensus on design decisions for presentation to Engineering and Operations management
Manage the on-call rotation effectively
Develop and maintain processes and standards of both design and administration
Work closely with the IT Operations team and the Application Management team to ensure that cross-team responsibilities and relationships are clear and stable
Competencies / Skills:
Clear and Concise with technical documentation
Technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail
Ability to prioritize tickets, tasks, and project work based on team objectives
Expert knowledge of database systems with a focus on Microsoft SQL Server and T-SQL
Working experience with MySQL, MariaDB, Postgres
High proficiency with common tools and techniques needed to develop, troubleshoot, and maintain database systems
Familiarity with current development and support tools including GIT, JIRA, Confluence, Ansible, etc.
Supervisory Responsibility:
This position directly supervises the database administration team and serves as a coach, coordinator, and mentor for other positions in the Technical Operations department. The position rotates on-call coverage with other Technical Operation managers.

Job Details
Description
Job Summary

The Database Administrator role is to manage, install, monitor, maintain, and performance tune production databases while ensuring high levels of data availability; and monitor interoperability of Excela Health's business processes. The DATABASE Administrator will interact with technical administration as problem solver and develop job skills and knowledge to research and introduce new techniques and technologies within the company. This individual is also responsible for developing, implementing, and overseeing database policies and procedures to ensure the integrity and availability of databases and their accompanying software. The DATABASE Administrator is responsible for process analysis, design and simulation. The DATABASE Administrator must also act as Project Manager by meeting with business partners, department heads, physicians, vendors and consultants to evaluate and determine the best possible solutions in accordance with system's specifications. Likewise, this individual will be responsible for coordinating all project efforts needed to successfully implement the applications and upgrades. The DATABASE Administrator will also act as a leader by staying abreast of latest trends and development in the field, demonstrating professionalism at all times and mentoring less experienced team members in the learning and adoption of new database skills.

Essential Job Functions

Strategic Delivery of Information Services
Ensures that all informational services performed and delivered fully supports the vision, mission and strategic objectives of both the organizational and departmental strategic plan.
Customer Service
Consistently demonstrates exemplary customer service skills and communications at all levels.
Build customer confidence in information services delivered by responding to customer needs in a timely, delightful and empathetic manner.
Data Quality and Integrity
Ensures that all data delivered, regardless of the delivery method, e.g. electronic, digital, hardcopy etc. is 100% accurate, concise and reliable.
Develop and employs data monitoring and testing methods to ensure data integrity.
Reinforces data quality standards by guiding and monitoring customers in the use of best practices that will support and maintain data integrity.
Accountability
Assumes responsibility for all facets of individual job performance and the subsequent impact of the delivery of information services.
Initiates corrective action and communications to rectify performance or delivery issues.
Software Application Administration
Manages assigned software applications by supporting and guiding customers in the maintenance of software functions, tools, tables or dictionaries.
Responds to and logically troubleshoots / debugs software problems.
Identifies and resolves or escalates and communicates operational failures to the necessary parties, e.g. technical services, vendors, IT Management, stakeholders etc.
Gathers, analyzes, recommends and submits software application enhancements to vendors with stakeholder approval.
Assumes responsibility and acts as project manager for all software application upgrades, patches / or STI activities.
Proactively monitors the performance of software applications or related services, e.g. ad hoc files, databases, etc., and resolves or escalates any problem situation.
Business Analysis
Interprets, analyzes and documents customer business practices and workflows as they relate to the implementation and delivery of new information products or services.
Seek business process improvements by working with customer to identify best practices and / or software application enhancements.
Exercise creativity and resourcefulness to gather information; network with fellow vendor clients; conduct product searches; pursue software application enhancements in the pursuit of business process solutions.
Recommend, document and communicate business practice resolutions.
Acquire stakeholder sign-off; develop project charters and complete preparations for implementation and / or transition
Accountable for the achievement of results.
An agent for transformation.
Works with management and Human Resources staff to enhance processes and define new responsibilities for employees working in the re-engineered processes.
Instrumental in process re-engineering and involved in change management.
Achieves the results specified in the requirements documents.
Project Management
Understands and utilizes project management principles to facilitate implementation and delivery of new information products or services.
Conducts project management activities in accordance with the departmental project management model.
Employs the use of project management tools, when applicable, to facilitate the implementation and delivery of new information products or services.
Participates in the management of information as outlined in the JCAHO Standards.
Contributes to Information Management planning.
Contributes to the maintenance of confidentiality and security.
Contributes to the effective management of processes.
Provides decision support information.
Contributes to making knowledge-based information readily available.
Contributes to maintaining the integrity of the patient medical record.
Other duties as assigned.

Specialty Functions

Monitors database system details within the database, including stored procedures and execution time, and implement efficiency improvements. Provide database schema design and implement data warehouse-based reporting metric applications.
Performs MS SQL Server database administration, tuning and monitoring, DTS package, SQL, data modeling and normalization
Monitors and maintains Databases as assigned.
Coordinating SQL Server upgrades and assists with SQL Server administration
Provides on-call assistance for the Customer Service Center and responds accordingly to reports of trouble as presented (which may include evenings and weekends)
Works with Technical Services group to resolve problems, outages, or slowdowns
Performs runtime optimization, capacity management and planning, security administration, configuration, scheduling, and execution of maintenance utilities
Provides basic TCP/IP network and services management in support of tools deployment and configurations
Monitors performance against established standards in regard to reliability and response time.
Manage systems for high availability
Responsible for coordinating backups with system administrator
Knowledge of SQL Server versions in current use
Replication, Log Shipping, Analysis Services, SSIS and Reporting Services.
Database knowledge and skills
Knowledge of or skills in database management system vendors, products, and product feature sets
Knowledge of or skills in database tables, indexes, and other related, internal components of the database management system
Knowledge of or skills in developing and maintaining a model of the overall database structure including tables, indexes, fields, triggers, views, and stored procedures
Knowledge of or skills in developing and maintaining one or more data stores for the purpose of running queries or reports, without affecting production (application) databases, to provide information in support of business decision making
Knowledge of or skills in developing, running, and/or confirming proper outcome of DTS packages and other automated and manual jobs run at recurring intervals as part of ongoing operations
Knowledge of or skills in ensuring the ability to recover data in the event of system error, hardware failure, or disaster
General knowledge of or skills in communicating status to impacted stakeholders - including end users, IT support staff, and IT management before, during, and after the installation or problem resolution activities as appropriate and in accordance with SLAs
General knowledge of or skills in developing database standards by applying industry knowledge to business needs by maintaining knowledge of information technology and research institute standards, which may include application, business intelligence, or database standards
General knowledge of or skills in maintaining information on the name, type, range of values, source, and authorization for access for each data element in the organization's files and databases. Information maintained includes which application programs use that data so that when a change in a data structure is contemplated, a list of affected programs can be generated
General knowledge of or skills in planning, developing and documenting technical requirements, including the end users view of the system, underlying data structures and system interfaces, supplying sufficient specifications to develop or purchase needed software and acquire a hardware platform
Analyzes interface failures
Quickly identify and determine if they are hardware, software, procedural or a combination of factors
Achieves a timely resolution of the problem once a solution is identified.
Manages database security
Administers security efforts under the direction of departmental senior leadership.
Monitors user accounts, file permissions, and network security policies.
Assists with audits as needed.
