Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer-facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience with C-Level/Director level customers in IT/Business to craft their Enterprise Architecture and IT Strategies

Knowledge of replication technologies such as Oracle GoldenGate, Amazon Database Migration Service, or similar
Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Experience in writing procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, T-SQL, PL/pgSQL, stored procedures
Experience in AWS Platforms and Service
Experience with Custom/COTS Applications and their implementation/maintenance is highly desired
Experience with TCP/IP Networking
Experience with MS Office (Excel)
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired

Come work with us at Spencer's & Spirit Halloween, where you'll be working with the best and brightest colleagues as you help us deliver the most fun experience and product possible to our guests. We're fast-paced and take our work seriously, but we always have a good laugh at the end of the day. Walk through our stores or the halls of our corporate office and you'll see firsthand that we're laidback and irreverent. We're firm believers in being true to YOU, so tattoos and piercings are as common as watercooler convos. Whether it's critiquing our new exclusive costumes or quality testing newly implemented software technology, our teams understand the importance of working collaboratively to challenge status quo and achieve our goals. We keep pushing ourselves to go above and beyond and are looking for top talent to become a part of our team!
We offer the following benefits:

30% discount on merchandise
competitive salary
career advancement
Bonus opportunity
an excellent benefits package including Vacation/Sick/Holiday pay, Medical/Dental/Disability/Life and AD&D insurance & 401k.
Responsibilities:
Manage SQL Server databases from Development, QA, Staging and Production systems.
Act as a contributor to SQL Roadmap and near and far term planning sessions
Configure and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring of system health and performance, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security.
Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end.
Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes
Assist developers with performance troubleshooting, query tuning, and schema refinement.
Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems. On a rotation basis.
Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours.
Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members.
Requirements:
5+ years MS SQL Server Administration experience required
Experience with Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO)
Experience with backups, restores and applicable recovery models.
Knowledge of High Availability (HA), AAG & Windows Clustering with SQL Server, and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for SQL Server
Experience with SSRS and SSIS (or other ETL process and procedure).
Experience working with Windows server, including Active Directory
Excellent written and verbal communication
Flexible, team player, 'get-it-done' personality
Ability to organize and plan work independently in a rapidly changing environment
Ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teamsProof of vaccination for COVID-19 required for employment, reasonable accommodations considered for medical, pregnancy or sincerely held religious beliefs.

Job Description

This is a Hybrid position within our IT Organization. The role will allow employees to work offsite but will also require onsite work based on business needs. The selected candidate will be expected to commute to the innovation center to which they are assigned as their primary GM facility. Relocation may be provided.

For all external applicants, we are targeting a start date on or after January 10th, 2022 for this position.

Location: Austin, Atlanta, Phoenix or Warren, MI


The Database Administrator is responsible for adhering to, leading, implementing & supporting Database Management concepts & practices, Logical Data Models, Database Standards, Tool Standards, Implementation of Database technologies, Support of Database Technologies, etc. A Database Administrator is responsible to have senior level, cross enterprise industry expertise and all of the capabilities required. Additionally, advanced working knowledge of industry standard database architectural patterns, technologies and processes. As a GM Database Administrator, you will possess the capability of working with general direction from a manager or architect in identifying, selecting, implementing and supporting enterprise-wide database standards. A Database Administrator can often act in a leadership capacity or delegated leadership capacity and will mentor and/or peer review junior database administrators.

Lead, implement, educate peers and partners on Database Standards, Practices & Policies to effect successful implementation & encouraged behaviors from Database management systems

Understand, Communicate, Develop, Validate & Implement requirements from IT Partners supporting either implementation or support of Database management systems

Prepare & assist, or lead with analysis to support decision making processes of senior staff or IT partners

Perform or develop assigned tasks using established procedures, policies and process

Perform & maintain all documentation supporting effective change control, business continuity & sustainment of Database systems. Validating peer compliance and peer quality as well.

Develop, communicate and lead implementation of solutions to Database Management problems of substantial scope and high complexity

Collaborate with peers & IT Partners in execution of assigned duties

Mentor entry & intermediate level Database talent

Lead Implementation and support of long term technology strategy

Accountable for accuracy and validity of solution design and documentation

Participation in On-Call rotations or Shift work as required by specific role or assignment

Holds themselves and others accountable for demonstrating GMs values and cultural behaviors. Models GM behaviors and creates a winning culture.

Performs other related duties as assigned.

Knowledge:

Advanced knowledge of Enterprise RDBMS Technologies, architecture, implementation & support

Advanced Operational capability of Enterprise RDBMS deployments

Knowledge of at least two IT technology domains including infrastructure platforms, data management and database technologies, storage technologies, security frameworks and tools.

Advanced Knowledge with data replication and/or disaster recovery capabilities preferred

Advanced knowledge of Backup & Recovery techniques and technologies

Experienced communications and leadership background

Additional Job Description

Minimum Qualifications:

8 - 10 years of database experience

Ability to learn new databases/processes quickly

2 - 3 years experience working on HANA

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in monitoring, tuning, and troubleshooting of SAP HANA systems.

HANA system administration using SAP HANA Cockpit and HANA Studio.

Experience in managing users and roles in SAP HANA system.

Implementing SAP HANA Table management techniques - data compression, table partition, compression techniques, and load/unload table into memory.

HANA Installation, Data Provisioning, Admin, Modelling.

Experience with high availability and backup mechanism.

Implementing SAP HANA Security mechanism, HANA XS Application service, and monitoring of HANA system.

Integration of SAP HANA into different remote systems. Exposure to different remote access options in HANA system.

SAP BusinessObjects and HANA integration, Design document, RFPs, and estimation plans.

Education Requirements:

Bachelor's degree required

Computer Science, MIS / CIS, or another STEM-related major preferred

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Benefits Overview

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statements

The policy of General Motors is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or veteran status. Additionally, General Motors is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us atCareers.Accommodations@GM.com. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

The Database Administrator is responsible for the development and management of the database infrastructure. This position will support various data initiatives within the company and be a critical technical resource for day-to-day operations. The Database Administrator will be the lead for SQL / MySQL database operations in support of the data acquisition system platform.
DUTIES:
Design, deploy, and monitor database infrastructure in cloud infrastructure (Azure).
Recommend and design storage solutions for mission critical data in common databases (MySQL/SQL) and cloud services.
Implement overall system design, coding, testing and maintenance for the data warehouse business intelligence platforms.
Coordinate with Deep Well Services customers on infrastructure support allowing for controlled access to customer data.
Manage documentation/configure of database systems.
Support of cloud-based databases for company data acquisition system.
Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality.
Deploy sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning and statistical methods.
Use data to discover tasks that can be automated.
Deliver updates to stakeholders based on analytics.
SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent years of job-related experience
Experience: At least 3 years of experience designing, planning and implementing cloud-based system solutions, to include:
SQL Database
MySQL
Possesses a strong mathematical and statistical background, including the ability to create predictive models and correlations
Understanding of science fundamentals: algorithms, data structures, operating systems, database systems, object-oriented systems & design
Experience utilizing PowerShell commands in an enterprise environment
Understanding of software frameworks such as J2EE and .NET would also be an advantage
Experience supporting cloud-based CRM, ERP, data visualization and financial services
Experience with processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management
Analyze performance issues to determine best solutions to increase performance [website] hardware purchases, server configuration changes or index/query changes)

Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.
KPMG is currently seeking a SQL Server Database Administrator for a six-month assignment to join our Digital Nexus technology organization.
Responsibilities:
Provide technical support of database environments/applications, including installation, database creation, upgrades, patches, problem diagnosis, performance monitoring, database maintenance, process automation, evaluation and tuning recommendations; Develop, implement and support backup/restore, disaster recovery and data replication procedures and exercises
Contribute in all aspects of the lifecycle for database environments; and in the implementation of application requested database code and configuration changes in supported database environments
Participate in the creation of new policies, procedures, projects and processes
Evaluate, document and recommend database-related software products within the technical architecture framework
Interact with various technology teams regarding work requests submitted, participate in the creation of new policies, procedures, projects, processes and participate in all aspects of the lifecycle for database environments
Provide technical guidance for other members of the team and create periodic status reports for management
Qualifications:
Minimum three years of recent experience administering and managing large databases in complex enterprise environments
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university; Or equivalent work experience
Experience in SQL Server 2014, 2016, 2017 and 2019 including system installation and upgrade\patching, backup and recovery, data migration, database maintenance and support, release management, troubleshooting, performance tuning, developer and third party product support, configuration and support of SSIS jobs, SQL Server Agent jobs; Familiarity with Ola Hallengren’s Maintenance Routines
Strong experience with the SQL Server Clusters including Failover Clustered Instances, Availability Groups, Distributed Availability Groups, Log Shipping and Replication
Experience installing and supporting SQL Server particularly with features such as SSIS, SSRS and SSAS; installing and managing 3rd party vendor applications and dependent components, including packages that utilize IIS and Microsoft Reporting Services
Proficient in using Transact-SQL and troubleshooting queries and stored procedures; Ability to determine performance degradation \ root cause; Experience creating documentation of procedures for installations, monitoring, migrations, security policies, configuration changes and best practices for development teams; Ability to provide off-hours support, may include evenings or weekends when required and in case of emergencies
US Citizenship is required

Job Description
As a Supply Chain DBA you will be performing an individual contributor role developing supply chain strategies that support the organizations strategic vision. Applies mathematics, statistics, advanced analytics and optimization modeling to find patterns and relationships in data to help optimize inventory, material, and create supply strategies. Applies modeling and other methods to gather and interpret data and to recommend new procedures and processes; conducts competitive analysis and benchmarking to identify areas of opportunity to further optimize Intel's supply chain from wafer starts through customer fulfillment.
This role requires in-depth knowledge of supply chain management and a Degree in a specialized or intellectual field of study such as engineering, computer science or a related field.
Qualifications
You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.
Minimum Qualifications:
The candidate must have a BS Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related field.
6+ years of experience in the following areas:
Windows Server Administration
RDBMS, SSIS and SSAS
Microsoft Office VBA
Preferred Qualifications:
2+ years of experience in the following areas:
Memory Supply Chain Data and Processes
Visual Basic.Net
Web Hosting
EDW
Inside this Business Group
The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.
Other Locations

Virtual US and Canada

We’re looking for talented professionals, anywhere in the United States, to join us in bringing smart money management and payment solutions to everyone’s fingertips.
At Green Dot, we are evolving to a new and permanent “Work from Anywhere” model designed to maximize the benefits of remote work, promote and enable a strong culture of performance and connectedness, and attract the best and brightest talent who align with our entrepreneurial spirit and mission.
“I want the best and brightest people we can find to join our team to help us be successful, and you can live anywhere you want. What COVID did was force a mind shift; we see how productive we are working from anywhere and how much our employees love it. It’s more important to be productive than be busy. If you force people to come to an office every day, then everybody’s going to try to be busy,” Dan Henry, President & CEO. (quoted in CNBC)

JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Summary
We are looking for a highly capable Database Strategy and Operations Leader to enhance the performance of our organizations databases. You will be creating and implementing standardized database management procedures, and overseeing the installation, security and upgrading of our databases.
To ensure success as the Database Strategy and Operations Leader, you should possess extensive knowledge of database architecture, industry leading practices with extensive experience in a similar role. An outstanding Database Strategy and Operations Leader will be someone whose database management expertise translates into optimal database performance.
Responsibilities
Enhances the scalability and performance of the existing database architecture.
Develops database structures and features according to organizational needs.
Protects data by developing data security and restoration policies, procedures and controls.
Conducts diagnostic tests and evaluating performance metrics.
Develops procedures to ensure data integrity and quality.
Prepares and presents system performance reports to Senior Leadership.
Performs database maintenance, migration and upgrading hardware and software.
Documents processes and complying with industry best practices in database management.
Keeps up to date with developments and trends in database management and architecture.
Presents recommendations for new database technologies.
Plans computerized databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long-range requirements, operational guidelines and protection.
Ensures Database Administration team accuracy and completeness of data in master files and various support tools, such as base dictionaries.
Establishes and maintains security and integrity controls.
Formulates and monitors policies, procedures and standards relating to database management.
Selects, supervises, develops, trains and evaluates database administration teams
Perform other duties as needed.
Required Skills
Bachelor’s degree in MIS, computer science, information systems or information technology or equivalent of professional certification and experience
10+ years of experience in database administration/management
5+ years of experience in leading a team
Advanced proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL)
In-depth knowledge of database technologies, architecture, and data security.
Knowledge of industry best practices in database management.
Advanced analytical, leadership and problem-solving skills.
Ability to achieve mid-to long-term goals and strategic results
Ability to interact and present to senior management, internal and external stakeholders
Ability to influence policies, practices and produces in and out of job area
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
POSITION TYPE
Regular

Job Details
Description
Job Summary

The Database Administrator role is to manage, install, monitor, maintain, and performance tune production databases while ensuring high levels of data availability; and monitor interoperability of Excela Health's business processes. The DATABASE Administrator will interact with technical administration as problem solver and develop job skills and knowledge to research and introduce new techniques and technologies within the company. This individual is also responsible for developing, implementing, and overseeing database policies and procedures to ensure the integrity and availability of databases and their accompanying software. The DATABASE Administrator is responsible for process analysis, design and simulation. The DATABASE Administrator must also act as Project Manager by meeting with business partners, department heads, physicians, vendors and consultants to evaluate and determine the best possible solutions in accordance with system's specifications. Likewise, this individual will be responsible for coordinating all project efforts needed to successfully implement the applications and upgrades. The DATABASE Administrator will also act as a leader by staying abreast of latest trends and development in the field, demonstrating professionalism at all times and mentoring less experienced team members in the learning and adoption of new database skills.

Essential Job Functions

Strategic Delivery of Information Services
Ensures that all informational services performed and delivered fully supports the vision, mission and strategic objectives of both the organizational and departmental strategic plan.
Customer Service
Consistently demonstrates exemplary customer service skills and communications at all levels.
Build customer confidence in information services delivered by responding to customer needs in a timely, delightful and empathetic manner.
Data Quality and Integrity
Ensures that all data delivered, regardless of the delivery method, e.g. electronic, digital, hardcopy etc. is 100% accurate, concise and reliable.
Develop and employs data monitoring and testing methods to ensure data integrity.
Reinforces data quality standards by guiding and monitoring customers in the use of best practices that will support and maintain data integrity.
Accountability
Assumes responsibility for all facets of individual job performance and the subsequent impact of the delivery of information services.
Initiates corrective action and communications to rectify performance or delivery issues.
Software Application Administration
Manages assigned software applications by supporting and guiding customers in the maintenance of software functions, tools, tables or dictionaries.
Responds to and logically troubleshoots / debugs software problems.
Identifies and resolves or escalates and communicates operational failures to the necessary parties, e.g. technical services, vendors, IT Management, stakeholders etc.
Gathers, analyzes, recommends and submits software application enhancements to vendors with stakeholder approval.
Assumes responsibility and acts as project manager for all software application upgrades, patches / or STI activities.
Proactively monitors the performance of software applications or related services, e.g. ad hoc files, databases, etc., and resolves or escalates any problem situation.
Business Analysis
Interprets, analyzes and documents customer business practices and workflows as they relate to the implementation and delivery of new information products or services.
Seek business process improvements by working with customer to identify best practices and / or software application enhancements.
Exercise creativity and resourcefulness to gather information; network with fellow vendor clients; conduct product searches; pursue software application enhancements in the pursuit of business process solutions.
Recommend, document and communicate business practice resolutions.
Acquire stakeholder sign-off; develop project charters and complete preparations for implementation and / or transition
Accountable for the achievement of results.
An agent for transformation.
Works with management and Human Resources staff to enhance processes and define new responsibilities for employees working in the re-engineered processes.
Instrumental in process re-engineering and involved in change management.
Achieves the results specified in the requirements documents.
Project Management
Understands and utilizes project management principles to facilitate implementation and delivery of new information products or services.
Conducts project management activities in accordance with the departmental project management model.
Employs the use of project management tools, when applicable, to facilitate the implementation and delivery of new information products or services.
Participates in the management of information as outlined in the JCAHO Standards.
Contributes to Information Management planning.
Contributes to the maintenance of confidentiality and security.
Contributes to the effective management of processes.
Provides decision support information.
Contributes to making knowledge-based information readily available.
Contributes to maintaining the integrity of the patient medical record.
Other duties as assigned.

Specialty Functions

Monitors database system details within the database, including stored procedures and execution time, and implement efficiency improvements. Provide database schema design and implement data warehouse-based reporting metric applications.
Performs MS SQL Server database administration, tuning and monitoring, DTS package, SQL, data modeling and normalization
Monitors and maintains Databases as assigned.
Coordinating SQL Server upgrades and assists with SQL Server administration
Provides on-call assistance for the Customer Service Center and responds accordingly to reports of trouble as presented (which may include evenings and weekends)
Works with Technical Services group to resolve problems, outages, or slowdowns
Performs runtime optimization, capacity management and planning, security administration, configuration, scheduling, and execution of maintenance utilities
Provides basic TCP/IP network and services management in support of tools deployment and configurations
Monitors performance against established standards in regard to reliability and response time.
Manage systems for high availability
Responsible for coordinating backups with system administrator
Knowledge of SQL Server versions in current use
Replication, Log Shipping, Analysis Services, SSIS and Reporting Services.
Database knowledge and skills
Knowledge of or skills in database management system vendors, products, and product feature sets
Knowledge of or skills in database tables, indexes, and other related, internal components of the database management system
Knowledge of or skills in developing and maintaining a model of the overall database structure including tables, indexes, fields, triggers, views, and stored procedures
Knowledge of or skills in developing and maintaining one or more data stores for the purpose of running queries or reports, without affecting production (application) databases, to provide information in support of business decision making
Knowledge of or skills in developing, running, and/or confirming proper outcome of DTS packages and other automated and manual jobs run at recurring intervals as part of ongoing operations
Knowledge of or skills in ensuring the ability to recover data in the event of system error, hardware failure, or disaster
General knowledge of or skills in communicating status to impacted stakeholders - including end users, IT support staff, and IT management before, during, and after the installation or problem resolution activities as appropriate and in accordance with SLAs
General knowledge of or skills in developing database standards by applying industry knowledge to business needs by maintaining knowledge of information technology and research institute standards, which may include application, business intelligence, or database standards
General knowledge of or skills in maintaining information on the name, type, range of values, source, and authorization for access for each data element in the organization's files and databases. Information maintained includes which application programs use that data so that when a change in a data structure is contemplated, a list of affected programs can be generated
General knowledge of or skills in planning, developing and documenting technical requirements, including the end users view of the system, underlying data structures and system interfaces, supplying sufficient specifications to develop or purchase needed software and acquire a hardware platform
Analyzes interface failures
Quickly identify and determine if they are hardware, software, procedural or a combination of factors
Achieves a timely resolution of the problem once a solution is identified.
Manages database security
Administers security efforts under the direction of departmental senior leadership.
Monitors user accounts, file permissions, and network security policies.
Assists with audits as needed.

Required Qualifications

Completion of Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.
Three (3) years of technical experience with SQL databases.
Strong leadership ability, good organizational skills, independent and critical thinking skills, sound judgment.
Strong ability to communicate complex and/or controversial topics and concepts to a wide and diverse audience.
Project Management experience.

Preferred Qualifications

MCSE, MCDBA certification preferred.
CAPM Certification preferred.

License, Certification & Clearances

Act 34-PA Criminal Record Check from the PA State Police system

Supervisory Responsibilities

This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities, but does serve as a coach and mentor for other positions in the department.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

Incumbent will be scheduled based on operational need (rotate shifts, standby, on-call, etc.).
Travel may be expected locally between Excela Health locations.

LEAN

Actively promotes a Lean work culture by performing team member duties to encourage consistent use of LEAN principles and processes, including continually seeking work process improvements. Recognizes the necessity of taking ownership of one’s own motivation, morale, performance and professional development. Strives for behavior consistent with being committed to Excela’s missions, vision and values.

8+ years of DBA experience in Oracle, SQL Server, or other commercial/open source platforms
Experience with mission critical environments from one platform to another
Experience working with high availability, disaster recovery and server tuning strategies including parameters, resources, contention, etc.
Experience in Shell/Perl/ Scripting
Bachelor's degree in Computer science or equivalent experience

Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer-facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience with C-Level/Director level customers in IT/Business to craft their Enterprise Architecture and IT Strategies
Relevant Application/Database replatforming experience (Commercial to Open Source Engines)
Knowledge of replication technologies such as Oracle GoldenGate, Amazon Database Migration Service, or similar
Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Experience in writing procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, T-SQL, PL/pgSQL, stored procedures
Experience in AWS Platforms and Service
Experience with Custom/COTS Applications and their implementation/maintenance is highly desired
Experience with TCP/IP Networking
Experience with MS Office (Excel)
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired

Description: The Database Administrator is a full time, exempt position reporting to the Director of Enterprise Research & Data Applications. This position oversees day-to-day operations for the Jenzabar administrative computing system, PowerFAIDS financial aid system, and other SQL Server applications used by various campus departments. Working closely with the Director of Enterprise Research & Data Applications and other IT professionals, the Database Administrator performs directed tasks to maintain SQL Server-based applications through script and report development. Supports the Department of Information Technology by serving as a backup for answering basic software and hardware questions. Work will take place in a climate-controlled office building. Having a flexible schedule is necessary.*Essential Functions: *Perform scheduled transfers of data between servers, automating systems as possibleAssist with all software (Jenzabar, PowerFAIDS, etc.) installations, upgrades, and work ordersAccurately assess and assign support calls for Software staff, resolve routine/documented issuesResearch and install routine SQL Server service packs as approved by the DBAWork with Network and Server staff to maintain and continuously improve server resourcesDevelop, document, and oversee maintenance plans  * Reboot or restart services as necessaryDevelop and deliver documentation and training for all relevant systemsDevelop, troubleshoot, and maintain Enterprise Reports using InfoMaker and SQL Server Reporting ServicesDevelop, and maintain stored procedures, triggers and batch filesWork with Enterprise Data staff to develop & maintain internal web-based database applicationsMaintain database backup/recovery environment: Assure that data recovery time objectives are established and met; verify implementation of correct backup strategy; develop recovery procedures; support recovery from loss of data caused by user or system error; respond quickly to refresh data.Other duties as assigned. Requirements: Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, related degree, or a combination of equivalent education and experience required.Experience: Two years of experience with MS SQL Server and SQL applicationsSkills: Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. Ability to work independently while meeting well-defined deadlines. Familiarity with Jenzabar or a similar administrative computing system. Experience writing SQL queries and/or reports and in the design of data extract, data migration.Preferred Requirements: Two years of experience with JenzabarOne year of experience with Infomaker/SSRS report writingTwo years of experience in an academic environmentPrevious experience developing user documentationTypical physical demands:Requires manual dexterity sufficient to effectively operate standard office and computer equipment as detailed above. Sitting, bending, standing and reaching. May require lifting or moving objects of no more than 50 pounds.Review of applications will begin immediately and will continue until the position is filled or the search is closed.Westminster College encourages and gives full consideration to all applicants for admission, financial aid, and employment. About Us::

We are a highly innovative surveying and engineering company with over 60 years of industry experience serving clients throughout the US and Caribbean.
At Pickett, we use the acronym S.O.L.V.E. to define our core values that include: Safety first, Outstanding service, Lasting relationships, Valued teamwork and Engaged culture.
“We solve the problems that matter” and we are always looking to add passionate, motivated, and qualified individuals to our rapidly expanding team.
About The Role::

As a GIS Administrator, you will be responsible for installation, configuration, operation, and the maintenance of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) software applications - including the ESRI platform and other automated tools.
You will ensure that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures adhere to Pickett’s organizational values.
What You Will Be Doing::
Meet with end-users to gather system requirements, analyze business guidelines, and make recommendations for technical solutions
Construct technical solutions to replace outdated systems or manual processes
Design, and develop complex GIS and/or application databases
Enhance database stored procedures, triggers, and views to meet client needs
Develop ETL processes to migrate data between disconnected systems
Provide data analysis, system administration, and technical support for new and existing clients
Utilize appropriate software development practices in planning and implementing work products, this includes working with web development and various severs
Support the creation of needs assessment reviews and provide recommendations for process improvement
Help grow and mentor our current and future GIS Technicians and Analysts through training and hands on support
Prepare technical documentation of project requirements, procedures, execution, and implementation plans
Design, interpret, and implement data model functionality
Help lead internal and client-facing technical training sessions
Prepare concise and correct written correspondence
Work independently or as part of a team to perform technical activities consistent with project plans within project scope and budget
Track progress on project tasks relative to scope, deliverables, schedule, and budget
Perform additional assignments as requested
What You Bring::
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, Geography, GIS, Planning or related field (required)
Minimum of 10 years in a GIS Professional role supporting enterprise applications, providing operational and process improvement support, and working with RDBMSs or ESRI ArcGIS/ArcServer software, current Windows OS, and web-enabling technologies (required)
Experience working with .NET, IIS, SQL/T-SQL, Python, CSS/HTML, JavaScript, Microsoft SSRS/SSAS/SSIS, Crystal Reports, web-services or APIs (preferred)
Proficient using ArcGIS Desktop/ArcGIS Pro, data visualization, and map production tool for all-source information (required)
Ability to work in a safe manner and obey safety regulations at all times
Capable of being a self-starter and thrive in an unstructured, varied and deadline driven work environment
Strong ability to collaborate with team members as well as peers in the electrical utility industry
Effective communication skills (verbal, written and presentation)
Able to recognize when technical problems are developing and initiate appropriate corrective actions
So...Why Join Us?:

You will have the opportunity to learn, grow and directly contribute to our business. You will also have a very visible and tangible impact by solving real world problems.
You will contribute significantly to the growth and development of our company while also continuing to be challenged and inspired along the way!
We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive health insurance & benefits, retirement planning support, PTO and more.

Overview:

Guidehouse is a leading management consulting firm serving the public and commercial markets. We guide our clients forward towards new futures that build trust in society and your professional skills along the journey. Join us at Guidehouse.
Responsibilities:

As a Senior Database Administrator Consultant, you will be performing the following:
Maintains the integrity, security and availability of multiple database(s).
Duties include disaster recovery, performance analysis and tuning, index maintenance, and monitoring of data.
Administers, maintains, develops and implements policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database.
Evaluates and recommends available database management system (DBMS) products.
Performs database and software life-cycle activities to ensure highest level of system performance and availability and compliance with business requirements.
Performs Oracle, SQL Server and SYBASE Database and Application server administration.
Organizes and formats data for efficient query and storage processes.
Qualifications:

The following qualifications must be met to be considered for this role:
Due to our contractual requirements, to be eligible for this role, you must be fully COVID-19 vaccinated at time of hire.
An ACTIVE and CURRENT TOP SECRET/SCI security clearance with a Counterintelligence (CI) polygraph
Bachelor's degree
FIVE (5) years of experience as a DBA on programs and contracts of similar scope, type and complexity
The following skill/knowledge/experience are preferred for this role:
Maintain the integrity, security, and availability of database(s)
Establish and maintain database user accounts
Administer, maintain, and Implement policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database(s)
Organize and format data for efficient query and storage processes
Evaluate requirements and recommends available DBMS products
Provide server administration with a variety of database products that include Oracle, SQL Server, and SYBASE
Provide Amazon Web Services (AWS) server administration with a variety of activities that include foundational AWS services (EC2 Compute, EBS, S3, Config)
Perform disaster recovery, performance analysis and tuning, index maintenance, and monitoring of data
Develop policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database(s)
Perform database and software life-cycle activities to ensure highest level of system performance and availability
Support data modeling activities by way of prototype database implementations
Additional Requirements:

The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.

Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer-facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired

Experience in AWS Platforms and Service

Experience with MS Office (Excel)
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired

Description
Job Description:
Job Description
The NISC IV program at Leidos is looking for a Database Management!
The candidate will provide support with developing a Database Management System (DBMS) solution for the electronic management of all Environmental, Occupational Safety and Health (EOSH) compliance data and information for the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). Areas of Support include proper management of the Database Management System; training and database support to users; and making the Database Management System available for presentation to a wide range of potential FAA customers.
We are seeking a talented and energetic candidate to work with the best and brightest employees around the country in creating innovative all-encompassing solutions for our programs. You will work in a fast-paced and diverse environment, enjoy flexible work arrangements, and will have a management team that encourages your career development and growth.
Primary Responsibilities
Specific tasks will include:
Develop a Database Management System user-friendly interface with the ability to handle multiple types of data (e.g. documents, spreadsheets, pictures).
Facilitate the collection, storage, analysis, reporting, and metric tracking of all EOSH compliance data and information.
Ensure the EOSH Database Management System can interface, import, and incorporate information from other FAA database/systems.
Facilitate in the testing of the Database Management System; data security; and administration of the Database Management System with the wide range of stakeholders.
Assist with troubleshooting and debugging Database Management System software issues during the creation and maintenance of the new database.
Provide updates and modifications to the Database Management System based on user/customer feedback.
Develop a written Database Management System User Guide and update as changes occur.
Provide training to FAA employees who will function as Database Administrators.
Provide Knowledge Sharing Network (KSN) support.
Make the Database Management System available for presentation to a wide range of FAA senior management, EOSH workforce, and support contractors.
Position requires approximately 10% travel.
Please Note: This is a 100% Full Time Remote Work at Home position.
** Prefers candidate to be in Denver/Longmont, CO**
** Candidate has to live in Denver/Longmont, CO OR within the Western Service Area locations (i.e. California, Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, Oregon, Utah, Washington, and Wyoming) **
Required Skills:
Server Database development, design and implementation; smart device applications; cloud drives and storage (e.g. Amazon Web Service, Google Drive, DropBox, OneDrive, etc.); and data analysis.
Relational database experience within a multi-tiered environment.
Microsoft SharePoint (Knowledge Sharing Network), Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Access experience.
Bachelor’s degree related to Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent; and have a minimum of 4+ years hands-on experience in a database developer role.
Ability to obtain and/or maintain Public Trust security clearance.
Preferred Skills:
Very experienced and proficient with programming languages such as Structured Query Language (SQL) and/or Phython.
Must possess and demonstrate highly effective written and verbal communications with excellent presentation skills.
Must be skilled at understanding inter-dependencies and relationships from complex technical data sets and be a creative problem-solver with strong analytical skills.
Must be a self-starter, demonstrate initiative, and possess excellent organizational and time management skills.
Permanent telework status is acceptable, and ensure easily accessible communications with Government Technical Interpreter (GTI) and EOSH team members is provided.
Microsoft Certified.
Leidos is a Fortune 500™ company aimed at embracing and solving some of the world’s most pressing challenges.
Through science and technology, Leidos makes the world safer, healthier and more efficient.
Leidos is growing! Connect with us on LinkedIn and Facebook.

The work is dynamic, challenging, non-routine and requires ability to work independently, be a self-starter, as well as multitask and communicate effectively. The ideal candidate will have previous experience supporting complex environments with medium to large scale Oracle databases. Many job listings provide a wide range of confusing and often vague terms, confusing an applicant like yourself. Here at Forcepoint we take a different approach by spelling out the key things you’ll be responsible for on a daily basis .
The Products:
For this position, you’ll be supporting the following Forcepoint products while at the customer site - Forcepoint - Insider Threat
The Forcepoint Insider Threat product is an industry leading user activity monitoring toolset. For more information, visit this link. https://www.forcepoint.com/product/insider-threat
The Location :
Local travel throughout the National Capital Region.
Responsibilities:
· Install, maintain and troubleshoot Oracle databases, spanning 11g, 12c. Hands on with 19c a plus. Perform database upgrades and migrations.
· Demonstrated operations experience with Linux based platform to include installation, administration, and troubleshooting in support of Oracle databases.
· Monitor and troubleshoot Oracle Database Performance and provide support for database related issues.
· Periodically perform backup/recovery to validate the backup/recover procedures.
· Experience with Oracle in a cloud environment is a plus.
· Experience with container database and pluggable database desired.
Things You Must Have to Apply:
· An active (currently in use) – TS/SCI Full Scope Poly
· Must meet DoD 8570 certification requirements.
· A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Cyber Security or equivalent education and/or work experience.
· 10+ years demonstrated experience in Oracle RDBMS, Grid, ASM, RMAN, and optionally DataGuard administration”. Duties include design, installation, upgrades, patching, system maintenance, backup/restore operations, resolving communication issues, scripting, etc.
· 10+ years’ experience performing the following tasks:
o Linux operating system installation, upgrades and troubleshooting.
o Updating device firmware or vendor supplied appliance software.
o Remediating security vulnerabilities or applying security controls to any hardware or software platform. Experience with STIGS and FIPS.
· Skilled in SQL, PL/SQL, Linux shell scripting.
· Experience interacting with Oracle Support.
· Works independently within a team, provides general direction to customers and fellow team members.
· Accountable for quality, completeness, and on-time delivery of own work products.
· Researches new technology and develops business cases to support product-wide database solutions.
Things That Would Be Nice to Have:
· Working in Cloud Environments like AWS, GovCloud, Google Cloud, or Azure
· Experience with N-Tier architecture
· Experience with Java application servers
· Oracle Certifications, such as OCA, OCP, OCM
We are mission driven.
We are passionate about our mission because our solutions protect businesses, critical infrastructures, and governments around the world.
Find out more about Forcepoint’s Mission, Vision, and Values at www.Forcepoint.com and follow us on Twitter at @ForcepointSec.
Find us on social at #forcepoint #forcepointculture #lifeatforcepoint to find out what its really like to work here from the team themselves.

Description:
Description
Job Description:
Job Description
The NISC IV program at Leidos is looking for a Database Management!
The candidate will provide support with developing a Database Management System (DBMS) solution for the electronic management of all Environmental, Occupational Safety and Health (EOSH) compliance data and information for the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). Areas of Support include proper management of the Database Management System; training and database support to users; and making the Database Management System available for presentation to a wide range of potential FAA customers.
We are seeking a talented and energetic candidate to work with the best and brightest employees around the country in creating innovative all-encompassing solutions for our programs. You will work in a fast-paced and diverse environment, enjoy flexible work arrangements, and will have a management team that encourages your career development and growth.
Primary Responsibilities
Specific tasks will include:
Develop a Database Management System user-friendly interface with the ability to handle multiple types of data (e.g. documents, spreadsheets, pictures).
Facilitate the collection, storage, analysis, reporting, and metric tracking of all EOSH compliance data and information.
Ensure the EOSH Database Management System can interface, import, and incorporate information from other FAA database/systems.
Facilitate in the testing of the Database Management System; data security; and administration of the Database Management System with the wide range of stakeholders.
Assist with troubleshooting and debugging Database Management System software issues during the creation and maintenance of the new database.
Provide updates and modifications to the Database Management System based on user/customer feedback.
Develop a written Database Management System User Guide and update as changes occur.
Provide training to FAA employees who will function as Database Administrators.
Provide Knowledge Sharing Network (KSN) support.
Make the Database Management System available for presentation to a wide range of FAA senior management, EOSH workforce, and support contractors.
Position requires approximately 10% travel.
Please Note: This is a 100% Full Time Remote Work at Home position.
** Prefers candidate to be in Denver/Longmont, CO**
** Candidate has to live in Denver/Longmont, CO OR within the Western Service Area locations (i.e. California, Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, Oregon, Utah, Washington, and Wyoming) **
Required Skills:
Server Database development, design and implementation; smart device applications; cloud drives and storage (e.g. Amazon Web Service, Google Drive, DropBox, OneDrive, etc.); and data analysis.
Relational database experience within a multi-tiered environment.
Microsoft SharePoint (Knowledge Sharing Network), Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Access experience.
Bachelor’s degree related to Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent; and have a minimum of 4+ years hands-on experience in a database developer role.
Ability to obtain and/or maintain Public Trust security clearance.
Preferred Skills:
Very experienced and proficient with programming languages such as Structured Query Language (SQL) and/or Phython.
Must possess and demonstrate highly effective written and verbal communications with excellent presentation skills.
Must be skilled at understanding inter-dependencies and relationships from complex technical data sets and be a creative problem-solver with strong analytical skills.
Must be a self-starter, demonstrate initiative, and possess excellent organizational and time management skills.
Permanent telework status is acceptable, and ensure easily accessible communications with Government Technical Interpreter (GTI) and EOSH team members is provided.
Microsoft Certified.
Leidos is a Fortune 500™ company aimed at embracing and solving some of the world’s most pressing challenges.
Through science and technology, Leidos makes the world safer, healthier and more efficient.
Leidos is growing! Connect with us on LinkedIn and Facebook.
Pay Range:
Pay Range $71,500.00 - $110,000.00 - $148,500.00

Overview:

Guidehouse is a leading management consulting firm serving the public and commercial markets. We guide our clients forward towards new futures that build trust in society and your professional skills along the journey. Join us at Guidehouse.
Responsibilities:

As a Senior Database Administrator Consultant, you will be performing the following:
Maintains the integrity, security and availability of multiple database(s).
Duties include disaster recovery, performance analysis and tuning, index maintenance, and monitoring of data.
Administers, maintains, develops and implements policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database.
Evaluates and recommends available database management system (DBMS) products.
Performs database and software life-cycle activities to ensure highest level of system performance and availability and compliance with business requirements.
Performs Oracle, SQL Server and SYBASE Database and Application server administration.
Organizes and formats data for efficient query and storage processes.
Qualifications:

The following qualifications must be met to be considered for this role:
Due to our contractual requirements, to be eligible for this role, you must be fully COVID-19 vaccinated at time of hire.
An ACTIVE and CURRENT TOP SECRET/SCI security clearance with a Counterintelligence (CI) polygraph
Bachelor's degree
FIVE (5) years of experience as a DBA on programs and contracts of similar scope, type and complexity
The following skill/knowledge/experience are preferred for this role:
Maintain the integrity, security, and availability of database(s)
Establish and maintain database user accounts
Administer, maintain, and Implement policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database(s)
Organize and format data for efficient query and storage processes
Evaluate requirements and recommends available DBMS products
Provide server administration with a variety of database products that include Oracle, SQL Server, and SYBASE
Provide Amazon Web Services (AWS) server administration with a variety of activities that include foundational AWS services (EC2 Compute, EBS, S3, Config)
Perform disaster recovery, performance analysis and tuning, index maintenance, and monitoring of data
Develop policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database(s)
Perform database and software life-cycle activities to ensure highest level of system performance and availability
Support data modeling activities by way of prototype database implementations
Additional Requirements:

The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.

EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.


Description

Do you like to work in the team responsible for providing SME support for 16,000 PostgreSQL and Oracle databases?
Would you like to be part of the team to influence IT Stakeholders and Customers on the latest database technologies?
DBA is required to work within the global database and data analytical organization to provide high-level database expertise for day-to-day support of production and development environments.

You’ll be working in the Domain Expert team in the Infrastructure and Platform function in Nashville. We provide database design, administration and build a database road map for 16000 databases for the client.
We maintain very large databases (350TB largest) and implemented many proven Oracle and PostgreSQL technologies like Data Guard, Real Application Cluster, Goldengate, Patroni, Oracle Enterprise Manager, OID, etc. to support high availability and BCM resiliency.

This benefits our customers to host Trading, Clearing, Regulatory and Financial systems for all business streams. As a DBA, you’ll play an important role in maintaining SLAs, achieving MTTR, certifying database products, implementing automation to improve processes and tools.

Req. #251432164
What You’ll Do
Develop and implement automated solutions by leveraging DevOps construct
Own SME for Database Product and functionalities in PostgreSQL and Oracle
Analyze and Resolve Database performance issues
Support the Service & Product Manager across several technical domains
Eensure workflows, processes, tooling and applications are of the highest quality standard
Contribute expertise to the management of existing and new IT database products and services
Define workarounds for known errors and initiate process improvements
Perform SME activities for complex High Availability and Disaster Recovery, performance tuning and troubleshooting, Database administration
Requirements
3 to 5 years of hands-on experience with PostgreSQL or Oracle database administration
Proficient with software development tools, such as python, iPSoft, Splunk, Data science analytical tools
Ability to solve complex issues, good at problem statement analysis and solution design thinking
Track record of influencing senior IT stakeholders and business partners
Confident communicator that can explain technology to non-technical audiences
Capable of understanding client needs and translating this into products and services
What We Offer
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance (Subsidized)
Health Savings Account
Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care, Commuter)
Short-Term and Long-Term Disability (Company Provided)
Life and AD&D Insurance (Company Provided)
Employee Assistance Program
Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
Matched 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
Paid Time Off
Legal Plan and Identity Theft Protection
Accident Insurance
Employee Discounts
Pet Insurance
Additional
Depending on the position, EPAM employees may need to work at a client worksite or an EPAM office. To protect employees and help communities fight the COVID-19 pandemic, vaccination is required to visit a EPAM office in the US, and many of our clients have similar policies in place. Due to this, a COVID-19 vaccination may be necessary and when applicable, specific details will be discussed during the interview process which may include providing proof of vaccination. For candidates with exceptional circumstances that prevent them from getting the COVID-19 vaccine, we will offer alternative reasonable accommodation, where possible, which should be coordinated by your recruiter and discussed directly with an HR Representative
