Database Administrator II
Grade 9

Department
Data Management Department (Honolulu, Oahu)

Work Schedule
Monday - Friday 8:00AM - 5:00PM (hours may vary)

Responsibilities
Are you interested in working alongside a group of dynamic thinkers, innovators, and leaders who thrive together as a team? Looking for a fun, collaborative, and challenging environment where you are empowered to make decisions? Would you like the opportunity to grow professionally and personally within a forward thinking company? If so, you've come to the right place. At First Hawaiian Bank, we invest in you. We offer an award winning training and development program to set you up for success. We pride ourselves on our company culture and core values: Caring, Character, and Collaboration.

Under general supervision of the manager/supervisor and with the assistance of senior staff, the Database Administrator II determines data and application requirements and coordinates the implementation of database solutions (SQL Server and/or Oracle); provides users with ongoing database support, including assistance with reporting, tuning, development (including ETL), analysis, design, testing, conversions, interfaces and other system implementation activities. Also provides administrative and operational support in accordance with established policies and procedures.

Required Qualifications
3 years SQL or Oracle database experience.
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Management Information Systems or Computer Science, or three years of equivalent work experience.

Preferred Qualifications

Three years of equivalent work experience.
Intermediate knowledge of SQL programming language.
Intermediate knowledge of procedure or scripting language.
Able to design and build databases (Oracle and/or SQL Server).
Proficient in developing database specifications and documentation.
ETL development (Informatica, etc.).
Data warehouse development and support.
Knowledge of business intelligence and analytic software tools.
Familiar with database and data warehouse tuning and administration tools.
Familiar with building schema, tables, procedures, and permissions.
Able to gather technical and business requirements and develop feasible solutions.
Good interpersonal skills and is able to work well with end-users in assisting them with system and application problem resolution.
Knowledgeable in project life cycle requirements (PLC) and able to apply them to application development projects.
Good written and verbal communication skills in order to address user concerns, document systems and procedures, prepare evaluations and proposals and provide reporting to management.

Job Title: Entry Level to Senior Level Database Administrators
Description:
Entry Level to Senior Level Database Administrators (Multiple Positions)
Job Duties:
SQL and relational database designing and administration, object-oriented programming, modeling, and working with various technologies such as Unix, shell scripting, Oracle, DB2, MS- SQL server, ERStudio, Data modeling, HP service manager, PL/SQL, other SQL Servers,and ETL Tools etc
Perform feasibility studies and may require traveling for setting up varioussystems across the nation.
Please send resume
Cover Letter and Salary requirements by regular mail to Agile Technologies Inc
400 South Avenue, Suite 8, Middlesex, NJ 08846.

Key Role:
Maintain responsibility for implementing and maintaining data platforms, build-out ETL pipelines, write custom codes, interface with data stores, perform data ingestion, and build data models. Assess, design, build, and maintain scalable data platforms that use the latest and best in Big Data tools. Perform analytical exploration and examination of data from multiple sources of data. Work in a Scrum-based Agile environment with a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, data scientists, developers, and data consumers pushing the envelope of bleeding-edge Big Data implementations. Monitor performance, scalability, and security and evaluate existing database design to determine the necessary updates and integration requirements of a new design and to ensure final solutions meet organizational needs.
Basic Qualification:
Experience with designing and developing complex SQL queries and reports to retrieve required data
Experience with analyzing and tuning queries to improve performance
Experience with Liquibase source control tools
Experience with Database Schema as Code tools
Experience with code reviews on SQL change sets and working with developers to create and enforce best practices
Knowledge of Agile methodologies or the software development life cycle (SDLC)
Ability to obtain a security clearance
HS diploma or GED
Additional Qualifications:
Experience with supporting Linux systems engineering efforts in system design and evaluation, solution engineering, software development, or system administration
Experience with a complex build system
Experience with database partitioning
Experience with open-source database technologies, including PostGreSQL
Experience with Cloud-native database solutions, including Amazon Web Services (AWS) Relational Database Service (RDS) and DynamoDB
Experience with installation, maintenance, and administration of PostgreSQL, Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server, or other RDBMS variants
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

About Us::

We are a highly innovative surveying and engineering company with over 60 years of industry experience serving clients throughout the US and Caribbean.
At Pickett, we use the acronym S.O.L.V.E. to define our core values that include: Safety first, Outstanding service, Lasting relationships, Valued teamwork and Engaged culture.
“We solve the problems that matter” and we are always looking to add passionate, motivated, and qualified individuals to our rapidly expanding team.
About The Role::

As a GIS Administrator, you will be responsible for installation, configuration, operation, and the maintenance of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) software applications - including the ESRI platform and other automated tools.
You will ensure that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures adhere to Pickett’s organizational values.
What You Will Be Doing::
Meet with end-users to gather system requirements, analyze business guidelines, and make recommendations for technical solutions
Construct technical solutions to replace outdated systems or manual processes
Design, and develop complex GIS and/or application databases
Enhance database stored procedures, triggers, and views to meet client needs
Develop ETL processes to migrate data between disconnected systems
Provide data analysis, system administration, and technical support for new and existing clients
Utilize appropriate software development practices in planning and implementing work products, this includes working with web development and various severs
Support the creation of needs assessment reviews and provide recommendations for process improvement
Help grow and mentor our current and future GIS Technicians and Analysts through training and hands on support
Prepare technical documentation of project requirements, procedures, execution, and implementation plans
Design, interpret, and implement data model functionality
Help lead internal and client-facing technical training sessions
Prepare concise and correct written correspondence
Work independently or as part of a team to perform technical activities consistent with project plans within project scope and budget
Track progress on project tasks relative to scope, deliverables, schedule, and budget
Perform additional assignments as requested
What You Bring::
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, Geography, GIS, Planning or related field (required)
Minimum of 10 years in a GIS Professional role supporting enterprise applications, providing operational and process improvement support, and working with RDBMSs or ESRI ArcGIS/ArcServer software, current Windows OS, and web-enabling technologies (required)
Experience working with .NET, IIS, SQL/T-SQL, Python, CSS/HTML, JavaScript, Microsoft SSRS/SSAS/SSIS, Crystal Reports, web-services or APIs (preferred)
Proficient using ArcGIS Desktop/ArcGIS Pro, data visualization, and map production tool for all-source information (required)
Ability to work in a safe manner and obey safety regulations at all times
Capable of being a self-starter and thrive in an unstructured, varied and deadline driven work environment
Strong ability to collaborate with team members as well as peers in the electrical utility industry
Effective communication skills (verbal, written and presentation)
Able to recognize when technical problems are developing and initiate appropriate corrective actions
So...Why Join Us?:

You will have the opportunity to learn, grow and directly contribute to our business. You will also have a very visible and tangible impact by solving real world problems.
You will contribute significantly to the growth and development of our company while also continuing to be challenged and inspired along the way!
We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive health insurance & benefits, retirement planning support, PTO and more.

Multiple locations across US, USA
Are you excited about data? Do you think cloud adoption is changing the way people and companies do business? Do you like being involved in solving complex business problems by creating advanced and innovative technical solutions?
If yes — we’ve got a solution for you!
Join ABCloudZ — a full-service company helping customers modernize legacy applications, create new solutions, and manage data, applications, and infrastructure anywhere. With close to 300 engineers and consultants in 4 countries, ABCloudZ has expertise with modernizations to Azure, AWS, and GCP, BI, Advanced Analytics, AI, Big Data, IoT, Application Development, DevOps, and Managed Services. Taking care of data for customers to make sure it’s secure, available, consistent, and managed in a cost-effective manner with mitigated risks — this is in our DNA. So if you enjoy working with data and considering what’s your next career move, we’ll be thrilled to talk to you!
ABCloudZ is looking for an experienced SQL Server DBA who has both broad and deep knowledge of the SQL Server platform to join a team of world-class experts. This is a great opportunity to get exposed to multiple customer environments and be on the edge of Data Management technology as it gets deployed to top-tier companies.
Qualifications
The experience and qualifications we hope you bring to the SQL Server DBA position:
Experience of managing a large-scale SQL Server environment
Expertise in troubleshooting SQL Server issues
Maintaining high availability solutions proficiency
Being able to communicate with non-technical people
Willingness and ability to be on on-call duty
Preferred Qualifications
Managing storage skill
Ability to manage virtual machines
SQL development skills
Sense of humor
Current Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL experience
Who we are?
ABCloudZ is a global full-service company operating at the cutting edge of the latest application development and data management technologies. At ABCloudZ, we believe optimal data environments are the greatest competitive advantage, and our Solutions Architects have experience with building enterprise-grade systems.
It is why our team has dedicated ourselves to helping hundreds of organizations – from start-ups to Fortune 100 companies – with architecting cloud solutions, developing web and mobile applications, optimizing complex data workloads, and managing workloads on an on-going basis — no matter where those datasets may reside.
Growth
Join an always-growing company to operate on the cutting-edge of information technologies, cloud services, application development, and digital infrastructure. At ABCloudZ, we created a perfect environment to raise your professional skills, understand new technologies, and work with world-class companies.
Expertise
Our expertise covers all major cloud and on-premises and databases, including Oracle, SQL Server, Azure, AWS, and GCP solutions. Our prolific developers are focused on delivering the best possible digital solutions leveraging our expertise with BI, Advanced Analytics, AI, Big Data, IoT, DevOps, and Managed Services.
Mission
Our mission is to help businesses accurately, efficiently, and reliably build, move, and manage data workloads. The trusted ABCloudZ team now has hundreds of employees in five countries, including our headquarters in Redmond, Washington, and offices in San Francisco, Israel, Poland, and Ukraine.
Your dream job not found?
We always keep the doors open for outstanding talents. Want to work with us, but couldn't find an appropriate opening? Let us know about your passion, tell us why you stand out from the crowd and how you can make the difference working at ABCloudZ.

Work Type: Full Time - Location is flexible within the Arvest 4 State Footprint (AR, KS, MO, OK).
Position is Monday through Friday from 8 am to 5 pm with the ability to work additional hours as needed.

Preferred Qualifications: Experience with different data sources and platforms such as SQL Server, Hadoop, Azure, and flat files. Familiarity with Data Vault methodology and/or Kimble.

SUMMARY: A data management professional who participates in the implementation analysis and administration of data and databases, and in the acquisition and integration and management of data
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Interfaces with business and IT colleagues to clarify requirements and support the delivery of databases and data solutions.
Under guidance and by applying approved tool set, determines the best ways to organize and store data.
Configures, installs, and tests and maintains databases and their associated software such as version upgrades, patches, and tools.
Monitors and manages database performance.
Researches and troubleshoots database errors, indexing, or other problems.
Under the guidance of DBA 2 and/or DBA 3, performance tunes databases and related servers.
Performs database backups on a regularly scheduled basis, and database recovery when required.
Implements data security measures under guidance and by applying approved procedures.
Writes documentation that describes installation and operating procedures and design of their work product.
Assists in the research of emerging database technologies.
Monitors, tracks and reports on unauthorized systems access.
Provides first level troubleshooting, technical, and operational support under guidance.
Participates in on-call rotations as needed.
Understand and comply with bank policy, laws, regulations, and the bank's BSA/AML Program, as applicable to your job duties. This includes but is not limited to; complete compliance training and adhere to internal procedures and controls; report any known violations of compliance policy, laws, or regulations and report any suspicious customer and/or account activity.
TEAM ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Support and uphold the Arvest Mission Statement.
Uphold the Arvest Code of Ethics and ensure that confidential information is safeguarded.
Maintain a high level of cooperation and rapport with all associates in order to ensure accurate and efficient operations and service.
Formulate and communicate new ideas and suggestions that will improve profitability and efficiency for the company’s overall operation.
Promote professionalism at all times.
QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, related field or equivalent relevant experience required.
2 years of relevant experience required.
OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Must be able to arrive at work on time, work on site and have regular work attendance
Must be able to work cooperatively with other co-workers regardless of personality, presence or communication style
Must be able to provide cordial customer service regardless of customer personality, presence or communication style
Must be able to perform several tasks at once
Must be able to work in a stressful atmosphere
Must be able to rotate job tasks
Must be able to occasionally work overtime
Must be able to greet others cordially
Must be able to coordinate multiple and changing priorities
Must be able to verbally communicate with all other associates
Must be able to operate telephone, scanner, copier and FAX machines
Must be able to move from department, division, or bank to department, division or bank to attend meetings
Must be able to operate personal computer keyboard in order to create reports, schedules and other appropriate documentation
Works effectively on a continuing basis with IT colleagues and clients to understand and explain technical issues.
Produces documentation of new, existing, or proposed systems in a clear, concise manner, adhering to standards.
Shares knowledge effectively within the work team.
Forms productive networks with IT colleagues, clients and the vendor community.
Provides all necessary documentation to meet corporate standards.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to stand, walk, sit, and to talk and hear. The associate must occasionally reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, or crouch.
The associate may occasionally be required to lift or move up to 25 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close, distance and color vision and the ability to adjust focus.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Overview:

Guidehouse is a leading management consulting firm serving the public and commercial markets. We guide our clients forward towards new futures that build trust in society and your professional skills along the journey. Join us at Guidehouse.
Responsibilities:

As a Senior Database Administrator Consultant, you will be performing the following:
Maintains the integrity, security and availability of multiple database(s).
Duties include disaster recovery, performance analysis and tuning, index maintenance, and monitoring of data.
Administers, maintains, develops and implements policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database.
Evaluates and recommends available database management system (DBMS) products.
Performs database and software life-cycle activities to ensure highest level of system performance and availability and compliance with business requirements.
Performs Oracle, SQL Server and SYBASE Database and Application server administration.
Organizes and formats data for efficient query and storage processes.
Qualifications:

The following qualifications must be met to be considered for this role:
Due to our contractual requirements, to be eligible for this role, you must be fully COVID-19 vaccinated at time of hire.
An ACTIVE and CURRENT TOP SECRET/SCI security clearance with a Counterintelligence (CI) polygraph
Bachelor's degree
FIVE (5) years of experience as a DBA on programs and contracts of similar scope, type and complexity
The following skill/knowledge/experience are preferred for this role:
Maintain the integrity, security, and availability of database(s)
Establish and maintain database user accounts
Administer, maintain, and Implement policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database(s)
Organize and format data for efficient query and storage processes
Evaluate requirements and recommends available DBMS products
Provide server administration with a variety of database products that include Oracle, SQL Server, and SYBASE
Provide Amazon Web Services (AWS) server administration with a variety of activities that include foundational AWS services (EC2 Compute, EBS, S3, Config)
Perform disaster recovery, performance analysis and tuning, index maintenance, and monitoring of data
Develop policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database(s)
Perform database and software life-cycle activities to ensure highest level of system performance and availability
Support data modeling activities by way of prototype database implementations

The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.

Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.
KPMG is currently seeking a SQL Server Database Administrator for a six-month assignment to join our Digital Nexus technology organization.
Responsibilities:
Provide technical support of database environments/applications, including installation, database creation, upgrades, patches, problem diagnosis, performance monitoring, database maintenance, process automation, evaluation and tuning recommendations; Develop, implement and support backup/restore, disaster recovery and data replication procedures and exercises
Contribute in all aspects of the lifecycle for database environments; and in the implementation of application requested database code and configuration changes in supported database environments
Participate in the creation of new policies, procedures, projects and processes
Evaluate, document and recommend database-related software products within the technical architecture framework
Interact with various technology teams regarding work requests submitted, participate in the creation of new policies, procedures, projects, processes and participate in all aspects of the lifecycle for database environments
Provide technical guidance for other members of the team and create periodic status reports for management
Qualifications:
Minimum three years of recent experience administering and managing large databases in complex enterprise environments
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university; Or equivalent work experience
Experience in SQL Server 2014, 2016, 2017 and 2019 including system installation and upgrade\patching, backup and recovery, data migration, database maintenance and support, release management, troubleshooting, performance tuning, developer and third party product support, configuration and support of SSIS jobs, SQL Server Agent jobs; Familiarity with Ola Hallengren’s Maintenance Routines
Strong experience with the SQL Server Clusters including Failover Clustered Instances, Availability Groups, Distributed Availability Groups, Log Shipping and Replication
Experience installing and supporting SQL Server particularly with features such as SSIS, SSRS and SSAS; installing and managing 3rd party vendor applications and dependent components, including packages that utilize IIS and Microsoft Reporting Services
Proficient in using Transact-SQL and troubleshooting queries and stored procedures; Ability to determine performance degradation \ root cause; Experience creating documentation of procedures for installations, monitoring, migrations, security policies, configuration changes and best practices for development teams; Ability to provide off-hours support, may include evenings or weekends when required and in case of emergencies
US Citizenship is required

Work you'll do/Responsibilities


The SQL team does end to end care of a large-scale enterprise MS SQL Servers

The Team


Our Government & Public Sector Systems Engineering team delivers large-scale software applications and integrated systems, and assists clients with architecture design, assessment and optimization, and definition. Your Impact:
At Jacobs, we don’t settle – always looking beyond to raise the bar and deliver with excellence. We apply our knowledge and innovation as we look to the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference.
As the GIS System Administrator, you’ll provide planning and Tier 3 technical support for delivery of the ESRI platform in North America while contributing as a key member of the Global Enterprise Geospatial Team in the Project Technology Services group at Jacobs.
We’re cutting-edge in our delivery of technology services, and Geospatial technology plays a vital role in how we deliver these services to our clients. Want to know more? Check out this article to gain a better perspective of how we use Geospatial in the move towards the digital revolution.
http://trajectorymagazine.com/jacobs-embracing-the-digital-revolution/
As the GIS Administrator, you’ll:
Support published map services web applications
Support documentation related to best practices and SOP
Install and maintain ESRI software
Utilize ServiceNow ticketing system for user support
Author Knowledge Base articles to enable end user self-service
Measure and refine support delivery for Global Enterprise GIS systems
Create, publish, and manage optimized map services.
Thrive in a dynamic team environment with scientists, planners, engineers, and technologists.
Display attributes of a world-class consultant (team player, eagerness to learn and grow, self-starter that takes initiative, versatile, and has a client service mentality).
Utilize your technical expertise to mentor other professionals, helping your team discover what drives them, nurturing their purpose and guiding them forward.
#corpitjobs #LI-Remote
Here’s What You’ll Need:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Geographic Information Systems, Geography, or directly-related discipline
Advanced experience as a GIS Administrator including ArcGIS Enterprise and Server administration, ArcGIS Online and ArcGIS Enterprise named user/role management and support
Experience with cloud technologies and hosting methodologies (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Significant experience with designing digital workflow ranging from mobile data collection to database management to data visualization.
Significant experience with the ESRI suite of software, including:
Online: ArcGIS Enterprise (Portal), ArcGIS Server, ArcGIS Online, Web AppBuilder
Desktop: ArcGIS Pro, ArcMap, ArcCatalog, ArcScene
Enterprise Geodatabase including traditional and branch versioning
Mobile Apps: ArcGIS Field Maps, Survey123, Workforce, Operations Dashboards o ArcGIS REST API for Python
Significant experience with RDMS such as MS SQL Server. Ability to design and customize database schemas, and write custom SQL for data querying

Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer-facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Are you excited about data? Do you think cloud adoption is changing the way people and companies do business? Do you like being involved in solving complex business problems by creating advanced and innovative technical solutions?
If yes — we’ve got a solution for you!
Join ABCloudZ — a full-service company helping customers modernize legacy applications, create new solutions, and manage data, applications, and infrastructure anywhere. With close to 300 engineers and consultants in 4 countries, ABCloudZ has expertise with modernizations to Azure, AWS, and GCP, BI, Advanced Analytics, AI, Big Data, IoT, Application Development, DevOps, and Managed Services. Taking care of data for customers to make sure it’s secure, available, consistent, and managed in a cost-effective manner with mitigated risks — this is in our DNA. So if you enjoy working with data and considering what’s your next career move, we’ll be thrilled to talk to you!
ABCloudZ is looking for an experienced SQL Server DBA who has both broad and deep knowledge of the SQL Server platform to join a team of world-class experts. This is a great opportunity to get exposed to multiple customer environments and be on the edge of Data Management technology as it gets deployed to top-tier companies.
Qualifications
The experience and qualifications we hope you bring to the SQL Server DBA position:
Experience of managing a large-scale SQL Server environment
Expertise in troubleshooting SQL Server issues
Maintaining high availability solutions proficiency
Being able to communicate with non-technical people
Willingness and ability to be on on-call duty
Preferred Qualifications
Managing storage skill
Ability to manage virtual machines
SQL development skills
Sense of humor
Current Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL experience
Who we are?
ABCloudZ is a global full-service company operating at the cutting edge of the latest application development and data management technologies. At ABCloudZ, we believe optimal data environments are the greatest competitive advantage, and our Solutions Architects have experience with building enterprise-grade systems.
It is why our team has dedicated ourselves to helping hundreds of organizations – from start-ups to Fortune 100 companies – with architecting cloud solutions, developing web and mobile applications, optimizing complex data workloads, and managing workloads on an on-going basis — no matter where those datasets may reside.
Growth
Join an always-growing company to operate on the cutting-edge of information technologies, cloud services, application development, and digital infrastructure. At ABCloudZ, we created a perfect environment to raise your professional skills, understand new technologies, and work with world-class companies.
Expertise
Our expertise covers all major cloud and on-premises and databases, including Oracle, SQL Server, Azure, AWS, and GCP solutions. Our prolific developers are focused on delivering the best possible digital solutions leveraging our expertise with BI, Advanced Analytics, AI, Big Data, IoT, DevOps, and Managed Services.
Mission
Our mission is to help businesses accurately, efficiently, and reliably build, move, and manage data workloads. The trusted ABCloudZ team now has hundreds of employees in five countries, including our headquarters in Redmond, Washington, and offices in San Francisco, Israel, Poland, and Ukraine.
Your dream job not found?
We always keep the doors open for outstanding talents. Want to work with us, but couldn't find an appropriate opening? Let us know about your passion, tell us why you stand out from the crowd and how you can make the difference working at ABCloudZ.

Job Title: DB2 for z/OS DBA - Database Administrator
Description:
Do you want to join a team that is agile, collaborative, and highly skilled? Here at OneMain you will be part of a DBA team with cross-training opportunities to learn even more about other database platforms. You will perform troubleshooting, possibly of multiple databases, and work with a team that works collaboratively to recommend database techniques that support business needs. You will provide technical support and participate in the OnCall rotation where each DBA contributes weekly.
Qualifications:
Design/implement backup and recovery solutions.
Document and implement best practices for database environments.
IBM Mainframe DB2 performance tuning.
Write and tune SQL.
Knowledge of SDLC and database design methodologies/principles.
Experience:
8+ years of hands-on experience with DB2 for z/OS (Version 10 or higher).
8+ years of experience with related utilities/tools, physical database design, DB2 integrity and security management.
5+ years of database administration for highly available applications.
College degree or equivalent military or relevant work experience.
This role can be remote within the Central and Eastern time zones.
Who We Are:
OneMain Financial is the country’s largest lending-exclusive financial company, a trusted name in lending for over 100 years. Since 2005 alone, we have looked beyond customers credit scores to lend more than $152 billion to 16.2 million people looking for simple, affordable loans.
With branches across 44 states, we're proud partners of the families and communities we serve. They turn to us to help meet important financial needs, including debt consolidation, medical expenses, household bills and auto purchases. It’s all about doing the right thing – a mission that hasn’t changed for more than 100 years.

Notice to applicants

It is Northeastern State University’s policy that all newly hired employees must provide an original social security card during the hiring process. Failure to provide an original social security card will delay the hiring process and ability to begin employment.
JOB SUMMARY
This position is responsible for the administration of university databases.
MAJOR DUTIES
Thorough knowledge of SQL and Linux
Develop, administer, and maintain policies and procedures to ensure the security and integrity of database systems
Guide functional users in the development of database requirements and criteria
Design and develop interfaces and database views for reporting and application processing
Extend the functionality of applications by combining system configuration and custom program development; implement data models, database designs, data access, and table maintenance codes
Follow-up with clients to facilitate quality control and ensure customer satisfaction
Assists in the testing and improvement of new technology initiatives
Modify database programs to increase processing performance
Maintain and audit institutional data standards
Communicate with technical, application, and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security
Establish the data administration function, including designing data models, data definitions, and policies governing administrative data systems
Identify common data and associated relationships, resolves data definition and ownership issues, and ensures data integrity
Coordinate processes to develop data standards policy to improve data accuracy, integration, access and integrity
The position also supports and must greatly contribute to a collaborative customer service team environment, proactively sharing information across the team, establishing documentation, workshops with team members and enhancing an interactive team setting with consistent knowledge sharing
Perform related duties as assigned

KNOWLEDGE REQUIRED BY THE POSITION
Knowledge of system administration and architecture concepts
Knowledge of relational data models and database programming
Knowledge of database security principles
Skill in decision making and problem solving
Skill in interpersonal relations and in dealing with the public
Skill in oral and written communication

COMPLEXITY/SCOPE OF WORK
The work consists of varied duties in the administration of university databases. The need to coordinate activities across university departments and sections contributes to the complexity of the position.
The purpose of this position is to administer university databases. Success in this position contributes to the efficiency and effectiveness of a wide variety of university functions.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/ WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work is typically performed in an office, sitting at a desk or table.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge and level of competency commonly associated with the completion of a baccalaureate degree in a course of study related to the occupational field.
Possession of or ability to readily obtain a valid driver’s license issued by the State of Oklahoma for the type of vehicle or equipment operated.
At least one year of enterprise database or system administration experience.
Strong understanding of SQL and relational databases.
Ability to maintain regular attendance.

Preferred Qualifications

In-depth understanding of relational databases, Oracle and SQL Server, application development tools, and experience in the programming field.
Strong knowledge and skill in Linux and Apache Tomcat systems
Working knowledge of and experience with the design, installation, and technical support of Oracle and/or Microsoft SQL databases in an enterprise-level environment.
Two years of experience supporting ERP systems in a large Higher Education environment.
Experience with Ellucian Banner, Operational Data Storage (ODS), and Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW).
Ability to monitor database performance metrics such as table space usage, query performance, locking contention, and other performance indicators. Capable to re-organize and tune databases as situations warrant.
Professional certifications such as ITIL v3 Foundations or Oracle.

Annual salary $47,580.00 with excellent benefits, including generous leave time

Purpose of Position
THIS POSTING WILL BE USED TO CONDUCT ONGOING RECRUITMENT AND WILL REMAIN OPEN UNTIL POSITION HAS BEEN FILLED
Why does the job exist?
The IT Database Administrator position designs, develops, monitors, and optimizes the Workers Compensation Administration's (WCA) database technologies. The WCA's database administrator is responsible for database creation and implementation, performance monitoring and tuning, troubleshooting, backup and recovery, and security.
How does it get done?
Configure, install, test and maintain SQL 2012 or higher database and Windows 2012 or higher server including associated software such as security updates and patches. Also, monitor and manage database performance and troubleshoot database problems.
Design and implement database security layers to include user rights, access, and encryption. Establish coding standards and practices for data elements.
Perform database backup on a regularly scheduled basis, and database recovery when required.
Produce and maintain documentation (i. e. data dictionary, Entity Relationship Diagrams)
Who are the customers?
Both internal and external users associated with WCA.
Ideal Candidate
The ideal candidate for this position has experience in the following:
Database administrationAdministering SQL server 2012 or higherSQL scripting, security hardening, and database operations and maintenanceSQL server performance tuning, backup and recovery solutions, perform disaster recovery setupinstalling and configuring both Windows Server 2010 or higher and SQL 2012 or higher, including all required security patches and updates
Minimum Qualification
Associate's degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems (MIS), Information Technology, Engineering or similar technical degree and two (2) years of experience in data analysis, design, storage and security. Substitutions Apply. See Substitution Table below.
Substitution Table

These combinations of education and experience qualify you for the position:

 Education Experience Education Experience

1 High School Diploma or Equivalent AND 4 years of experience OR High School Diploma or Equivalent AND 4 years of experience
2 Associate's degree in the field(s) specified in the minimum qualification AND 2 years of experience Associate's degree or higher in any field AND 4 years of experience
3 Bachelor's degree or higher in the field(s) specified in the minimum qualification AND 0 years of experience

Education and years of experience must be related to the purpose of the position.
If Minimum Qualification requires a specific number of "semester hours" in a field (e.g. 6 semester hours in Accounting), applicants MUST have those semester hours in order to meet the minimum qualifications. No substitutions apply for semester hours.

Employment Requirements
Must possess and maintain a valid New Mexico Driver's License. Must possess and maintain a current Defensive Driving Course Certificate from the State of New Mexico or must pass and receive a Defensive Driving Course Certificate as a condition of continued employment.
Working Conditions

The Public Health Order (on Vaccination) dated August 17, 2021, requires Congregate Care Facility Workers and Hospital Workers to be fully vaccinated.

If you have questions about whether these requirements apply to this specific position, contact the agency contact listed on this advertisement.

Evaluate requirements and recommends available DBMS products

Provide Amazon Web Services (AWS) server administration with a variety of activities that include foundational AWS services (EC2 Compute, EBS, S3, Config)

Your Specific Responsibilities:
This is a high-level technical position within Florida Department of Health\Division of Disability Determinations Information Systems Bureau. This position will be responsible for report planning, design, development, documentation, and implementation supporting Division business community and conforming to Agency standards. The incumbent must translate operational needs into functional reports, which meet the business owner's needs and specifications. The incumbent is responsible for technical project delivery to expectation quotients (functionality, quality, documentation, audit considerations, security considerations, change management and performance dimensions).

Functions as developer in the design, development and implementation of custom Agency application systems. Develops and implements specialized programs, routines and procedures as needed to support Agency applications.

Plan for and manage underlying hardware and software infrastructure to support reporting and application requirements.
Conducts customer meetings to define requirement specifications. Coordinates the analysis and interpretation of customer requirements to define required programming specifications (business solutions). Coordinates development and execution of integration and system testing plans.
Plan and direct work assignments for team members to build effective, functional, and successful solutions following documented technical specifications based on business requirements and Agency best practices of system design. Communicate and work effectively with other Information Systems sections and customers to ensure successful project execution and delivery.

Provide technical assistance and advice to business operations staff, customers and technical staff regarding system support, maintenance and operations.

Develop and provide management status briefings at key project milestones.

Provide various types of assistance to the Systems Bureau Chief as requested.

Confers with SSA and DDD employees to determine information system requirements, define and propose solutions to production systems problems evaluate programs, set priorities and objectives and determine time schedule for development and implementation.

Performs related work as required.

Recommends priorities for systems development.
This position is on call in accordance with applicable rules.

Incumbent may be required to work during and/or beyond normal work hours or days in the event of an emergency. Emergency duty required of the incumbent includes working in special needs or Red Cross shelters, or performing other emergency duties including, but not limited to, responses to or threats involving any disaster or threat of disaster, fabricated or natural.

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Knowledge of Microsoft SQL, PostgreSQL, and graphical report building tools such as Microstrategy.
Knowledge of Microsoft SQL server configuration and administration.
Knowledge of Windows & operating systems.
Knowledge of application development techniques.
Skill in project management programs and practices.
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing.
Ability to write, prepare, and review system, application and user documentation.

Preferred Qualifications:
PREFERRED YEARS’ EXPERIENCE:
Four (4) years’ experience in SQL, graphical reporting tools, and managing underlying infrastructure.

Description
The Senior Database Administrator is responsible for the development and implementation of the SQL Server life cycle as it relates to application needs, working directly with peers, vendors and application developers to create database strategies that support the application and operational needs of customers. In addition, this role also acts as a DBA architect responsible for designing database environments for UH applications including partnering with application vendors and their technology staff to ensure the database environment meets UH and regulatory policies and requirements while supporting application requirements.
Essential Duties:
Performs database system management functions (e.g., software installs, version upgrades and configuration management, security).
Designs, implements and manages complex database cluster environments including data center SQL cluster farms and application cluster farms.
Define database objects and relationships as indicated based on requirements of the application.
Implements business rules via stored procedures, middleware or other technology.
Implements data models, database structure design, database documentation, backup and recovery processes.
Perform assessments and identify, test and resolve moderately complex database performance issues (e.g., monitoring and tuning).
Recommend and/or design and develop monitoring tools and processes for the UH SQL enterprise.
Provides guidance and mentoring to junior administrators and SQL developers in database system management functions (e.g., software installs, version upgrades and configuration management, security) including:
Data transfer/manipulation using linked servers, DTS/SSIS.
Database performance monitoring, optimization and tuning.
Provides guidance and mentoring to junior administrators and SQL developers in assessment and identification, testing and resolving moderately complex database performance issues including database and server alerts and message resolution.
Performs code and index reviews.
Designs and implements SQL Server and other database periphery technologies such as Reporting Services, Notification Services, Analysis Services, and Service Broker.
Works directly with vendors, IT&S leaders and customers to implement database environments that meet regulatory requirements as well as UH security requirements and standards. Ensures database environments are properly installed and implemented and utilize appropriate backup strategies.
Performs moderately complex modification, testing and debugging tasks on vendor supplied utilities and packages to ensure fit with current operating environment.
Leads in the escalation of issues with appropriate internal resources.
Leads the development and maintenance of system documentation.
Performs all technical support of assigned applications.
Reviews and edits system documentation developed within the department for the SQL environment to ensure that client access to product is efficient and meets all regulatory and security requirements.
Works with hospital systems.
Partners with the Project Management Office and participates in all phases of project implementation.
Utilizes and maintains appropriate change control procedures and standards.
Performs on-call duties as required.
Qualifications
Experience & Knowledge:
3+ years experience as a SQL database administrator in an enterprise environment required.
Minimum of 3 years experience with SQL servers and clusters required.
Proficient in the use of current SQL Server technologies required.
Ability to work with Views, Data Dictionaries, Stored procedures, DTS and SSIS packages required.
Experienced in database disaster recovery approaches and technologies required.
Ability to troubleshoot technical problems related to the implementation and processing of database software required.
1+ years experience in IT Healthcare desired.
Proficient with Microsoft .Net programming languages as they relate to Microsoft SQL including C# and VB.Net preferred.
Experience with XML data types, XML parsing and SQL XML functions preferred.
Familiar with the development of monitoring strategies that encompass the entire SQL enterprise preferred.
Experience in SQL Server Replication technologies preferred.
Ability to research and analyze information preferred.
Knowledge of MS Office and MS Visio is required.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong analytical skills with an ability to organize and communicate thoughts clearly.

Special Skills & Equipment Knowledge:
Knowledge of MS Project, RedGate SQL Toolbelt, TSM, Spotlight and PowerShell scripting language are a plus.

Education:
High school diploma or equivalent required.
Bachelor degree in Computer Science/Business Management preferred.

Credentials, Licensure or Certification (i.e. RN, RRT):
Microsoft Certified DBA desired
MCITP Database Administrator desired
Microsoft Certified IT Professional Developer (MCITP) Microsoft SQL Server desired
